email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Cargo Inquiry - Makassar to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Dear Capt. Hu,

We need to discuss more about your cargo details:

1. Is the cargo washed, solvent free or not?
2. What about the cargo condition and appearance?
3. What about the cargo viscosities, oxidation and moisture content?
4. Does the cargo have any other special requirements?
5. Can you provide us with the API gravity of the cargo?
6. Can you provide us with a cargo test report and certificate of origin and delivery?
7. What is the cargo smell like?
8. What is the cargo condition like?
9. What about the cargo color?

Please reply to the above questions.

Regards,
Zoe

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Cargo Inquiry - Makassar to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Hi Zoe,

Please note that we are a transportation company, not a shipper or buyer. We cannot answer cargo specification questions as we only provide shipping services. Please direct cargo-related questions to the actual cargo owner.

Regards,
Peter Wong

email_chain.subject: Berth Congestion Query - Mundra to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Peter,

We have a cargo to ship from Mundra to Long Beach. I do not anticipate any berth congestion in either port, but would you still please confirm that?

Many thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Berth Congestion Query - Mundra to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Hope you are well.

As far as Mundra is concerned, there will be no berth congestion throughout this year.

Regarding Long Beach, container volume is increasing month on month. We've seen improvement in vessel turnaround with 8 ETDs in February compared to 7 in January 2019. While transhipment movement from West Africa & other major US destinations to Long Beach will increase by >10% this year, we expect minimal congestion in Q1 2019. However, starting April, congestion probability is high unless CBP relaxes current regulations affecting dwell times.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Berth Congestion Query - Mundra to Long Beach - Volume Data
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

For your reference, here is the year-over-year volume comparison data for key arrivals:

ID       Type          Volume   Jan 2017   Jan 2018   Difference
TLG327   OFFD ANCHOR   LCL      185        445        +140
TLG062   OFFD ANCHOR   LCL      112        235        +123
TLG188   OFFD ANCHOR   LCL      100        165        +65
CMACTI   OFFD ANCHOR   LCL      151        165        +14

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Berth Congestion Query - Mundra to Long Beach - Terminal Updates
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Please note these important terminal changes:

- All Ship-to-Ship (STS) operations will cease by end of March 2019
- Terminal is prioritizing containers for rail/truck transport, special containers (Transponders, Chilled, Refrigerated), and exports via Ocean Terminal, Pier 400, and LBCT
- Long-term focus is on improving gate out/container return efficiency to handle increased volume

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:
Dear Steve,

I'd like to discuss your shipping requirements and provide a quote. Could you please provide details on:

- Carrier and Charterer requirements
- Ship type preferences
- Feeder line specifications
- Nominated vessel details
- Berth and draft requirements
- Cargo quantity
- Destination port
- Expected arrival time
- Delivery terms
- Payment terms
- Laytime specifications
- Harbor and L/D charges
- Line speed requirements
- Chargeable weight
- Discharge delivery details

As an economist with extensive industry connections, I can ensure you get the best possible arrangements. Looking forward to assisting you with this business.

Best regards,
Charles

Rob

As per our agreement, any claims will be handled between you and the broker, with compensation paid accordingly.

You have two options:

Charles

email_chain.subject: Estate Administration Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Peterson,

I am writing to inquire about assistance with administering an estate. Could you please advise on your firm's probate services?

Best regards,
John Client

email_chain.subject: Re: Estate Administration Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Client,

In the matter of the Estate of [Deceased], I have several questions regarding the will in question:

1. Does the Will meet the legal requirements to be admitted to probate?
2. What assets did the deceased own at the time of death?
3. Are any of those assets not subject to the terms of the Will?
4. What steps are necessary to commence the administration of the Will?
5. What are the tax implications of the administration of the Will?

Please call me at your earliest convenience at (415) 599-2483 or reply to this email. I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Shari Peterson, Esq.

Admitted in the State of California. The State of Oregon does not permit attorneys to practice under the same terms as other states.

email_chain.subject: Re: Estate Administration Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Client,

Thank you for your interest in our firm. We are a small law firm with a strong emphasis on probate law. While our practice areas are focused, we pride ourselves on providing comprehensive representation within our specialties.

As probate is only part of estate administration, we collaborate with other attorneys and accountants when clients require assistance outside our areas of expertise.

I should mention that my colleague, Sarah Thompson, specializes in estate planning, including wills, trusts, and financial planning. Please feel free to contact her directly for any estate planning questions.

Should you have any further questions, please contact me at (415) 599-2483.

Best regards,
Michael Roberts, Esq.

email_chain.subject: Rice Shipment to Matadi - Berth Congestion Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Morris,

We have an enquiry for 13,000MT of rice from Colombo to Matadi. Can you give us a berth congestion forecast and how does your laytime allowance work in case of port delays?

Many thanks,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment to Matadi - Berth Congestion Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

Matadi is currently experiencing high congestion levels. Please note the following:

- Typical waiting time for berth is 2-4 days
- No guaranteed transit time to discharge
- Berth queue is unpredictable as vessels can arrive without prior notice
- Terminal operates up to 2 berths simultaneously
- Berthing priority is assigned by the Terminal based on vessel readiness
- Reserved berth slots may be reassigned if vessel arrival is delayed due to congestion

I recommend factoring these conditions into your laytime calculations.

Best regards,
Sarah Morris

William Lee

email_chain.body:

I need an answer by 20:00 Hong Kong time on the 12th regarding the laycan. This is particularly important as the vessel needs to clear 90,000 tonnes of existing cargo while loading this product.

For space and availability reasons, we need to keep the loading plan as close to the current laycan as possible.

Looking forward to your response within the next day.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window Query - 40KMT Fuel Oil Haldia/Singapore
email_chain.body:

Laycan: 12th Aug/14th Aug

Regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window Query - 40KMT Fuel Oil Haldia/Singapore

Thank you in advance.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window Query - 40KMT Fuel Oil Haldia/Singapore

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Quote Request - Houston to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hello Elena,

The offer is valid only for 3 days. The offer is based on the condition that the cargo is not rejected at final inspection, all the relevant documents (Bill of Lading and other documents) will be sent by email on the day of shipment. We accept no liability for errors in email transmissions and reserve the right to withhold payment in respect of cargo received in less than perfect condition.

Elena, as we discussed, we are going to charge you the full amount in advance. Please transfer $65,000.00 to our account.

I have made some changes to the contract terms. I will send you the updated file for signing.

Best,
Xylo

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Quote Request - Houston to Antwerp

Elena

email_chain.subject: HFO Cargo Inquiry - Panama to Port Qasim
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Habib,

Would you please help arrange for a 100,000MT parcel of HFO to be delivered from the Panama Canal to Port Qasim. What is your LFG rate and expected transit time?

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: HFO Cargo Inquiry - Panama to Port Qasim
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Habib,

The vessel Sun Dragon that we have arranged the charter for to deliver the parcel of oil that you requested has taken on the cargo at the Panama Canal. It is currently waiting for a berth at Port Qasim. Unfortunately, its ship-to-ship transfer hoses were damaged in a recent collision and the ship's owner does not wish to risk using a new or used set of hoses that might fail again. Instead they have ordered a new set of hoses which will take a couple of weeks to deliver and install.

Please let me know if there is any alternative means that we can use to load the cargo and I'll try to make the necessary arrangements to comply with your request.

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: HFO Cargo Inquiry - Panama to Port Qasim
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Habib,

This morning we received confirmation that the shipment can be discharged as scheduled into our own terminal.

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Fresh Fruit Shipment Inquiry - South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Smith,

Our office is arranging a 2,400MT freight of fresh fruit from South Africa to Antwerp, departing next week. Please confirm your earliest available dates and your standard demurrage rate.

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Fresh Fruit Shipment Inquiry - South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

As you are aware, we regularly ship fresh produce from South Africa to Antwerp. We currently have two vessels loading with scheduled departures next week. Should your preferred vessel not be available, we can offer alternatives.

I have attached a charter summary for your reference, including our standard rates as requested.

Additionally, we understand the time-sensitive nature of your cargo. Our office maintains a well-equipped laboratory for testing, and we can arrange for one of our freight inspectors to verify cargo condition in cooperation with our certified biological agency.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Juan Du Preez
Umschlagskontor

email_chain.subject: Re: Fresh Fruit Shipment Inquiry - South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

We confirm receipt of your inquiry regarding vessel availability for December 1st loading. While we are currently at full capacity, the voyage duration is only 21 days, and we expect our southbound vessel to return promptly for potential charter.

Please contact either Mr. Du Preez or myself to discuss this further.

Best regards,
Nicol Kohn
Schiffahrtkontor

email_chain.subject: Re: Fresh Fruit Shipment Inquiry - South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

We regret to inform you that the vessel 'Daanen de Jong' has been detained by USCG in New York. Given the current congestion in Antwerp, we recommend considering an earlier departure.

Unfortunately, our southbound vessel 'Baedeker' has been chartered by our German branch for a US-bound voyage.

The vessel 'Winkelhuis' is loaded and scheduled to depart on December 5th. Our dispatch department is actively seeking temporary alternatives given the urgency. I have attached a chart for your reference.

Please advise on your intentions at your earliest convenience.

Regards,
Nicol Kohn

email_chain.body:

Is it possible to see a preview of the model?

Best regards,
Francisco

email_chain.subject: Gasoil Cargo - Ras Tanura to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Hi Matthew,

We have 32,500MT of gasoil from Ras Tanura to Port Sudan. Is the price good enough for you to load in early June? Please confirm the demurrage terms.

Regards,
Henry

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoil Cargo - Ras Tanura to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Dear Henry,

Yes, the price is good enough. Could you please tell me when we can load the cargo?

Regards,
Matthew

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoil Cargo - Ras Tanura to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Hi Matthew,

The cargo is available from early June, exactly it depends on the buyer. Please discuss with the buyer and let us know when they would like to have it.

Regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoil Cargo - Ras Tanura to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria,

We can load by the 2nd of June.

Regards,
Matthew

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoil Cargo - Ras Tanura to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Dear Matthew,

I am sorry, but the buyer cannot accept the 2nd June because he will be away for a short holiday during that period. Is the 4th June acceptable?

Regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: End-of-year party invitation
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

We're delighted to invite you to our end-of-year party on Friday 22 December 2024 at the ballroom of the Park Plaza County Hall. If you have any questions, or if you can't make it, please reply to this email.

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: End-of-year party invitation
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thank you for inviting me to the end-of-year party on Friday 22 December 2024 at the ballroom of the Park Plaza County Hall. However, I've already got plans and won't be able to attend.

Regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Tanker Charter Request - Algiers to Marseilles
email_chain.body:
Good morning Dr. Beckmann,

We would like to charter a 35,000-ton tanker for 60 days to ship 250,000MT of crude oil from Algiers to Marseilles. Do you have a vessel available?

Best regards,
Amy

email_chain.subject: Re: Tanker Charter Request - Algiers to Marseilles
email_chain.body:
Hi Amy,

I think I could send you the relevant details of the chartering options that might be appropriate for you.

Best wishes,
Sandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Tanker Charter Request - Algiers to Marseilles
email_chain.body:
Dear Sandy,

We need a tanker to move 250,000 tons of crude oil from Algiers to Marseille. We are considering the following options:

(a) time charter for 60 days or
(b) a long term (3 months) contract (one voyage plus option to charter a further 2 voyages).

Are you able to supply a tanker for this purpose?

Best regards,
Amy

email_chain.subject: High Volume Freight & Storage Package Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hello Andy,

I am writing to suggest adding a high volume 2,000-ton freight and storage price package to your current model, including deductibles, commission and profit. Could you please send us your most recent offer?

Regards,
Jennifer

email_chain.subject: Re: High Volume Freight & Storage Package Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hello Andy,

Your offer sounds good to me! Would it be possible to add one week of equipment rental and incorporate that into the deal?

Regards,
Jennifer

email_chain.subject: Re: High Volume Freight & Storage Package Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hello Jennifer,

Ok, here is my final offer:
- Freight: $3,200
- Storage: $1,100
- Deductible: $250

Let me know what you think.

Regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: RoRo Transport Request Turkey to Germany
email_chain.body: Hey! I'd like to book a RoRo truck, 26 meters with 4 axles, for transport from Turkey to Germany. Could you please provide more information about availability and requirements? Thanks, Elio

email_chain.subject: Re: RoRo Transport Request Turkey to Germany
email_chain.body: Hello Elio, We currently have different truck options available, but not exactly what you're requesting. We have RoRo trucks from Holland to South Africa (3 axles), and 16-meter trucks with 3 axles serving Holland-Morocco and Holland-Romania routes. Could you please provide the dimensions of your cargo? This will help us determine if we can accommodate your transport needs.

email_chain.subject: Re: RoRo Transport Request Turkey to Germany
email_chain.body: Thanks! The cargo dimensions are: 9.56m length x 2.5m width x 3.8m height, with an empty weight of 2800 kg. We need to transport a centrifuge system that's too long for a standard 20-foot container. Thank you for your help. Elio

email_chain.subject: Re: RoRo Transport Request Turkey to Germany
email_chain.body: Dear Elio, Unfortunately, we cannot accommodate this transport request. The centrifuge system's total weight of 35,000 kg exceeds our equipment capabilities. Our 3-axle trucks have a maximum capacity of 28 tons, and while a 4-axle truck would be needed for your 36-ton load, we don't currently have 40-ton capacity vehicles in our fleet. I apologize we couldn't be of more assistance. Please let us know if you need any other information.

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Port Lagos to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Jones,

We are in need of a vessel for 7,000MT of refined crude oil from Port Lagos, Nigeria to Mina Al Ahmadi. We are happy to discuss lumpsum deals and would be interested in your availability from 19 October to 2 November.

Regards,
Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Port Lagos to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Anders,

Thanks for your mail, we are happy to discuss lumpsum deals. Our vessel, the MV Khaleej is currently on charter in Galveston, Texas. We could ship 7,000MT of refined crude oil for an FOB price of USD 55 million from Port Lagos. There are only two conditions:

- The charter rate must be USD 120,000/day. The vessel's average speed is 14.6 knots and it would take about 11 days for the voyage.
- Your agents in Galveston can make all arrangements for the charter. Please find attached our CV.

Regards,
Mr. Jimmie Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Port Lagos to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Hi Jimmie,

Could you clarify how long you need the charter for? What is the estimated voyage time, taking into account weather conditions? Also, could you provide your company profile?

Regards,
Anders

email_chain.subject: PET Shipment Inquiry - Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Good day,

We are seeking to transport 50 tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore, with a loading date of 11th December. Could you please provide the airfreight and insurance costs for this shipment?

Best regards,
Chuck

email_chain.subject: Re: PET Shipment Inquiry - Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Chuck,

Thank you for your inquiry. I will need some time to calculate the airfreight and insurance costs accurately. I should be able to get back to you within two days with a comprehensive quote.

Best regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: PET Shipment Inquiry - Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Good day Chris,

I understand the rates should be approximately $4,000 per ton for airfreight and $1,000 per ton for insurance. Can you confirm if these rates are correct and if you have capacity for 50 tons on December 11th?

Please provide the total price including both airfreight and insurance costs.

Best regards,
Chuck

email_chain.subject: Re: PET Shipment Inquiry - Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Chuck,

I notice something unusual about the rates you've mentioned. The insurance cost seems disproportionately high compared to the airfreight cost. Could you clarify where you obtained these rates? This would help me better understand and verify the pricing.

Best regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Gasoline Cargo - Jubail Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

We can load the gasoline at Jubail on April 15th. Please advise on your voyage charter terms requirements.

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoline Cargo - Jubail Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Ford,

I have noted your early availability and am trying to gauge market interest for gasoline from Jubail at this time. Could you please quote your freight rate?

Regards,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoline Cargo - Jubail Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

We can deliver the gasoline on a 35-day FOB basis. For voyage charter terms, we can quote USD 3,000-3,200 per MT FOB Rotterdam.

I await your response.

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoline Cargo - Jubail Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear James,

We would like to confirm the price for 80,000 MT of gasoline at USD 7,000 per MT CIF Rotterdam. Please confirm your availability. We can discuss freight and voyage charter details once you confirm the price. My colleague is awaiting your confirmation.

Regards,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoline Cargo - Jubail Loading
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

We understand your position regarding FOB Rotterdam. We can accommodate loading in 35 days under voyage charter terms. However, our principal would prefer a 25-day FOB basis at USD 7,000 per MT. We can offer CIF Rotterdam with no increase in freight. Payment would be by letter of credit. We have noted the April 15th availability requirement.

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Chan,

Could you please let me know if you have any availability for shipments? We have 11,100 MT of corn oil, with open delivery and payment terms in Shanghai.

Best regards,
Albertina Silva

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Ms. Chang,

We have space for 11,100MT of corn oil from Puerto Alegre to Shanghai. Our earliest date of lifting is on the 20th, and your open vessel has an ETA of the 26th. The freight rate is 22.5% and we are charging in USD from our Taiwan account.

Hope to hear from you soon,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Conditions Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Daniel,

Would you please clarify how we can load corn oil in our barge under condition of open delivery & open payment? Please send us your commercial terms.

Regards,
Wayne

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Chan,

We would like to know what was the final agreement. We have availability for 16,000MT of Corn Oil for your needs in USD and payment in Shanghai for shipment 20th of this month to 3rd of next month from Argentina.

Best Regards,
Marta Maffei

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Carl Chan,

About your message, we would like to know what was the final agreement. We have availability for 18,000 MT of corn oil for your needs in USD, open payment in Shanghai from Puerto Alegre to Shanghai.

Best regards,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Moving 50,000L of transformer oil from Dunkirk to Ancona
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Helmen,

We have an urgent requirement to move 50,000L of transformer oil from Dunkirk to Ancona, within two days. Could you provide me a rate on a Danish flag vessel? What are your payment terms, if any?

Regards,
Tim

email_chain.subject: Re: Moving 50,000L of transformer oil from Dunkirk to Ancona
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer a 2007-built vessel, sister ship to our regular fleet, with the following specifications:
- Length: 72.00m
- Beam: 13.30m
- Draft: 5.00m
- Speed: 14.5 knots

Please let me know if you would like to proceed with a formal quote.

Best regards,
Johan Helmen

email_chain.subject: Cargo Consolidation Opportunity - UK/Benelux/Germany to Mexico
email_chain.body:
Hey Edd,

Could you please tell me if there is any cargo we can consolidate for you out of London next week? We are looking for cargoes from UK, Benelux and Germany into Mexico, and our options would be the following vessels: Cap Othello at 11,000 metric tonnes and two feeder vessels at 4,000 metric tonnes each.

Let me know if there is any possibility of consolidation.

Cheers,
Ariel

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Consolidation Opportunity - UK/Benelux/Germany to Mexico
email_chain.body:
Hi Ariel,

There's a cargo available in Rotterdam for your feeder vessel. 20 metric tonnes of carbon steel coils. The cargo will originate in Romania, and is available for loading starting tomorrow. Please advise the dwt of your feeder vessel as well as your rates so I can get back to you.

Thank you,
Edd

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Consolidation Opportunity - UK/Benelux/Germany to Mexico
email_chain.body:
Hi Edd,

Please provide a full offer including an ETB for our load in Rotterdam on 11 January 2018.

Cheers,
Ariel

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Consolidation Opportunity - UK/Benelux/Germany to Mexico
email_chain.body:
Dear Ariel,

Thank you for your email. Please find enclosed full offer details for your attention.

Quantity: 20 metric tonnes of carbon steel coils

We look forward to working with you in the future.

Yours faithfully,
Amber

email_chain.subject: LPG Freight Rate Request - Buenos Aires to Okinawa
email_chain.body:

Do you have rates for 100,000 MT of LPG from Buenos Aires to Okinawa? Our carrier has run into a congestion issue and is unable to transport our cargo at this time.

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Freight Rate Request - Buenos Aires to Okinawa

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Freight Rate Request - Buenos Aires to Okinawa
email_chain.body:
Ryan,

I know I have a few emails floating in your inbox. Please advise regarding your response to my rate request.

Thanks,

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Freight Rate Request - Buenos Aires to Okinawa
email_chain.body:

Best,

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Freight Rate Request - Buenos Aires to Okinawa
email_chain.body:

I sent the email again, can you check your spam?

email_chain.subject: Rate Request - Grain Cargo Tampa to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Hey Jay,

Could you give me an estimated rate for a cargo of 7,000MT of grain from Tampa to Gibraltar, on an FOB basis? Could you please include CIF and DAP options in the email, and let me know which insurance you use.

Thanks,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Grain Cargo Tampa to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the quote.

The cargo is a bulk cargo, and we will need the vessel to be equipped with hatch covers for weather protection. Can you give me a rate for a 14,000MT cargo of foodstuffs from Tampa to Gibraltar?

I will be sending you an LOC (Letter of Credit) within the next 2-3 weeks. Could you please let me know your line of insurance.

Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Grain Cargo Tampa to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Could you please give me your estimated rate for 14,000MT of foodstuffs from Tampa to Gibraltar. Will need hatch covers to be fitted, cargo will be bulk, and a shipment of FCL containers must also be included.

Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Grain Cargo Tampa to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Dear Phil,

We would like to offer you 28 USD per metric ton.

Kind regards,
Nada

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Grain Cargo Tampa to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the quote.

Could you please let me know which insurance you use, as we will be receiving an LOC.

Thanks,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Grain Cargo Tampa to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Dear Phil,

We use Zurich Financial Services.

Kind regards,
Nada

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Montevideo to Isla Margarita
email_chain.body:
Afternoon Mr. Saeed,

We have a 5,000MT parcel of equipment to move from Montevideo to Isla Margarita. Could you please send a freight quote for this shipment?

Regards,
Lacey

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Montevideo to Isla Margarita
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

Good afternoon to you. We have received your request through Peter regarding this move and are currently working on the quotation.

Please note there might be a slight delay due to a local holiday, but we will provide you with the best solution for your cargo as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Montevideo to Isla Margarita
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

I'm following up regarding the shipment from Montevideo to the Vargas Free Zone (Isla Margarita, Venezuela). We've identified that your current freight forwarder is utilizing passenger vessels at premium rates.

We can offer an alternative solution using the MS Francy, which typically operates between Brazil and Venezuela. The vessel was recently chartered by a Dubai-based tour operator who has partnered with us for logistics support.

I've attached the detailed quotation for your review.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Updated Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

Regarding yesterday's quotation, I wanted to provide additional details. The voyage is scheduled to depart on July 22nd with an estimated arrival on July 25th in Isla Margarita. We recommend using 20' pallets rather than containers to optimize costs. The Dubai operator will contact you directly with additional details.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Revised Schedule and Options
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

I need to inform you that the previously mentioned voyage is now fully booked. However, we've arranged an alternative cargo vessel departing from Valparaiso on July 24th, arriving in Isla Margarita on July 27th. 

We recommend using either 20' flat racks (pallets) for deck loading or truck transport in the vessel's hold, which would be the most cost-effective solution for your cargo.

Please let me know if you'd like a quote for this new arrangement.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Charter Request - Paper Cargo Cork to Chester
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Ms. Kirila,

We're looking for a charter vessel to transport 1,500MT of paper from Cork to Chester. What is the estimated charter cost, and are your fuel prices included?

Best regards,
Derek

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request - Paper Cargo Cork to Chester
email_chain.body:
Hi Derek,

Regarding your request for transportation of paper from Cork to Chester, I've arranged for our sales manager in Chester, Johan Karwowski, to contact you on Monday. Our sales managers can give you a more accurate quote including fuel costs, as fuel prices vary from week to week.

Best regards,
Ms. Kirila

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request - Paper Cargo Cork to Chester
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kirila,

We've completed all export and insurance paperwork required for shipping 1,500MT of paper from Cork to Chester. Could you please let me know what the full cost will be (including VAT) for your company to transport the cargo and provide a quote for insurance.

Kind regards,
Derek

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request - Paper Cargo Cork to Chester
email_chain.body:
Hello Derek,

I see that your company has insurance of £10,000,000. However, there is a clause in our contract stating that our company cannot be held liable for any accidents or damages. Could you please provide proof that your company has the correct insurance?

Thank you,
Ms. Kirila

email_chain.subject: Potassium Hydroxide Shipment Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Mr. Lo,

We will ship 3,500MT of potassium hydroxide from Yantai to Tianjin before end of next month. Would you provide a preliminary quote and confirm if you handle port dues under FOB terms?

Regards,
Elaine

email_chain.subject: Re: Potassium Hydroxide Shipment Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Elaine,

We can offer FOB, CNF, and CIF terms. Under CNF and CIF terms, we will cover port dues and insurance. For FOB terms, we require the original bill of lading to be sent to our freight forwarder before month-end.

Please let me know your preferred terms so I can provide a detailed quote.

Best regards,
Debatoy Lo
Rich Potash Trading Co., Ltd

email_chain.subject: Re: Potassium Hydroxide Shipment Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lo,

Could you clarify which South China ports you can ship from? We typically receive cargo through Xiamen or Nansha ports.

Best regards,
Elaine

email_chain.subject: Re: Potassium Hydroxide Shipment Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Elaine,

We can arrange shipment through either Xiamen or Nansha. The goods will be ready for shipment by the end of September. Please confirm your preferred port so we can proceed with the arrangements.

For additional information about our products, you can visit our websites: www.richpotash.com and www.chinaopticalpotash.com

Best regards,
Debatoy Lo

email_chain.subject: APU6000 Series Quotation Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Chen,

We are interested in sourcing the APU6000 series components. While reviewing market conditions, I noticed silicon commodity prices are currently around $62/unit. Could you please provide us with your latest quotation for this series?

We look forward to your prompt response.

Best regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: Re: APU6000 Series Quotation Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Helen,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the APU6000 series.

To provide an accurate quotation, please clarify the following:

1. Specific product specifications for the APU6000-125W
2. Preferred chip encapsulation materials
3. Minimum order quantity and desired delivery schedule

Once we receive these details, we can provide you with a comprehensive quotation.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Alan

email_chain.subject: Re: Estate Handover Meeting
email_chain.body:
Dear Maggie,

Thank you for the invitation. I hope I have understood this correctly. It appears that the Chair of the General Board has given us the go-ahead to carry out our plan and I am now responsible for the handover of the estate. As I mentioned in our telephone conversation, I am going to seek a meeting with the Board before I do anything else.

Kindest regards,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Estate Handover Meeting
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Daniel,

Thank you for your confirmation to help with the handover of Mr. Green's estate. I will be delighted to meet with you on Thursday at 10 am in our office. We have a canteen here if you would like a light lunch.

Regards,
Maggie

email_chain.subject: Re: Estate Handover Meeting
email_chain.body:
Hello,

I'm in London but will be in Cambridge on Thursday next week and can meet with you then, if that's convenient. I suggest that we meet in the Library at Great St. Mary's Church. It is very close to the University Offices and has some quiet rooms which are usually available during the morning and can be used to avoid interruption.

Kind regards,
Walter

email_chain.subject: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Smith,

We're looking to arrange the transportation of 7,000MT of soybean from Tampa to Tokyo in early May. We're hoping to secure a good rate, and will appreciate your input.

Thanks,
Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmine,

Hope you're having a great day.

Please find our rates to Tokyo attached. We can advise more on the best port to ship from, once we know the quantity and port of origin.

Looking forward to hearing back from you,

Regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

Thank you for the rates! We'd like to ship from Houston. What do you think of this option?

Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hello Yasmine,

Thank you for your patience. I've attached our new rates for Houston, can you please let me know if this works for you?

Regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

That's perfect, thanks for the prompt response! We'll be shipping 5,000MT to Tokyo in early May from Houston. Let me know if there's anything else we need to do to finalize the booking.

Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmine,

Great news, we've received your booking request. We'll get back to you once we've confirmed the details.

Thanks,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Tampa to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

Thanks for confirming our booking. Here's the confirmation number for your records: 12345. I've also attached a copy of the contract. Please review and let us know if there's anything that needs to be addressed.

Best regards,
Yasmine

email_chain.subject: Vessel availability to Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Mr. Gupta,

Would your vessel have a BIBL to a port in Vietnam? Also, what are your rates?

Warm regards,
Richard

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel availability to Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Richard,

It has always been my pleasure to assist you. I am pleased to advise that from your proposed origin in Hong Kong, we can offer vessel coverage on April 12th with transshipment at either Shenzhen or Zhuhai. This is subject to booking confirmation and cargo handover at the transshipment port. The rate will be provided upon confirmation of the routing, excluding handling costs at Shenzhen or Zhuhai port.

Best regards,
Samuel Xu

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel availability to Vietnam
email_chain.body: Are you going to add 250USD as a 'shipping cost' as well? Or is it included in your quote?

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel availability to Vietnam
email_chain.body: To clarify: I want to ask if you are planning to charge 250USD for the cost of handling the cargo at either Shenzhen or Zhuhai? If so, please include that in your quote.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel availability to Vietnam
email_chain.body: The cost for handling at both places is 250 USD. You can find this included in the calculation.

email_chain.subject: Sample of isopropanol 99.9% for our customer in USA
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We are manufacture of petroleum products. We have a customer in USA that require 4800MT isopropanol 99.9% from Houston. We are ready to negotiate your best price, however, we must have your bank account details before we proceed.

Regards,
Mahesh Nambiar

email_chain.subject: Isopropanol quote for Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. John,

Could you please give a freight quote for loading 4,800MT of isopropanol from Houston to Cartagena?

Regards,
Markus

email_chain.subject: Isopropanol quote for Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:
Hi Mahesh,

Please see below quote from us as requested.

Your shipment requirements are as below:
Loading: 4800MT Isopropanol 99.9%
FOB Price: 0.44USD/MT
Origin: Houston
Port of Destination: Cartagena
Payment: TT advance 20% and balance against copy of B/L upon arrival.

If you could provide your Bank details I will issue an Invoice on your name for advance payment.

Regards,
John (Eriq) Xu

email_chain.subject: RE: Isopropanol quote for Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:
Hi Markus,

I would like to have your assistance on this matter.

I have been in communication with an agent in Cartagena and he had informed me that isopropanol is extremely dangerous to transport and he is trying to deter us. He had offered an alternative product for the price you had provided.

The supplier is directly from the US and I think there is no reason for any third party to be involved in the transaction.

To be honest with you, the suppliers are not even prepared to sell the product at the prices you had quoted. For this reason, I don't think we will be able to do business with you and appreciate if you will be kind enough to refund the advance payment of 1,200USD.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

Best Regards,
Mahesh Nambiar

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Urea Dalian/Eregli
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Cohn,

Could you assist with a suitable vessel for 10,000MT of urea from Dalian to Eregli? We can ship by the end of January, and would appreciate your preferred freight rate for that cargo.

Many thanks,
Amelia

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Urea Dalian/Eregli
email_chain.body:
Hi Amelia,

From Mr. Huang:
Please assist us with your proposed freight rate for urea from Dalian to Eregli. Our vessel is available for loading at the end of January, so we are seeking the soonest availability on your charters.

Many thanks,
Harvey

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Urea Dalian/Eregli
email_chain.body:
Hi Harvey,

The vessels we have available for late January are:
- Monte Mediolana
- Monte Rascal
- Monte Apollinare

And the rate for urea on any of them would be $7.10 pmt.

Many thanks,
Mary

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Urea Dalian/Eregli

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Damietta to Karachi

Li

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Damietta to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Dear Jenny,

We have the following inquiries regarding the freight:

1) What documents are required for customs?
2) Is FOB possible? If so, what are the costs?
3) Who will be responsible for loading? Do you need a representative?
4) What are the demurrage costs? Is advance payment required?
5) Does demurrage need to be settled within the terminal?
6) Is freight payment required in advance?
7) Do you provide storage?

Thanks,
Li

We regularly handle bulk cargo shipments on this route and would be happy to provide a quote. I'll review the current rates and get back to you shortly with a detailed proposal.

Best regards,
James Gould

Nippon Steel Corporation

email_chain.subject: Cement Transport Query
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Jang,

Please check if we can transport 1,400 tonnes of cement from Ashdod to Bombay. What is the base FOB rate for this shipment?

Kind regards,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Cement Transport Query
email_chain.body:
Hey Matt,

We can do 100,000 tonnes a year for you if you agree on an annual contract. The best rate will be $60 per tonne plus $5 in extra charges. This special rate is available because the port authority in Israel offers us a discount for shipping volumes of 100,000 tonnes or more annually.

We also offer shipping insurance at $3 per tonne. A security deposit of $20,000 would be required before commencing shipments. As this is FOB, you will be responsible for all charges related to moving the cement from the terminal to your desired location.

Let me know if you're interested, and I can prepare the necessary documentation for your signature.

Yours truly,
Ha

email_chain.subject: Waste Plastic Film Shipment - Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Scott,

We have a 5,000MT shipment of waste plastic film from Fuzhou to Tianjin that will be finished by July 28. What is the best lead time you can offer, and will you be able to cover our last two shipments for $2,500?

Regards,
Annabelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Waste Plastic Film Shipment - Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Annabelle,

Thank you for your email. We have storage tanks and packing equipment available to accept your 5,000MT shipment of waste plastic film starting July 28. The lead time will be approximately four days for completing the tanking process.

We can handle the loading, stuffing, and lashing, while you will be responsible for fixing and sealing the hatch. Please confirm if the cargo will be using hatch cover or double-containerization so we can prepare accordingly.

Regarding the $2,500 rate for the last two shipments, we cannot accept this condition as terminal handling fees and port storage costs are included in the quoted price. We would need to discuss a rate adjustment.

Best regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Waste Plastic Film Shipment - Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Scarlett,

The cargo will be using hatch cover. The cargo from our past three shipments will arrive in Tianjin tomorrow. We expect the same quality as before. Please have the cargo loaded as soon as possible and arrange for delivery to our designated terminal before August 15. If everything goes as expected, we will make arrangements for the second shipment.

Best regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Waste Plastic Film Shipment - Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Annabelle,

10 tons of cargo were loaded yesterday, but we still have remaining cargo. Please note that our available forklifts can only lift a maximum of 10 tons at a time. We currently have limited space due to ongoing building works, which affects truck maneuverability around the storage tanks.

Please advise the final loading date required for our storage tanks. We expect the cargo to maintain good condition and hope the terminal waiting time won't affect your schedule.

Regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Waste Plastic Film Shipment - Fuzhou to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Annabelle,

Please be advised that the cargo was delivered at 10 a.m. this morning. Our team will monitor the cargo continuously and keep you updated about any movements. We will notify you if we need to deliver the cargo ahead of schedule.

We look forward to our continued business relationship.

Regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Seablue Grounding Impact Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Kathy,

Has the grounding of the Seablue had any impact on your crude fixing level for the short term?

Thanks,
Blayney

email_chain.subject: Re: Seablue Grounding Impact Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Blayney,

Not at all. Seablue is a crude vessel and almost all crude cargoes have been fixed by the other time-chartered tankers coming out of Chinese yards.

As I mentioned previously, if Seablue did not come out in China, other tankers would come out of the dock and China would be fixed. These tankers would operate at a price level set by the most competitive time charter tanker which is the drydocked Seablue, and therefore the price level at which China is fixed would not be different even if Seablue was out of the drydock.

LPG cargoes are different since we cannot use LPG in the crude tankers, and crude cargoes are not as easy to fix as LPG, since many producers are contracted and certain prices are set.

Regards,
Kathy

email_chain.subject: Re: Seablue Grounding Impact Query
email_chain.body:

We are starting to use one of our new internal chat systems and will not have emails automatically sent to our inbox. Best Regards,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Gasoline Shipment Inquiry - Transaction Details
email_chain.body:

I am prepared to wire you $100,000 towards the transaction on condition that you forward the other $300,000 (and the shipping documents) within 10 days of receiving this deposit.

I understand that this is a small amount relative to the transaction, but I am sending you this deposit on the condition that it will be returned within 14 days if you are not able to complete the transaction.

Raymond

email_chain.body:

Managing Director
World Holdings

Raymond

email_chain.body:

Raymond

email_chain.body:

I hope you are doing well. Could you highlight any particular agreements or notable outcomes from the recent G20 meeting regarding financial regulation? Additionally, I'm interested in your assessment of whether the G20's recommendations will adequately address the discussed issues.

Your insights would be valuable for my research paper.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Re: G20 Meeting Results Query
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are well. I'm writing to better understand the G20's role in financial regulation. As I understand it, the G20 comprises the world's leading economies that collaborate on global financial system guidelines.

Specifically, what role does the G20 play in promoting financial stability? Are there particular regulations or guidelines established to prevent future financial crises? I'm especially interested in their approach to promoting transparency and accountability in the global financial system.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cooper,

I was wondering if you could assist me by answering a few questions about your operations:

1. What does the above schedule imply for transit times?
2. How many times per year can you load at New York?
3. Can you accept transshipments of grain from Europe (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany)?
4. How many times per year can you transship to Vladivostok from Europe?
5. What do your services entail?
6. Can you store bulk products in your vessels?

8. What is your exact transshipment capability?

I appreciate your help!

Best regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Marina,

Sorry for the delay. Here are the answers to your questions:

1. Transit time is approximately 4 weeks. We handle bulk containers (20 feet and 40 feet) and can accommodate shipments from 15,000 tons per trip.

2. We can accept transshipment of grain from European ports. Service frequency is every two weeks from Europe (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany) with transshipment to Vladivostok once per month. You can also arrange grain shipments from these ports for transshipment in the United States.

3. Our services include transshipment of grain from both the United States and Europe to Vladivostok.

Best regards,
Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Marina,

To complete my previous response:

4. We do not have terminals in New York or Vladivostok.
5. We have been providing this service for more than 5 years.
6. We can store grains in our vessels.
7. Our total transshipment capability is 70,000 tons.
8. We currently have 6,000 tons of grain in our inventory in the United States.

Kind regards,
Cooper

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Copenhagen to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Woo,

Could you please provide a 7-day freight estimate for 25,000MT of oil from Copenhagen to Lagos?

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Copenhagen to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

25,000 tons of oil from Copenhagen to Lagos in a seven-day freight? That's quite a bit of oil. I assume you need to ship it by sea.

You see, the oil trade operates on a just-in-time inventory management model, whereby oil is shipped to tankers as needed. This provides a stable supply and demand, eliminates inventory storage costs and prevents oil from degrading over time.

Since your request involves shipping 25,000 tons of oil in seven days, my freight quote estimate would exceed what is available.

Please confirm that your request is for 25,000 tons of oil in a seven-day freight and I can provide a quote to the maximum that is available to my company.

Thanks,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Copenhagen to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

Yes, my request is for 25,000 tons for shipping in seven days to Lagos in Nigeria. Could you please provide a quote?

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Copenhagen to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

Again, shipping 25,000 tons in seven days is an unusual request. If you are shipping this amount of oil in an outbound tanker, then the only companies capable of doing so are Shell, Chevron and Exxon. I don't have contacts with these companies.

If you're shipping by sea, then you'll need a port in Copenhagen to load onto a tanker. I've emailed my contacts in the seaport of Copenhagen. They'll be in touch with me in the morning.

If you're shipping by road, then the quantity would need to be in 45 liter plastic oil drums. The storage space and legal limitations of this option would be impossible to organize in such a short time frame.

I'm sorry, but I simply don't have the resources to fill your request. I recommend you submit your request to one of the three large oil companies I mentioned before.

Regards,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Copenhagen to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

I am absolutely okay with you contacting the seaport in Copenhagen. I understand that you don't have the resources to fulfill my request. I will be submitting my request to an oil company.

Thank you for your assistance,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Rate Request - Oil Seed Cake SPB/Seoul 7,500MT
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Lewis,

Can you confirm rates for 7,500MT of oil seed cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul? Please include details on length of laycan and any additional costs associated with accelerated discharge.

Regards,
Katherine

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Oil Seed Cake SPB/Seoul 7,500MT
email_chain.body:
Hi Katherine,

The following rates apply:

- Spot: $50 per mt over 20% IFM + 30/5/20 (laycan 7-10 days)
- Extended: $40 per mt over 20% IFM + 30/10/20 (laycan 10-14 days)
- Longer: $30 per mt over 20% IFM + 30/15/20 (laycan 14-21 days)

Fixed delay rate (FDR) applies as follows:
- $5 per day for the first 7 days
- $10 per day thereafter
(Example: if vessel delayed 8 days, FDR is $70 - ($5x7) + ($10x1))

Best regards,
James Lewis

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Oil Seed Cake SPB/Seoul 7,500MT
email_chain.body:
Hello Katherine,

Additional important information regarding your inquiry:

1. Accelerated discharge charges for +35 days cargo will be paid by Seller and are not included in the above rates.

2. Due to the busy season, vessel availability is limited during April-May 2023. We have several vessels that could be offered at these rates, but they are currently engaged in previous trades. We would require 20-30 days notice to arrange a ballast leg after their return to Russia.

I recommend booking soon if these terms work for you.

Best regards,
James Lewis

email_chain.subject: Montevideo Timber Installation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hello Min,

How flexible are you on the nailing and lashing requirements for the timber installation at Montevideo?

Thanks,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Montevideo Timber Installation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

Regarding Montevideo, we can be flexible on the installation methods as long as we meet the church history museum's requirements. They are constructing a rock wall with hand-hewn timber base inside the museum, where two of our timbers will be hung using chains. The nailing specifications for these timbers must be strictly followed for the display setup.

The museum has requested that the side facing the rock wall be treated with a protective coating of their choosing for display purposes.

Best regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: Re: Montevideo Timber Installation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Min,

We're planning to transport the timber to Denmark. Should we arrange shipping or transport them across Europe by truck?

Your advice would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Montevideo Timber Installation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Dear Bob,

We recommend you bring the timbers personally. I've attached our current brochure with prices and descriptions, plus a payment form for your reference.

One timber can be shipped via FedEx at approximately 1,000 Danish Krone. We also have display materials available, and our representative in Denmark has some additional recommendations.

Please let us know if you're interested in the display materials.

Best regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: Pre-print draft - Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Dear colleagues,

I've completed the initial draft of our joint paper on the proofs of Voiculescu's theorems 4.1 and 5.1 in the context of non self-adjoint operator algebras. I believe we've successfully addressed the gaps in the original proofs.

Please review and let me know if you have any suggestions before I submit to Annales Polonici Mathematici.

Best regards,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-print draft - Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Denis,

I've reviewed the manuscript and support submitting it to Ann. Pol. Math. The treatment of relative freeness is particularly well-developed.

One minor suggestion: we might want to elaborate more on the transferral principle in section 5.

Regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Submission Received - Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Cavenagh,

We confirm receipt of your manuscript 'Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness and Voiculescu's Transferral Principle' for consideration in Annales Polonici Mathematici.

The paper has been assigned for review. You can track its status through our online system after registration.

Best regards,
Editorial Office
Annales Polonici Mathematici

email_chain.subject: Re: Submission Received - Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Colleagues,

The paper has been submitted and is now under review. I've uploaded the latest version (May 13, 2019) to the preprint server.

I'll keep you informed of any developments from the reviewers.

Best regards,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment Inquiry - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

Looking to move 5.8KMT of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male. Can you advise how the refrigeration is done in the holds?

Cheers,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment Inquiry - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The refrigeration is done by ventilation - the holds are ventilated by a system that draws air through ice-cold seawater. This air maintains the cargo at the required temperature. We don't have traditional refrigeration in our vessel holds, but we do have specialized rooms for bulk goods packaging.

We could accommodate the PKE in these rooms, likely requiring one or two compartments. The loading rate would be 7-8t per hour, with a maximum weight limit of 1,500kg per unit.

To protect the PKE during loading, we've implemented special handling procedures. The product must be properly sealed after loading, and we recommend specific sealing materials for this purpose. We can provide samples if needed.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment Inquiry - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

That sounds good. I can arrange the product to arrive in 20ft containers. The dimensions are as follows:

Largest unit: 140cm x 75cm x 37cm
Maximum weight: 1,270kgs
Total requirement: 5 containers

I can arrange the sealing material, but could you please confirm the dimensions of the rooms you have in mind?

Thanks again,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment Inquiry - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The rooms measure 8.5m x 2.9m with 2.8m height, which should be sufficient for your needs. Container transport is indeed the optimal solution, and we're equipped to handle ISO containers.

We can also offer trucking services from Port Klang if needed, using our own vehicles.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director
Kleine Business Consultancy
Maritima Massey Building
41 Massey Road
Sandton 2196
Johannesburg
Tel: +27 (11) 684-3387
Mobile: +27 (83) 322-5294
Email: kleine@net

email_chain.body:

- General Average
- Warranties

email_chain.subject: Pre-Halloween Digital Rights Update
email_chain.body:
Team,

I wanted to share some important updates regarding our ongoing research into post-9/11 censorship and digital rights. We're compiling resources for an upcoming report.

Please review the materials at:
https://www.eff.org/overview

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-Halloween Digital Rights Update
email_chain.body:
I've reviewed the materials and want to note that nothing has been altered in our archives. This research will be valuable for those studying the evolution of digital rights during this period.

For additional context, please see our full report at:
https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2013/11/post-9-11-censorship-post-9-11-censorship-and-right-know

The National COPP.COM Defense Fund maintains related documentation at:
http://copp.com

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-Halloween Digital Rights Update
email_chain.body: As someone who was on the front lines of the early Web, I can provide firsthand perspective on these developments.

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-Halloween Digital Rights Update
email_chain.body: This aligns with what our reporters have been documenting through direct interviews with early internet pioneers and digital rights advocates.

email_chain.body:
Dear Kadir,

• Vessel capacity: 5000mt open hatch up to 7,000mts
• Duration: 1 month spot charter
• Delivery: 15 days window between 23rd and 30th of October
• Cargo type: bulk or container
• Charter party: BIMCO
• Redelivery period: 1 month (28th November – 28th December)

Available dates:
October: 23, 24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 30
November: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 14

Best regards,
Miguel Lopez

email_chain.subject: Sugar Shipment - Durban to Jakarta - Demurrage Query

Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment - Durban to Jakarta - Demurrage Query
email_chain.body:
For another seller we're considering for Jakarta, they have a bigger bag size (see attached). The quality looks the same though. Is this all right for the end customer?

All the best,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment - Durban to Jakarta - Demurrage Query
email_chain.body:
Thanks for confirming the demurrage rate.

Some further questions for you:
Are you planning to deliver to ports in South Sumatra as well? What would the cost be for trucks into Palembang?

And do you know who is currently running the factory on the Kertosono Estate? If it's restarted, would it have a competitive price?

Thanks,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Indonesian Ports - Demurrage Rates Request
email_chain.body:
We have a few large transactions on the agenda for Indonesia and need to find out the demurrage rates for the ports we are considering for delivery. They are:

* Pelabuhan Umum Tanjung Priok
* Pelabuhan International
* Batamindo Batu Besi Port (near Batam Airport)
* Pelabuhan Internasional Tanjung Priok, Teluk Gadung, Bekasi

For these ports, please could you confirm the following information for each:

* Current monthly demurrage rate per twenty foot container
* Average waiting time at each port (how long is the waiting queue? If there are waiting lists, do we need to be on it to secure our port slot?)
* Trucks into Palembang or Jambi - distance/cost

Thank you,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Indonesian Ports - Demurrage Rates Request
email_chain.body:
Thanks so much for your fast response. That's very helpful.

Holly

email_chain.subject: Technical Assistance Request - Shoe Durability Issues
email_chain.body:
Dear Technical Support Team,

I'm looking for some help, and I was hoping you could point me in the right direction.

I work for OrthoComfort Manufacturing, and we've been getting a lot of complaints about our orthopedic shoes falling apart. It seems to happen whenever a patient uses our shoes to do a heavy activity, like basketball or soccer.

Our shoes are made with the same materials as the other brands that are out there, so I don't understand why our shoes would be falling apart faster. I'm wondering if there's something wrong with our manufacturing process, or if there's some other reason that our shoes would be breaking more easily.

Can you help me out?

Many thanks,
Jim Peterson
Quality Control Manager
OrthoComfort Manufacturing

email_chain.subject: Timber Transport Query - Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

How much does it cost to transport 20,000MT of timber from Skopje to Suez, and what is your earliest possible departure date?

Thanks,
Farouk

email_chain.subject: Re: Timber Transport Query - Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:
Dear Farouk,

Thank you for your query. The cost to transport the timber from Skopje to Suez is approximately €3,040 ($4,227), with an estimated arrival date of April 5th. Please note that these figures are based on market conditions and are subject to change.

We appreciate your interest in our services, and we look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Timber Transport Query - Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Vessel Charter Request - 2,500MT Cargo Vessel
email_chain.body:

We are looking to charter a 2,500MT cargo vessel for 45 days. Please send us your availabilities, all-in costs, terms and conditions.

Thanks,
Enzo

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Charter Request - 2,500MT Cargo Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Enzo,

I have arranged for the vessel in question, ORIFLAMM, to make a call at Bimini next week so that you may arrange a survey of the vessel.

Her current schedule is as follows:
Week 1: Load cargo in Houston, load fuel in New Orleans, voyage to Cuxhaven
Week 2: Load cargo in Cuxhaven, voyage to Halifax, load more cargo in Halifax, voyage to Boston, offload cargo in Boston

She will then proceed to Bimini where the survey may be arranged.

I'll be in contact with you soon to arrange the survey.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Charter Request - Survey Arrangements
email_chain.body:
Dear Enzo,

Just a quick note to say thanks for the logistics of arranging the survey in Bimini. My colleague and I will have a flight to Bimini on Thursday and will be staying at the Grand Isle Bimini Bay Resort. We'll be ready to meet the vessel at the survey dock on Friday.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Charter Request - Survey Results
email_chain.body:
Dear Enzo,

As promised, I have prepared a comprehensive analysis of the ORIFLAMM survey data, along with a list of repairs, ratings, and observations. You may review this document and advise us whether we should proceed to purchase the vessel or not.

There are a few issues with the vessel that are a cause for concern, however it should be possible to address these issues without significantly compromising vessel integrity.

The main concerns are a cracked main engine bearing housing and the state of some of the steering equipment. I recommend having these issues looked at by a professional marine surveyor.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Abraham Tax Fraud Article Publication
email_chain.body: Article titled 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release' submitted for today's publication. The piece covers correspondence under aliases 'H' and 'O'Toole' to The Irish Independent regarding the Stephen Trew case from 1998, and subsequent prison restrictions on Abraham's writing privileges.

email_chain.subject: RE: Press Coverage of Mr. Abraham - Important Notice
email_chain.body:
Dear Friends,

First of all, I would like to thank everyone who has expressed their concern regarding the news that appeared in the press today about Mr. Abraham. I want to assure you that the published information does not correspond to reality. We have already informed Mr. Abraham's legal team about the necessary steps that should be taken to correct these misrepresentations.

I can confirm that the court in New York has issued an interim order prohibiting the publisher from writing any further articles about Mr. Abraham in any form of publication.

Thank you all again for your support.

Yours faithfully,
Mr. Edmund Taylor

email_chain.subject: Correction Request - Abraham Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We are writing regarding the article published by Mr. Eoghan Rice concerning Mr. Maurice Abraham's case. The article contains several misrepresentations regarding Mr. Abraham's correspondence and his time in federal prison.

Specifically, the claims about letters signed as 'H' and 'O'Toole' in relation to the Stephen Trew case of 1998 are unsubstantiated. Furthermore, the statements about prison authorities restricting Mr. Abraham's writing privileges are incorrect.

We request an immediate correction of these inaccuracies.

Regards,
Legal Defense Team

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Ship Broker Recommendation Needed
email_chain.body:

I noticed your profile on LinkedIn and would appreciate your expertise on an urgent matter. I previously worked with a broker named Brian Hopkin from Thomas Hopkin & Co for a shipment from Panama to the US West Coast. Unfortunately, the vessel ran aground and became a total loss. Mr. Hopkin misrepresented the ship owner's credentials and manipulated the insurance arrangements for personal gain.

Given this experience, I'm seeking a reliable broker for a new shipment from Greece to Rotterdam. Could you advise on recommended routes and proper insurance coverage to protect our interests?

Best regards,
Cieran Sullivan

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiries

Javier García

Can you please let me know which fuel qualities you require? Are you looking for VLSFO 0.5%S, or 0.1%S?

Regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Fujairah to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Hi Kate,

We will need the fuel to be available on or before 25th August to discharge at your earliest. Can you please confirm when you will be able to supply it? If you are able to arrange this we will be looking for 0.5%S VLSFO fuel, please confirm the FOB Fujairah price.

Regards,
Nimo

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Fujairah to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Hi Nimo,

I can supply you a VLSFO cargo available on or around 23rd August. The price will be 350 USD FOB Fujairah, plus a $1.50 USD additional fee to cover the forward fixing of the MGO. This will be purchased on the spot market at the time of discharge.

Can you please confirm you are happy with this price and to proceed?

Regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Fujairah to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Hi Kate,

The price you quoted is acceptable. If we can proceed, can you please send me the documentation that I will need to prepare to load this cargo?

Regards,
Nimo

email_chain.subject: Alternative Shipping Routes Proposal

email_chain.subject: Re: Alternative Shipping Routes Proposal
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Oscar Everest

email_chain.subject: Re: Alternative Shipping Routes Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Everest,

We would be happy to provide you with more details. Our products can be of several types, but we do not specify the brands. If you specify the port of destination, we can define the most interesting directions.

Yours truly,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Re: Alternative Shipping Routes Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Vladimir,

Thank you for your kind reply. Unfortunately, I cannot provide you with the port of destination as we are still in the proposal stage. We plan to conduct a survey of our potential customers first before making any commitments.

Best regards,
Oscar Everest

email_chain.subject: Re: Alternative Shipping Routes Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Everest,

We always take into account our partners' needs and preferences. Regarding the list of potential customers you are interested in, we can choose the most suitable direction. Please send me the list, we will be happy to assist you.

Yours sincerely,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Sugar Shipment Quotation - LA to Seattle
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Quotation - LA to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Kelsey,

Please find attached a quotation for the delivery of 4,500 MT of granulated sugar from Los Angeles to Seattle. To pay 30% of the value in advance and the balance against the B/L, you are required to make a bank to bank transfer within three working days of the date of this offer.

Best regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Quotation - LA to Seattle
email_chain.body:

Kelsey

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Quotation - LA to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Frank,

Thank you for your message. As the details have already been discussed over email, we will now go ahead with the bank to bank transfer. Looking forward to doing business with you.

Regards,

email_chain.subject: MEG Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

My buyer here in Oslo needs 600MT of MEG from Houston. Could you please give me a rate estimate for a spot voyage and advise on the signing of a charter party?

Cheers,
Kristina

email_chain.subject: Re: MEG Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hi Kristina,

It's in the $90s/ton (FOB NOLA) at the moment. Rates are firm at this level, since very few tonnage is being offered. Also, considering the port congestion in Houston, we would only sign a charter party once we have the deal in hand. Should the charter party contain a destination clause, then of course, it could be signed upon final confirmation.

Regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: MEG Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

Here in Norway, it's our currency, the Krone, that is used. So here goes our deal in the local currency:

3,300,000 NOK/MT (FOB NOLA)

A charter party may be drawn up to cover our terms. But, if the MEG should arrive a bit early, we could store the cargo until we need it.

Best,
Kris

email_chain.subject: Re: MEG Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Harris,

I received a FOB quotation from a Singaporean trader today, but I am not sure how it compares to what you quoted.

12,000MT of MEG FOB NOLA (delivery within 2 weeks)
3,300,000 NOK/MT
FOB                             USD 3,300,000
Estimated delivery cost: USD 20,000
Charter party fee: USD 200,000
Insurance: USD 350,000
Total: USD 3,890,000

The above price includes destination clause: "Bill of Lading to be issued 'Norwegian ports only'". So, how does your rate compare?

Best,
Kristina

P.S. According to my friend who works in the shipping department at the big Norwegian oil company, the port congestion in Houston is due to Hurricane Gustav

Spot Steel Trader

email_chain.body:

Please let me know if you have any questions, otherwise you can proceed with the deal and sign the attached contract.

Thank you,
Greg
Spot Steel Trader

email_chain.subject: Re: Steel Booking Request - 6,000 MT Miami

All other terms and conditions of the deal remain the same. Please let me know if you have any questions, otherwise you can proceed with the deal and sign the attached contract.

Thank you,
Greg
Spot Steel Trader

email_chain.subject: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jacobsen,

We have an inquiry for a suitable vessel to load 3,000MT of Urea at Arzew to discharge at Barcelona. Could you please send me a suitable freight rate for this cargo?

Thank you.

Best regards,
Stephan

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Stephan,

Thank you for your inquiry. Before I can provide a freight rate, I need some clarification regarding the charter type you're seeking.

Please confirm if you're looking for a time charter or voyage charter arrangement. For time charter, I would need to know the intended duration. For voyage charter, please specify the preferred charter party terms (BIMCO Vessel-Partner, Vessel-Space Charter party, or other).

Best regards,
Christian Jacobsen

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Stephan,

I am following up on my previous email regarding the charter details. Please provide the requested information so I can calculate an appropriate freight rate for your cargo.

Best regards,
Christian Jacobsen

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Stephan,

I am still awaiting your response regarding the charter type and terms for the Urea cargo from Arzew to Barcelona. Please provide these details so I can proceed with the freight rate calculation.

Best regards,
Christian Jacobsen

email_chain.subject: Grangemouth Vessel Space Inquiry
email_chain.body:

Thanks,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Name - Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:

We are delighted to be able to offer the following slot for the vessel's voyage into Grangemouth on 19 August:

Ship: [Vessel Name]
IMDG No.: 2287
ETA Grangemouth: 21:00 (19/08/2020)

Best regards,
John Barlow

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Name - Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Marco,

Apologies for not replying earlier. I have just returned from 3 months leave.

This vessel would be loaded with Polymers and Visco polymer. Generally the cargo would take up the whole space, however as mentioned earlier, we will accommodate smaller sized cargo if possible.

Best regards,
Tony

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Name - Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Hello Tony,

Are you able to advise your normal laycan for this vessel? And your normal berth use. Is this vessel restricted to cranes that can handle 50 metric tonnes?

Many thanks,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Name - Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tosco,

Laycan wise this vessel is always flexible and will try to accommodate as much as possible. Berths are not usually allocated until 24-30hrs prior to arrival, more so during peak season.

50 MT cranes are usually ok with any cargo carried on board.

Best regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Name - Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tosco,

This vessel will stay within laycan 14-19 August and will not change berth at Grangemouth.

Best regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Specifications Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Rook,

Thank you for the kind offer. Some clarification required:

1. Please confirm the number of cubic meters that can be loaded. Maximum POL volume is 4900 cbm.
2. If we load the full volume, how much POL can be loaded?
3. How many cubic meters of POL can be loaded in the forward (viscopol) hold?
4. If POL can be loaded, how much can be loaded?

Please also confirm:
1. MCT: 40 tons
2. Lead time to build a POL hatch: 24 hours from confirmation
3. Access to MOORFIX for our inspection: pending on availability of the terminal

Best regards,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Bunker Fuel Request for MSC Cristiana
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Bridget,

Could we use your bunker tankers for upcoming voyages of MSC Cristiana? We are looking for two times 5,000MT in August and September, but we are also open to 8,000MT voyages. Can you provide us with details on terms and conditions?

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Fuel Request for MSC Cristiana
email_chain.body:
Hey there!

We have two possible options for you to choose from. We can offer the following:

1. 5,000MT of High-Sulphur Fuel Oil (HSFO) at 3.5% - Can be available in 3-4 days in your destination.
2. 3,000MT of Marine Gas Oil (MGO) at 0.5% - Can be available in 4-5 days in your destination.

Could you please let us know your preference? We look forward to working with you!

Kind regards,
Bridget
