email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Elsner,

Could you provide a 1,500MT cargo of freight from Hamburg to Tehran before June 14th? Please share your typical demurrage and dispatch rates.

Thanks,
Serafina

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Serafina,

We have available 1,500 MT freight capacity on various routes. We can offer space on our vessel ETERNAL DREAM from Hamburg to Istanbul with one stop, and then transfer to our vessel METAPHYSICS for the journey from Istanbul via Ahvaz to Tehran.

The rate is $750 per 20' container demurrage, $500 per 20' container dispatch.

Please let me know if this arrangement works for you.

Thank you,
Johann

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Johann,

Thank you for your offer, but this is not the route we are seeking. We'd like to ship directly from Hamburg to Tehran. Please let me know if you can accommodate this request.

Thank you!
Serafina

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Serafina,

I must clarify that our current routing options are as previously stated. We can offer space on ETERNAL DREAM departing Hamburg for Istanbul on May 31st, followed by METAPHYSICS from Istanbul via Ahvaz to Tehran.

Thank you,
Johann

email_chain.subject: Zinc Cargo Charter Inquiry - China to Egypt

John

email_chain.subject: Re: Zinc Cargo Charter Inquiry - China to Egypt
email_chain.body:
Hi Min-Jeong,

Vessel: A1

Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Port Darien to Port Dauphin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

Thanks for your response. Unfortunately, our requirement is not just Darien to Dauphin; the cargo will be delivered to an island off Guadeloupe. Do you know anyone who might be able to help us in this region? Or perhaps you know another shipowner who might be able to do this run for us?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Information Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

I noticed that your ship was in Dauphin a couple of weeks ago. I wonder if you know anything about cargo? It seems to us that most of the big ships do not have their cargo listed on your online service. I was just wondering if you might have information on shipping agencies that might be able to provide that information?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Requirements in Caribbean
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

We have a requirement for a shipowner with a large ship available for work in the Caribbean. It seems that most of the vessels under 20,000 tons are not available to carry cargo, even when they are tied up at the docks. Do you know anyone who might be able to help us? The ships listed in the Maritime Database are not for sale, although some shipyards are listed. Are there any shipowners who have vessels for sale? Are they listed in the Maritime Database?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Project Cancellation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

I just received word that our project has been canceled. Thanks anyway, however. The shipbuilding project is no longer an option for us.

Have a nice day.

Jessica

Kind regards,
Jacob

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Yellow Tungsten Carbide Buttons
email_chain.body:
Dear Jacob,

Please see below our company details:

Spectra Trading LLC
Tel.: +962-6-5612345
Mobile: +962-7-95678901
Fax: +962-6-5612346

While we have production facilities in Bahrain, our exports are managed from our Jordan office. We typically export 50-150kg monthly. If this matches your requirements, we can prepare an offer within your budget with shipment from Bahrain.

Best regards,
Nevens

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Yellow Tungsten Carbide Buttons
email_chain.body:
Dear Jacob,

For your reference, Spectra is an Amman-based importer and distributor of mining chemicals. Our product portfolio includes CŁpim™ 41 (75% Sodium Cyanide), Satyam M3, Kengal ® M, TMAA, DCTA, and Hexamine.

We import primarily from Europe and supply in bulk drums (50kg or 125kg), jerry cans, and pouches for various industries. We also offer bulk and tanker load supplies with custom packaging and blending options.

Our facilities are located in the Abdali area, Amman, conveniently situated 20 minutes from both Queen Alia International Airport and King Hussein port.

Best regards,
Spectra Team

Hannah

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Shipment - Berth Availability Query
email_chain.body:
Mr. Li,

We plan to load 2,000MT of iron ore from Tianjin to Port Hedland next month. Could you please confirm your vessel position and berth availability?

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment - Berth Availability Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlie,

According to your email, your vessel will load iron ore from China and discharge at Port Hedland. Our yard is usually full of steel sheet during this time of year. Could you let us know your deadline?

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment - Berth Availability Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlie,

There are vessels waiting for their berthing at the dock. If the berth is available for your vessel, our shipowners plan to offer us at USD1.00/MMT and also wish to extend the payment terms to 60 days. Your advice would be very much appreciated.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment - Berth Availability Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

As a result, our shipowners only agree to raise the contract price by USD0.10/MMT. Could you please pass it on to your shipowner? Also, could you let us know if the steel sheet is in the iron ore range? We want to confirm with the load port.

Best regards,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment - Berth Availability Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

We accept the offer. Could you please sign the letter of indemnity for our shipowner? Also, our commercial team in the load port confirms that the steel sheet is in the iron ore range.

Best regards,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Vessel Request - Genoa to Haifa Lubricants Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlene,

Thank you so much for taking the time to reply. What I'm looking for is a fixed rate from Genoa to Haifa for 3,300MT of lubricants for delivery on 22 June. I had hoped to receive an offer before the end of the day yesterday, but the best offer I've received so far is a rate of US$80 per MT from WFS Energy and this was only received this morning.

I've heard a lot about your brokerage, and it would be great to work with your company, so I look forward to hearing your best offer.

Kind regards,
Sam Montgomery
Group Procurement Manager
John Robb Ltd

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Request - Genoa to Haifa Lubricants Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thank you for your email. Can you confirm the following?

1. Main cargo: lubricants
2. Loading date: 21 June, but we can probably accept a few days either side of that.
3. Discharge date: no earlier than 22 June.
4. Trade: Genoa to Haifa.
5. Vessel size: What range of vessels are you considering?
6. Is there any flexibility in the loading port or discharge port?
7. Bunker date: can you be flexible with the bunker date? If so, what are your preferred ranges?

Thanks,
Justine Smith
Vessel Procurement
Bolla Ltd

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Request - Genoa to Haifa Lubricants Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Justine,

Thank you for your email. I can confirm the following.

1. The main cargo is lubricants.
2. I can accept a loading date of 21 June.
3. The discharge date should be no earlier than 22 June.
4. The trade is Genoa to Haifa.
5. I would prefer a vessel that is no larger than 25,000 DWT.
6. We can be flexible with the loading and discharge ports.
7. The bunker date is 22 June.

Kind regards,
Sam Montgomery

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Request - Genoa to Haifa Lubricants Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thank you for your reply. In that case, we would like to offer our client US$90 per MT for a bunker date of 22 June for a voyage from Genoa to Haifa.

Kind regards,
Justine

email_chain.body:

João

email_chain.subject: Re: Polish Ceramics Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear João,

Our laycan is from 10 June to 15 June. Our port fees are as follows:

1. Security: $50 USD per container
2. Terminal Handling: $150 USD per container
3. Peak period fee: $100 USD per container

Total: $300 USD per container

All fees are inclusive of tax and insurance. If you want to add an inspection by an independent agency, that will be an additional $100 USD per container.

Let me know if you need anything else.

Best regards,
Krystyna

email_chain.subject: Re: Polish Ceramics Shipment
email_chain.body:

I just want to confirm our shipping. Are the Polish ceramics ready to load on 10 June?

João

email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Krystyna

email_chain.subject: Welcome back from London
email_chain.body:
Dear Justin,

Greetings from Tez and Cengiz. Good to see you are back from London and we hope you had a good time. We have some updates regarding university admissions that will affect your options.

Best regards,
Tez and Cengiz

email_chain.subject: Re: Welcome back from London
email_chain.body:
Hello Tez and Cengiz,

Thank you for your message. I'm planning to take a short break but will be back soon. Could you provide information about the University of Chicago and the English University programs? I heard they've changed their course structures and admission policies.

Best,
Justin

email_chain.subject: Re: Welcome back from London
email_chain.body:
Dear Justin,

The University of Chicago does not currently admit graduate students for study abroad programs. However, I recommend first finding a good residential school and then inquiring about credit transfer options. I can send you links to some competitive residential programs that might suit your needs.

You can find a list of potential summer schools here: http://www.thegatewayus.com/Study/Subject/Summer-School.aspx

Regarding credit transfers, while it can be challenging, many universities offer flexible programs that allow summer course credits. The key is finding a suitable residential course first.

Best regards,
Cengiz

email_chain.subject: MGO Cargo Shipment Query - Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Hello Capt. Hu,

We are organizing a 200,000mt cargo of MGO from Gijon, Spain, to Japan. As you know, it's a big shipment. In your opinion, are all the suppliers out there able to supply such a big order?

Also, how long will the loading time take?

Many thanks,
Timothy

email_chain.subject: Re: MGO Cargo Shipment Query - Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Regarding your query, we've never handled that quantity of MGO in a single shipment. However, our parent company has experience with 100,000mt+ shipments for major trading companies in recent years, so this is feasible.

The timeframe is typically negotiable between supplier and buyer. We normally provide shipping documents within 10-12 days of shipment, with payment terms of cash within 4 weeks. Bank documentary charges should be settled within 2 weeks of shipment.

However, finding a supplier capable of delivering 200,000mt at once would be challenging. I recommend splitting the order into two shipments of approximately 100,000mt each.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Re: MGO Cargo Shipment Query - Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

I should add that vessel capacity is also a consideration. The maximum capacity for suitable vessels is around 130,000mt, so we would definitely need two ships for this order.

Typical delivery time is approximately 45 days, though this can be optimized depending on vessel availability and routing. Freight costs typically range from USD 10 to USD 20 per mt, varying with vessel size, route, and distance.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Re: MGO Cargo Shipment Query - Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

To provide additional context, the Europe-Japan route is approximately 7,000 nautical miles, typically taking around 30 days depending on weather conditions and vessel speed.

For sourcing suppliers, I recommend reaching out to local trade associations or trade missions. They can connect you with suitable suppliers or refer you to relevant organizations in the destination country.

Various vessel types could handle this cargo, including bulk carriers and tankers, each with their specific advantages.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Hamburg-Aarhus Fixture Rate Clarification
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Let's assume our 4,500MT fixture from Hamburg to Aarhus has settled for a free-out rate of $300/MT. I just want to confirm - is that an all-in rate?

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg-Aarhus Fixture Rate Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

I understand your question, however, while the quotation has settled at $300/MT, the vessel owner has indicated flexibility to accept $250/MT. This could present an opportunity for negotiation.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg-Aarhus Fixture Rate Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

I need to be very clear about this. The agreed rate is $300/MT all-in. If we were to negotiate a lower rate with the vessel owner, they would have no obligation to maintain the $300/MT all-in terms. My position remains firm on the original agreement.

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg-Aarhus Fixture Rate Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

Please review our previous correspondence carefully. You've taken one particular stance on this matter, but there might be other approaches worth considering. I'm not making any specific proposals - I'm merely pointing out that there could be alternative solutions to explore.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg-Aarhus Fixture Rate Clarification
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

To be clear, I'm not proposing or assuming anything specific. I'm simply suggesting that taking such a rigid approach might be limiting from a business perspective, even if it makes sense legally.

If you'd like to discuss this further, I'm happy to schedule a call to talk through the various options.

Cheers,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: June Shipment Questions - Dhaka to Tejing
email_chain.body:
Thanks for reaching out, I'm happy to help.

Your container should arrive on the 29th of June. The demurrage is $500 per day. As for arrival time, it depends when your truck arrives at the port and the port's efficiency. As the summer is very hot in China, the best time is around 10-11am.

Let me know if you need anything else!

Best,
Bruce

1. Cargo/bunker barge mooring alongside with through-water manifold connections

Mark Taylor

email_chain.subject: LNG Cargo Inquiry - Lagos to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:

We have an urgent requirement for a tanker to carry 25,000MT of LNG from Lagos to Hong Kong. Would you be able to provide your best freight rate and do you allow re-instatement of laytime beyond 96 hours?

Thank you,
Damian

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo Inquiry - Lagos to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:
Hi Damian,

The price is FOB USD540.00/MT, not including the lightering fee (max 5,000mt at $300/mt). Freight time of the vessel in and out of the ports is 4 days, transit time is 27 days.

Regarding reinstatement: For arrival, we can grant up to 24 hours if the vessel is delayed. For departure, no reinstatement is possible after the vessel has left port, even beyond 96 hours. 

If you wish to proceed with the Charter Party, please provide:
1. Company profile, scope of operation, address, fax number, phone number
2. Certificate of insurance

Best regards,
Lisa Cheng

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment Request
email_chain.body:

Can you handle a methanol shipment from Mumbai to Osaka and then a reshipment from Osaka to Canada?

Regards,
Ulysses

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Ulysses,

I will handle the methanol. When the shipment arrives in Osaka, you must submit an SF-478 (Item 16) and send it to the PBO Warehouse. Then, I will make the arrangements to have it shipped from Osaka to Canada.

Regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Ryan,

As far as I know, methanol is a hazardous material. Are there any special requirements we need to consider?

Regards,
Ulysses

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Request
email_chain.body:
Ulysses,

You are correct; methanol is a hazardous material and cannot be shipped commercially. Instead, I will arrange for the shipment to be carried by the Military Sealift Command, which transports military personnel and cargo.

Regards,
Ryan

Samantha

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:
Dear Claire,

We require clarification on the following points:

1. What is the duration of the time charter?
2. Which documents are required for sugar export:
   * Certificate of Origin (CO)

email_chain.subject: Vessel Almarakib Status Update Request
email_chain.body:

Best,
Nada

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Almarakib Status Update Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Nada,

Here are the latest developments regarding the Almarakib:

The vessel is currently outward bound. There are two important updates:

1. The vessel's Pakistani captain is low on funds and has accepted a cargo transport job from our port to Pakistan to generate immediate income. As a freelancer, he's willing to take on this job with advance payment.

2. The captain is requesting $30,000 upfront for this voyage. We need to take out a bank loan for this amount. Unfortunately, due to our financial situation, I must sell my share of the ship to cover the loan. I'm currently at the bank finalizing arrangements where they will take your share of the vessel as collateral against the loan.

Regards,
Sada

Bulk Sugar Qty: 5,500MT (3,500MT + 2,500MT + 500MT)
Containerized Sugar Qty: 4,700MT (3,550MT + 2,950MT + 200MT)
Overall Average Unit Rate USD 330 (converted from USD 345/MT)

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Quote Request - Wheat Shipment Dalian to Durban
email_chain.body:
Mr. Anderson,

Would you please provide a quote for our shipment of 10,000MT of M.G. wheat from Dalian to Durban. Can you include any extra charges for overweight or additional services?

Thank you,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment Quote
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your quote. Your quote of $7,350 is a great value for a premium wheat like our MG and we were hoping you would have enough of the stock to allow us to charter your vessel to Dalian to load. When is your next voyage to Dalian?

If we could charter your vessel directly from your current port, perhaps London, then that would greatly reduce our shipping costs and we would definitely prefer to charter with you. We will arrange for our vessel to load with your wheat and deliver it to Dalian where we will book a voyage to Durban.

We look forward to hearing from you,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your reply. Although we understand that your vessel is heading to Australia, we would like to discuss alternative arrangements for the shipment.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Acceptance
email_chain.body:
Mr. Anderson,

We believe your quote for $6,500 is very attractive. We are holding the quote open until the end of the week to allow time for our enquiry to be approved.

Thank you,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Quote
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your reply. We look forward to hearing back from you by Thursday when we will be able to consider your revised quote.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Comparison
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

We note your revised quote is less competitive than your original quote of $7,350. As we stated in our first enquiry we are trying to obtain the best value for our shipment of wheat and it would be unwise to have a new agent. We still hold your initial quote of $7,350 open for the time being.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Violet,

I'll need you to give us more information about the shipment, like:
* The cargo's name, weight, and volume (in cubic meters)

* Lashing for securing the cargo
* More requirements (like reefer containers for cargoes that need a particular temperature for preservation, etc.)

We can make a quotation when we have all the required details.

Alwin

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Paul

Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643 x225
Fax: 604-557-3644

email_chain.subject: RE: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Great - you book a 50-foot container, which is not in our scope! Are you sure we have a 50-foot container deal with you? If we had a 50-foot container deal with you, I would've thought you would've offered us the container first because we are an origin based company. Also, I'm not sure what 'book' means in this context. There are not many 50-foot container companies in Canada and if we had a deal with you, I would be sure about that.

Regards,
Neeta

Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

Yes, we will book it as you wish. We will also book the 20ft container for you, however, we need to move it as a OOG from the main line to the OOCL main line. We need to move it to Keelung for OOCL to pick it up from there. We have booked a 20ft container for your company to move from Shanghai to Kaohsiung. We will need the original BL or amendment for the move from Shanghai to Laem Chabang.

Regards,
Paul

Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.

email_chain.subject: FW: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Paul,

I am looking for the agreement first. We don't trust your company. We don't need you to book a 20-footer for us. We were never notified that you offered us a 20-foot deal. We don't need anything else from you unless we have the agreement.

Regards,
Neeta

Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc

Tom

email_chain.body:

Fred

email_chain.body:
Dear Giulia,

In response to your earlier email, we can confirm VLCC cargo space availability for 3,300 MT of lubricants from Genoa to Haifa. We can arrange delivery from loading port via truck, rail, or barge.

Rate for sea carriage: EUR 14,000 per MT
Estimated charges: EUR 20,000 and USD 400 (see Exhibit A)
Commission rate: USD 1,000

Terms: CIF (see attached general terms - Exhibit B)
Our standard bill of lading will be used.

Best regards,
Fred

email_chain.subject: Wood Panel Transport Inquiry - Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Sven,

We're looking to ship 5,500MT of wood panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao. Please send your rate ideas along with a preliminary quote and any specific questions.

Sincerely,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Wood Panel Transport Inquiry - Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Dear Jeremy,

Thanks for your email about the transport of wood panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao. What is the weight of the panels? If they are 1.6 cubic meters (a typical wood pallet size) with a panel thickness of about 2.5cm, that's approximately 1,000kg/m³ with a density of 1.7. Do you have any other measurements?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Wood Panel Transport Inquiry - Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hi Susan,

Yes, all panels are 1.6 cubic meters and 2.5cm thick, so I can use your equation to find the weight (1,000kg/m³ * 1.6 cubic meters = 1,600kg).

How about this deal? How many cubic meters can your truck transport from Bordeaux to Bilbao? How many total trips will the vehicle make? What is the total cost for transport?

Thanks!
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Wood Panel Transport Inquiry - Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Dear Jeremy,

Thanks for your email. Our truck can transport 24 cubic meters at a time from Bordeaux to Bilbao. The total cost would be 10,000 euros. We will also cover all of your customs costs and administrative fees in the EU and at the destination.

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Wood Panel Transport Inquiry - Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hello Susan,

I am excited to get a deal on our wood panels! I have a few more questions to ask about the transport. Can we discuss these details in person? Maybe over the phone or via video chat? I'm free now if you are.

Thanks,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Wood Panel Transport Inquiry - Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hello Jeremy,

Yes, we can discuss the details in person. If it's more convenient for you, I can meet you at the cargo port in Bordeaux. The coordinates are 44.8370° N, 0.5980° W.

Is that okay with you?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Request - Household Chemicals from Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Betsy,

We're expecting 6,600MT of household chemicals to leave Antwerp on Friday. If you could advise your final freight rate, we can accept it.

Thank you,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - Household Chemicals from Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

I can confirm that the rate I quoted you earlier still stands: US$2.00 per ton FOB Antwerp, plus US$10 per package in case the packages are of different dimensions.

Should you require additional details please let me know.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Response Strategy
email_chain.body:
Hi Dave,

Why don't you just offer the rate per ton and let David accept it or suggest alternatives?

Do you remember in our training course, we learnt that the purpose of most email communications is not just to reply with 'yes' or 'no', but to help others make a decision?

David's just a little reluctant, but he will accept it and agree to it if you can help him to make a decision by making your rate specific enough.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Petroleum Coke Shipment Query - Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Hello my old friend,

A little birdie tells me you have an urgent need to get 3,000MT of petroleum coke into Cape Town. You don't have space on the F/A ABLYN which is at Latakia? Are you going to wait for her next stop, after a quick turn around in Sudan? Or are you desperate?

Yours,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Re: Petroleum Coke Shipment Query - Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Hi again,

Here is the story. I can make you an offer you can't refuse. Remember when I mentioned a quick turn-around in Sudan? Well, the job is not for me. It's for my cousin. He has taken over my business. He is not as nice as me. Don't worry, I can get your oil to South Africa.

Yours,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Re: Petroleum Coke Shipment Query - Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Salam Aliki,

Remember me? I was one of those sailors you knew in Dubai. I am in Cape Town now. I have a good deal for you.

Three thousand metric tons of petroleum coke, sapphire black, stored in an oil tanker on the Black Sea.
First offer: $500,000
Second offer: $150,000 per metric ton for the whole load.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Re: Petroleum Coke Shipment Query - Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Salam,

Let me know if you want the deal. The seller is asking for 150,000 dollars per metric ton. The deal will be closed when you sign the contracts. An independent bank will transfer the funds after the transaction.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Re: Petroleum Coke Shipment Query - Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Salam,

The seller is still waiting. I told you not to wait too long to reply to this offer. If you don't, someone else will. Who knows where this oil will end up?

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry Barcelona-Puerto Madryn
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Mendoza,

We have a cargo of 2,200MT which we are hoping to load to a feeder vessel on the 15th, departing Barcelona on the 17th. The discharge is at Puerto Madryn in Argentina.

Please confirm your earliest loading date and advise on transit times.

Kind regards,
Anne Marie

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry Barcelona-Puerto Madryn
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne Marie,

The cargo you have quoted will fit comfortably on MV ACATENANGO.

This ship will load in Aviles, Spain on the 13th March and sail the following day to Madryn, Argentina.

On arrival in Madryn, the cargo will discharge in two weeks time, approximately on the 26th March. This will give you approximately two weeks transit time from Spain to Madryn.

I will send you the following details:
- Laycan: 13th March
- Prelim D/D
- Report of Findings: 12th March
- First Week: 15th-22nd March
- Second Week: 22nd-29th March
- D/D (SPB form)
- Expected discharge: 26th March
- Invoice: 19th March

Please confirm the delivery to Madryn, Argentina.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Milestones - MV ACATENANGO
email_chain.body:
Milestones to be completed between 14.03 and 20.03:

- 14.03: MM automatically notifies the principals the completion of the "Report of Findings"
- 18.03: MM automatically notifies the vessel owner of the completion of the preliminary D/D
- 18.03: Vessel owner should approve the D/D within 24 hours
- 18.03: Vessel owner is required to download the preliminary D/D and secure the vessel
- 20.03: The first week of the pre-laycan D/D expires

email_chain.subject: Contract Confirmation - MV ACATENANGO
email_chain.body:
Dear Vessel Owner and Vessel Manager,

We are pleased to announce that we have agreed to the following contract regarding the cargo booking you made for shipment to Argentina.

Arrangements have already been made with your agent Mr. McCarthy in Barcelona, Spain and our MD to make all the required arrangements.

Vessel details for MV ACATENANGO will be handled by:

Chibest Vessels (M.V) Inc
Attention: Ms. Pia Arroyo
8 Ellery Lane
Bromley Hill Industrial Estate
Kent, BR1 4RQ
United Kingdom

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Feeder Vessel Request - Novorossiysk to Batumi
email_chain.body:
Dear Anne,

Can we schedule a call to discuss the feeder vessel requirements in more detail?

Thanks and Best regards,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Feeder Vessel Request - Novorossiysk to Batumi

email_chain.subject: Port Charges Query - Heavy Plates Shipment to Port Louis
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ferris,

My name is Samuel. I'm currently the vessel broker of a Chinese bulk carrier currently in Chittagong, Bangladesh.

We have 3,800MT of heavy plates to load. Destination is Port Louis, Mauritius. We have been given the following port dues and fees to be deducted from the cargo:

* General Cargo Port Dues: USD 3,256.00
* Coast Guard Charges: USD 164.00
* MFAF (Mauritius Free Airport Fee): USD 112.80
* Port Corporation: USD 159.84
* Generator Rental: USD 0.16/Hour * 12 Hours = USD 1.92
* Empty Tank Cleaning: USD 10.00 * 2 Tanks = USD 20.00

Could you kindly take this into account when submitting your freight quote?

Best regards,
Samuel

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Charges Query - Heavy Plates Shipment to Port Louis
email_chain.body:
Dear Samuel,

Thank you for your email. Unfortunately, it is not appropriate for you to pass charges like this on to the cargo owners without their consent. If you are able to provide evidence that this is the owners' responsibility (e.g. a bill of lading with a clause allowing the carrier to deduct port dues from the cargo), we might be able to discuss a rate increase to cover these expenses, but if you are just making up charges to pay your agency then it is unethical and we will not pay you.

We also need a few more details on the cargo (origin, grade, product code), which will enable us to get a more accurate quote for the freight.

The more information you are able to provide in your emails, the faster we can give you an answer.

Thank you,
Alain Ferris

email_chain.subject: Suez Canal Delays Query
email_chain.body:
Hi,

I have heard of some vessels taking longer than normal to make passage through locks at the Suez Canal. Do you know if this is correct and do you think it might delay my shipment from China to Long Beach?

Sincerely,
Donald

email_chain.subject: RE: Suez Canal Delays Query
email_chain.body:
Hi,

I've also heard about vessels taking longer than normal to make passage through the Suez Canal. How does that affect my shipments?

Sincerely,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: RE: Suez Canal Delays Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Valued Customers,

Thank you for your inquiries about the Suez Canal situation. Here are the current facts:

1. The Suez Canal is experiencing significant congestion with 67 vessels waiting to enter and 55 vessels waiting to exit as of May 2nd.

2. This congestion stems from the March incident involving the Ever Given vessel, which has created an ongoing backlog despite the canal's reopening.

3. The Ever Given has been successfully dislodged but remains in the canal pending refueling and repairs.

We recommend factoring in potential delays for any shipments routing through the Suez Canal during this period.

Best regards,
Shipping Support Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Sulphuric Acid Shipment Inquiry - Aqaba to Khor Fakkan
email_chain.body:
Dear J. Pye,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can accommodate a late July load date, however please note that securing the necessary permits for hazardous cargo may take several weeks. A load window of 3-4 days is possible, but this will need to be specified in the permits.

We recommend engaging a local agent to expedite the permit process. Given the nature of the cargo, all documentation must be handled with appropriate care and attention.

Best regards,
M. Kelly

email_chain.subject: Weekly Updates - New Code of Conduct and RFS News
email_chain.body:
Hey All,

Because I'm out of the office this week, I'm sending you some important updates:

1. The Fertilizer Institute has released a new Code of Conduct, featuring nine guiding principles for good behavior, including promoting a culture of safety and legal compliance. Anyone working with anhydrous ammonia or other fertilizers must review and share this with their teams.

2. Following discussions between California manufacturers/distributors and CARB regarding the 2013 RFS proposed by the EPA, new legislation has been introduced providing tax incentives for renewable fuel blending.

Best regards,
Brian Jennings
Director of Regulatory Affairs

email_chain.subject: Potential Entity Formation and Volume Increase
email_chain.body:
Dear Messrs Rettig and Nogales,

I hear that you are in talks to form a new entity, can you confirm this?

If true, this could be positive news for the industry, particularly if you can demonstrate a joint offering that provides real added value.

In light of this development, we would be interested in discussing the possibility of increasing our volume through HUB. However, this would necessitate improvements in your handling efficiency. I'd appreciate hearing your plans for any planned upgrades.

Best regards,
Ira

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Entity Formation and Volume Increase
email_chain.body:
Dear Ira,

Thank you for your inquiry. I can confirm that we are indeed in discussions regarding the formation of a new entity.

We are confident that this consolidation will create significant synergies and enhance our service offering to clients like yourself.

Regarding handling efficiency, we have already initiated planning for major infrastructure upgrades that would support increased volumes. We would welcome the opportunity to discuss these plans with you in detail.

Best regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Vegetable Oil Storage & Transport Query
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Vessel Loading Update - MV Star Horizon
email_chain.body:

A vessel, the MV Star Horizon (IMO 9876543), is currently awaiting loading of a shipment of iron ore from Port Hedland to Qingdao. The vessel is scheduled to depart Port Hedland on January 20, 2024.

The shipper is expected to complete loading within 72 hours. The expected cargo volumes to be loaded on this vessel are as follows:

Iron Ore: 170,000 MT

The estimated cost of this shipment is 2,550,000 USD.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
John Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Loading Update - MV Star Horizon
email_chain.body:
Hello Peter,

I wanted to follow up on our previous conversation regarding the shipment of iron ore from Port Hedland to Qingdao.

The vessel, the MV Star Horizon (IMO 9876543), is currently waiting for cargo at Port Hedland. We expect the vessel to depart Port Hedland on January 20, 2024.

We understand that the shipper is experiencing some delays in completing the loading process. The shipper has informed us that they expect to complete loading within the next 48 hours.

Based on the current information available to us, we estimate that the total cost of this shipment will be 2,550,000 USD.

Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns about this shipment.

Best regards,
John Smith
Ocean Freight Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Vancouver to Bordeaux Grain Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Adam,

Empty vessels for departure May 2023 will be limited. However, we are still expecting some availability, particularly in mid May. Please advise your preferred vessels and vessels you are willing to consider.

Some of our available vessels will be into several weeks of demurrage, even though we know your usual demurrage rates. In your reply, please advise any other empty vessels you are currently interested in.

I would also recommend you to follow the Baltic Dry Index (BDI), which is currently at a 9 month high and going up fast.

email_chain.subject: Caustic Soda Shipment - Limassol to Monrovia

James

email_chain.subject: Re: Caustic Soda Shipment - Limassol to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Dear James,

The transit time is currently 28-30 days. Based on vessel capacity and port restrictions, we can accommodate 26 MT per week for a period of 6 weeks, totaling 156 MT over the full period.

Let me know if this arrangement would work for you.

Best regards,
Rudi

email_chain.subject: Ground Nuts Shipment - Bonny to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Haider,

We'll be shipping 30,000kg of ground nuts from Bonny to Monrovia. Do you see any congestion issues? Could you also quote for the handling and demurrage fees?

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Ground Nuts Shipment - Bonny to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hi Bobby,

Bonny is fine to call to board immediately. However, the berthing congestion is currently at Monrovia.

We'll have to leave by Monday next week for handling. In total, the cost would be as follows:

- R/T cargo handling fee: $480/mt
- Storage and demurrage: $4,500
- Handling for Monrovia: $100/mt

Total amount: $8,580

If you like, I can prepare the documents and send them to you.

Regards,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Re: Ground Nuts Shipment - Bonny to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hi Isaac,

Thank you for your prompt reply. We'd like you to prepare the documents for our approval.

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Ground Nuts Shipment - Bonny to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hi Isaac,

We have approved the documents. Could you send us your bank account details so that we can make the payments?

Regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: RFQ - Coal Shipment Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body:
To all Freight Forwarders,

Can you send me a quote for 3,000MT of coal from Jeddah to Kaohsiung for shipment in early July?

Thank you!

Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Coal Shipment Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body:
Dear Jason,

Thank you for your email and for the opportunity to quote for this shipment of coal. Our quotation is USD260/MT CIF Kaohsiung.

Can you please confirm that this price is acceptable to you?

Kind regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Coal Shipment Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body:
Dear Jason,

Unfortunately, my offer is not accepted by my client. My client offers to you an FOB Jeddah price of USD210/MT and the rest USD20/MT will be added as demurrage charge at terminal.

Please let me know if this offer is acceptable to you or if you wish to negotiate further.

Kind regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Coal Shipment Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for your email. It is acceptable for our side to receive the cargo under such conditions.

Thanks for your effort and cooperation, I look forward to receiving the details.

Best regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Coal Shipment Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for your offer but I'm afraid our client cannot accept the terms at this moment, as there are some issues on end customer side, and they will be receiving other cargo later in the week so it will be impossible to give me clear instructions before Friday.

Please stay in touch, and I will keep you updated regarding the final confirmation.

Thank you and take care.

Best regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - Coal Shipment Jeddah to Kaohsiung
email_chain.body:
Dear Jason,

I'm not available during weekend but my client has given me positive response. However, my client can confirm your offer only for 2500MT, not 3000MT.

In that case, my FOB price remains USD210/MT and demurrage charge is USD20/MT. Please confirm this offer by the end of today.

Kind regards,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Career Guidance Session Follow-up
email_chain.body:
Dear Students,

Following our career guidance session, I encourage you to reach out with your specific career path inquiries. Please include your academic background and particular areas of interest in your messages.

Best regards,
Dr. Smith
Career Advisory Department

email_chain.subject: Re: Computer Engineering Career Path Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Smith,

I am writing to you regarding my interest in computer engineering and designing advanced technology. I would appreciate your guidance on the steps needed to pursue this career path.

I have completed several core computer engineering courses and conducted preliminary research into the field. However, I would value your insight on specific work and learning opportunities available. I'm particularly interested in hearing about your professional journey and what you consider essential steps for success in this field.

Could you advise me on recommended coursework and professional organizations that would be beneficial for my career development?

Thank you for your time,
James Chen

email_chain.subject: Psychology Career Path Questions
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Smith,

My name is Sarah Miller, and I'm writing to seek your advice regarding a career in psychology. I've heard various perspectives about entering this field and would appreciate your professional guidance.

While I understand the basic requirements of majoring in psychology and completing internships, I would value your insight on the most effective path forward. Could you share your experience and recommendations for achieving success in this field?

Would it be possible to schedule a brief meeting to discuss career possibilities in psychology?

Thank you for your time,
Sarah Miller

Please send complete instructions if interested.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Hi Jason,

We would like to charter vessel C3 from Rotterdam to Long Beach. We will load 5,000 MT in Rotterdam. The deadline is 30th June. We need 60 days of free time for discharge in Long Beach.

Please send your charter party.

Regards,
John Z.

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
John,

Thanks for the notice. I've prepared the charter party which will give you 20 days free time for discharge. Could you send us your details of insurance?

Best Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the insurance details. I have made the charter party which gives you the free time you wanted. Please confirm and send a signed copy.

Best Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: SB Vessel C3
email_chain.body:
Hi Jason,

I have signed the charter party and sent it via mail. Please confirm receipt.

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Review - Kaohsiung/Daesan Jet Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Regan,

Our provider M&N has quoted us 16.74 USD/MT to ship jet fuel from Kaohsiung to Daesan via m/v. Could you please review if this rate is acceptable?

Thank you,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Review - Kaohsiung/Daesan Jet Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
David,

We need to consider that the bunker price being charged to shipowners is higher than our selling price for VETSA trades, where our agent covers all bunker costs.

Additionally, please note that the vessel will be delivering product from Daesan to India before loading jet fuel to Daesan.

Therefore, the rate will be 16.74 USD/MT including bunker for VETSA trades.

Let me know your thoughts.

Regards,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Review - Kaohsiung/Daesan Jet Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Eddie,

I understand we need to estimate bunker consumption at loading port (Daesan). However, most bunker will be consumed during the voyage from loading to discharge port, and we should only be responsible for bunker consumed from discharge port back to loading port.

Could you please clarify the final calculation based on this?

Regards,
David

Thanks,
Vitoria

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Shipment NOLA-JAX
email_chain.body:
Dave,

I checked the surface tanker jet fuel route chart. The distance is only 275 miles, potentially 250 if cutting through the shallows. With the shallowest part at 43 feet, a 35,000 ton tanker would only need about 16' of water draft.

While vessel passage shouldn't be an issue, insurance premiums might be higher due to limited refueling options along the route. However, I'm not seeing any suitable tankers available at the moment.

Regards,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Surface Tanker Route Documentation
email_chain.body:

I have uploaded the PDF file to 'www.surfacetankers.info'. Please confirm if you can access it.

Thanks!
Bob Loeschcke

email_chain.subject: Soybean Oil Shipment Quote

Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Shipment Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Can you send me the detailed specification of the product? In general do you want the CIF Asia or CIF Europe? I think we can do Europe with your present price.

Best Regards,
Neha

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Shipment Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Neha,

Here are the specifications for the crude soybean oil:

- Quantity: 7,500MT CIF Ravenna
- Product: Crude soybean oil, MTOT classification
- Quality: Customer-approved grade
- Packaging: Buyer's own packing
- Loading: P&S Clearing at Paranaguá
- Specifications: CIF 80,000BTU, 1.0% max impurities, 0.04% max moisture
- Delivery: Average date May 20, 2017
- Payment Terms: 35% discount on sale (25% prepaid, 10% post sight, 35% at place)
- Premium: 20% on original CIF quote
- Credit: 1% x 30 days, 1% x 60 days

Regards,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Shipment Quote
email_chain.body:
Thanks Daniel.

Let me discuss it with our pricing department and get back to you soon.

Best Regards,
Neha

email_chain.subject: Re: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Xingxiao,

We're planning to ship a product of 15,000MT from China to US ports in two loads for a total of 30,000MT. I've attached the commodity profiles for your reference. Can you please provide the following information?

a. available delivery dates for each of the two loads, allowing 15 days for ship procurement
b. vessel sizes and speed
c. estimated price per metric ton, rate schedule, and bunkering options
d. estimated transit time from load port to discharge port
e. maximum permitted soil / soil contamination

email_chain.subject: RE: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Xingxiao,

Great news, we are fully booked from load port until 2022 for both 15,000MT loads. We've secured the vessel, and we'd like to offer you the low end of the range for the bunkering price.

Could you please provide the revised cost?

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: RE: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Alexander,

Unfortunately, this load is booked to August 2022. We can offer the following rate schedule:

$7.4 per metric ton on stevedore fees
+ 4% over base rate from bunkers
+ 3% load / discharge port fees

We can send the commercial invoice in two weeks

Thank you,
Xingxiao

email_chain.subject: RE: import from China to US ports
email_chain.body:
Xingxiao,

Great! We'll go with the $7.4 flat rate.

Thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Potential Acquisition Discussion
email_chain.body:
Rob,

I've heard rumors that you are in talks to merge with Brooker Inc. We at our company have been following your success for a while now, and we're very interested in potentially acquiring your brokerage. I believe you could be an excellent addition to our organization.

Would you be open to discussing this opportunity?

Best regards,
Jorge

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Discussion
email_chain.body:
Jorge,

Thank you for your interest. I'd be happy to explore this possibility. Could you send me more information about your company and what you envision for this potential acquisition?

Regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Discussion
email_chain.body:
Rob,

I will have our brokerage agreement drafted and sent to you within the next 3 days. We haven't discussed compensation yet, but I'm confident we can find terms that work for both parties.

Thanks for your prompt reply.

Best regards,
Jorge

Sent from my iPad

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Discussion
email_chain.body:
Jorge,

Regarding compensation, could you give me an idea of what kind of fee structure you're considering? I'd like to ensure we're working toward a mutually beneficial arrangement.

Also, I'm curious about your assessment of the local market conditions. We've been hearing concerns about a potential market correction in the near future.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Discussion
email_chain.body:
Rob,

I've reviewed the numbers again, and while they're not quite where we'd like them to be, I still see great potential in this deal. As an alternative approach, I could come in as a silent partner initially, with the option to complete a full buyout later.

Could you share more detailed financial data for our first proper evaluation? I'm looking for a structure that ensures mutual benefit, not just increased sales figures.

Thanks again,
Jorge

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Request - HFO and Gasoil Cargoes
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Chen,

Could you please advise freight rates for the following cargo:

1. 8,000MT of HFO from Dili to Sekondi, payable against B/L (FIO)
2. 7,500MT of Gasoil from Nosy Be to Tema, payable against B/L (FIO)

Your kind response would be much appreciated.

Sincerely,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - HFO and Gasoil Cargoes
email_chain.body:
Dear George,

For the first cargo: 1 x CIF, or if direct berthing at the second port, 2 x CIF
For the second cargo: 2 x FIO, no guarantee (Charter Party may be a good way to go?)

Have a good evening.

Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - HFO and Gasoil Cargoes
email_chain.body:
Dear George,

Geary Tankers B.V. does not have direct experience with HFO cargoes, but for comparison and reference:

Recent comparable trade:
Malange - Pointe Noire
1,500 tons HFO
CIF, double nomination in Porto Amboim
Earnings: $34,000, time charter at $22,000

Current Rotterdam options:
- HFO Rotterdam 9/24/2012: 7,000 tons cargo, USD 33.75/MT
- 1,200 mt HFO, ex-shore Rotterdam, vessel at anchor, USD 34/mt
- HFO Rotterdam 9/20/2012: 4,000 mt HFO

Regards,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - HFO and Gasoil Cargoes
email_chain.body:
Dear George,

For additional reference, Geary Tankers B.V. has handled only two oil contracts previously:

1. Delivery from Curacao to Pointe-a-Pitre, Guadeloupe
2. Sale from Fort-de-France, Martinique to Pointe-a-Pitre

The first case involved 2,000 mt HFO sold to M/S Mayflower Bayside (owned by Epsilon Tankers Corporation, T/A Mayflower Shipping Ltd.) under CIF terms for delivery to Port Louis, Guadeloupe. Note that this particular case involved some legal complications and was not completed.

Regards,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Virginia to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Jack,

I'm trying to secure a spot for 20,000 MT of iron ore from Virginia to Turkey. After-hours berthing is an option, but we're flexible. Could you get back to me with some options for the next week and next month?

Thanks,
Susanna

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Virginia to Turkey
email_chain.body: Just to follow up, we're still in need of options from Turkey. What do you suggest for a daily service to Turkey, starting next week? This is urgent.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Virginia to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Dear Susanna,

Our liners operate out of Virginia, Houston and Long Beach, and to Istanbul, İzmir, Kütahya, and Antalya. We also have a weekly direct service to İzmir from Savannah. It's a fast service, taking about 14 days from loading in the US to discharging in Turkey. If you're interested in shipping from Houston, it's an 11 day trip to Antalya.

All of these routes can be served from one of our 3 weekly services. For a monthly schedule, please visit our website. We don't accept individual bookings, so you would need to find a freight forwarder or consolidator to place your booking.

Regards,
Jack

email_chain.subject: Shipping Query - Milk Powder & Grain from Sydney to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hello Owen,

Our Australian customer wants to ship some powdered milk from Port Botany in Sydney to Tokyo. The contract says 2,500MT, but they might also require 1,500MT of grain. This order will need to leave in the first week of July.

How much would shipping 4,000MT of both goods together cost, and do you see any risk of port congestion?

Many thanks,
Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Query - Milk Powder & Grain from Sydney to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Ivy,

The order for 2,500MT should be manageable. However, regarding the combined shipment with 1,500MT of grain, we cannot find a vessel available to accommodate both cargoes together. While there are still some free slots in July, the total order size limits our options.

We can offer to fit 1,000MT of milk powder and 1,500MT of grain on a 10,000dwt vessel that will complete its previous cargo discharge in July. The vessel details are:

M/V T1
Type: General Cargo
Flag: Liberia
Call Sign: MOYO
Deadweight: 8,600MT
Built: 1996

Best regards,
Owen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Query - Milk Powder & Grain from Sydney to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Ivy,

I should add that port congestion in Australia is worsening, and securing a slot for such a large order may be challenging. The railway terminals are also experiencing overload.

If you can wait until October, I can offer a better slot with more space, which would allow for more cargo capacity or a reduced price.

Please let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Owen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Query - Milk Powder & Grain from Sydney to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Dear Owen,

Thank you for the detailed information. We need to proceed with shipping the 4,000MT cargo in early July as we don't have sufficient storage capacity. Delaying the delivery could lead to product depreciation, so we'll need to stick with the original timeline.

Additionally, we will have more orders to deliver in July. Can you please assist with those as well?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Query - Milk Powder & Grain from Sydney to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hi Ivy,

I understand your urgency and inability to wait until October. I can propose the following solution:

- Ship 1,000MT in July
- Ship either 2,000MT or 3,000MT in August

We can accommodate 2,000MT on a 6,000dwt vessel due for September discharge, or 3,000MT on a 6,500dwt vessel also due for September discharge.

Could you specify whether you prefer to ship the milk powder or grain portion in August?

Regards,
Owen

Sincerely,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Rubber Shipment Inquiry - Shanghai to Salem
email_chain.body:
Dear Sarah,

Glad to get your inquiry. I have just sent an email regarding the new liner service through Hoegh Autoliner 85 and Maersk Ode to our VRS China office. I should note that I'm not directly handling sea transport to India, as that's managed by a different department. However, I can say that Hoegh Autoliner is currently offering attractive FCL rates.

One of our contacts in Taiwan is also interested in this carrier, looking at 10/20 CBM containers, pending government approval. Please wait for our China department's feedback regarding your specific requirements.

Don't hesitate to contact me with any other queries.

Have a nice day!

Yours faithfully,
Rita Lee

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Port Elizabeth to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hey Jeremy,

email_chain.body:
Hi Brian,

No issues, I can make it by mid-March. The vessel will arrive at Port Elizabeth on the 9th, load the cargo on the 10th, and sail immediately. How is your schedule? We can meet on the water on March 9th and the vessel will be anchored outside the port for your cargo.

Can you give me the terminal requirements?

Thanks,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Port Elizabeth to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hey Jeremy,

Sure, I can make it. Can you send me your vessel's details?

Brian

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Port Elizabeth to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hi Brian,

Here are the vessel details:
MV WIDE BEAM 01 (Built 2013)

Best regards,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Port Elizabeth to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeremy,

Thank you for the details. Regarding Port Elizabeth terminal requirements: The port is quite basic, with coal stored at berths up the hill or in side-loading facilities. Loading is done via ash ponds filled from barges, stockpiles, or rail. Average loading rate is 600-800 mt/h, but we can achieve up to 1,500 mt/h under optimal conditions, potentially reaching 2,000 mt/h if coal delivery to berth is efficient.

Please note that March will have low water levels in the port.

Best regards,
Brian

email_chain.subject: Port Equipment and Service Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Bennett,

As a stevedore, you have access to ample cranes and loading equipment, but I understand most shipping companies prefer to hire their own personnel for discharge. We have a reputation for working fast at berthing and cargo operations, ensuring both berthing rights and successful shipments.

What's your experience with crane capacity at your ports, and can you give an estimate on service time for ships 2,600 meters and 6,500m³ cargo capacity?

Thank you,
Edward

email_chain.subject: Re: Length and Capacity
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Bennett,

Thanks for your reply. It appears neither your terminal nor mine has cranes strong enough to handle such large ships. However, we share common interests regarding Grande Comore operations. We both prioritize using reputable ports with quality equipment and speedy service while avoiding overloading.

We need to find a company that can efficiently handle the cargo, as most shipping companies prefer their own discharge personnel due to specialized requirements. Would you be interested in collaborating with our team to find a solution?

Best regards,
Edward

email_chain.subject: Re: Length and Capacity
email_chain.body:
Hi Edward,

What about using a multi-purpose dock, such as Port Natal? They have the most advanced docking equipment and their crews are very experienced. They are also one of the fastest ports in the world with an average unloading time of 15 minutes per ship.

Alternatively, we could consider a third-party port. I know a company called 'Aloha Stevedoring' who can handle your requirements. They have an excellent reputation with top-tier facilities.

All the best,
Cory

email_chain.subject: Re: Third-party option
email_chain.body:
Hi Cory,

I've been discussing this with a contact near our terminal. They've just opened a new facility in the Philippines that can handle vessels of 2,600 meters and 6,500m³ cargo capacity. They're looking to expand operations and are seeking quality partnerships.

I believe they would be interested in working with you. If you'd like to speak with them directly, please let me know.

Best regards,
Edward

email_chain.subject: Re: Third-party option
email_chain.body:
Hi Edward,

I'm actually in the Philippines myself, which is quite fortunate. My company can offer competitive rates and premium service for your cargo handling needs. We should discuss specific loading rates and service terms.

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Cory

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body:
The total capacity required is 36,000 metric tonnes of glycol from Mexico to Luanda in Angola. Could you please advise on any suitable vessels?

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body:
Regarding your inquiry for 36,000 metric tonnes of glycol from Mexico to Luanda, I have a vessel available.

Volume calculations:
36,000 MT = 36,000,000 kg = 3,600 m3 (at density of 1 ton/m3)

The vessel has a capacity of 5,500,000 litres (5,500 m3), which would be suitable for your cargo.

The shipment costs US$100,000, which can be deducted from the commission payable to us.

Please let me know if this meets your requirements.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body:
The price per litre is $10, so 5,500 m3 of glycol is worth US$55,000.
The net profit for the shippers would be US$55,000 - US$100,000 = -US$45,000.

Let me know how you feel about this arrangement.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body:
If this offer is accepted, I will issue a commission invoice as follows:

Net profit: $55,000
Commission (5%): $2,750
Balance due: $52,250

Please deposit the balance in my bank account, and you will receive the remaining $100,000 less commission.

I will provide a contract for your signature. Please review and return a signed copy.

Let me know if you have any questions about this arrangement.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body:
Thank you. I have signed and returned the contract.

Please provide the bank account details where I should deposit the balance of $52,250.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body:
Thank you. The bank details have been provided.
Please confirm once you have made the deposit.

Regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body: The balance showing in my account is US$50,000. Please let me know if you have any queries.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Glycol Mexico to Angola
email_chain.body: Many thanks for your cooperation. The shippers' bank details have been provided to you. Please arrange for the payment to be made and advise once completed.

Stanley

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Sumatra to Suez
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

Thank you for your inquiry through E&T Group regarding iron ore transport from Indonesia.

We can offer transport for 20,000mt of iron ore (Fe 62%) with a laycan from 1st August to 1st September. Loading will be from the Sumatra region.

Please note that all offers should be made on a non-negotiable basis (ex works) in USD, based on the FOB Hamburg price of iron ore (US$78/mt).

Kindly let us know if you would like to proceed with freight and sailing cost details.

Best regards,
Jake Mueller

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Inspection Requirements
email_chain.body:
Dear Stanley,

Apologies for the delay. We've been addressing issues with bills of lading.

Regarding the cargo inspection at discharge port, this will need to be arranged through your broker or agent. We've removed the clause making us responsible for inspection duration from the bill of lading.

Please note that your client will be responsible for customs clearance at the discharge port. We understand you're working with our port agent on documentation, but please let us know if you need any assistance.

Best regards,
Jake

email_chain.subject: Re: Discharge Port Change - Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Jake,

I hope you're well. The client has changed the discharge port from Hamburg to Antwerp, Belgium. The cargo is already on board and sailing, so we had to sign a bill of lading without prior notification.

We will contact your agent in Antwerp to ensure proper documentation for cargo clearance.

Please send us a copy of the bill of lading when possible, and we await confirmation of the inspection schedule.

Regards,
Stanley

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Clearance Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Stanley,

Our agent in Antwerp has confirmed that all necessary documents have been filed and the cargo is cleared.

The inspection is scheduled for tomorrow morning at 9 AM.

I will forward the bill of lading copy shortly.

Regards,
Jake

email_chain.subject: Container Ship Investment Query
email_chain.body:
Hello Sir,

I'm considering an investment in the container shipping industry and would appreciate your thoughts. Do you think a large container ship will be built in China? Additionally, would it be better to own a small container ship outright or to have a partial interest in a large container vessel?

Thank you,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Ship Investment Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Since my last email, I've been studying a comprehensive book on the container shipping business and have developed some additional insights.

The shipping market is currently very strong, and I believe the container shipping industry will continue to grow. After analyzing the options, I'm leaning towards a specific conclusion: it appears more advantageous to own a small container ship outright rather than holding a partial interest in a large vessel.

I would appreciate your thoughts on this assessment.

Thank you,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Ship Investment Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

After further research and careful consideration of the container shipping business, I've reached a firm conclusion. I am now convinced that owning a small container ship outright is the better strategy compared to having a partial interest in a large vessel. This approach offers more stability and control in the long term.

I look forward to your response regarding this decision.

Thank you,
Andre

Amanda

email_chain.subject: Caprolactam Cargo Inquiry - Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We'd like to cargo 300MT of caprolactam from Cotonou to Dover. Could you suggest if after-hours berthing is available and if we could load on a vessel berthed at a berth located in the South Container Terminal?

Regards,
Pauline

email_chain.subject: Re: Caprolactam Cargo Inquiry - Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Thanks Pauline,

I checked the schedules and I think you mean the Commodore. This is our weekly spot cargo service, loading containers for France.

The Commodore berths at the South Container Terminal but we can't berth there this week. There are no slots available and the berths have to be occupied in a particular order.

South Container Terminal berths are occupied in this order:
5, 1, 2, 4, 7, 3, 6

This week we have the Commodore coming in from Kingston on Wednesday. This is the first available berth for that vessel so we are expecting her to be berthed at 6 South. The ship is due to sail to Cherbourg on Friday night.

I hope this helps.

Regards,
Geraldine

email_chain.subject: Re: Caprolactam Cargo Inquiry - Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

Do you know which berth and slot the next Commodore is going to berth? We've had cargo arriving and other cargo waiting for loading so we could try and get an early booking.

Regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Re: Caprolactam Cargo Inquiry - Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We will need some bulk cargo loading in the next few days. Could we get some advice as to which berths will be free next week?

Thanks,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Business Levels Discussion
email_chain.body:
Deidra,

I thought it would be useful to start a dialogue about the current flat situation. Do you agree that January levels are unsustainable and, if so, what will it take to increase business?

With best regards,
Teo

email_chain.subject: Re: Business Levels Discussion
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I cannot say more at this point. However, I believe we could start a conversation by considering reducing prices to the point where we could generate a large volume of business again. What do you think about this approach?

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Business Levels Discussion
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I am not against the idea but I need to be convinced that it is good for the business in the long term. Nevertheless, I acknowledge that January levels are unsustainable and it is better to consider reducing prices and increase the volume of business rather than going down the road of layoffs.

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Business Levels Discussion
email_chain.body:
Teo,

Let us continue our conversation to define together what our level of business in the short and long term would be in a scenario of sustained price reduction. What is your current opinion on that point?

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.body:

My name is Douglas Brown, director of Romco Mining Ltd. We specialize in mining and exporting various types of coal globally.

Our steam coal specifications are as follows:
- Sulphur: 1.5% max
- Calorific Value: 6,000 kcal/kg min

- Moisture Content: 5% max

- Other Minerals: 18% max

Please provide your target price CIF Antofagasta, and we will review it accordingly.

Best regards,
Douglas Brown
Romco Mining Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Steam Coal Inquiry - 150MT to Tocopilla
email_chain.body:

We look forward to receiving your offers. Meanwhile, please visit our website for detailed information about our company, subsidiaries, and operations. We've recently updated our mobile-responsive site with virtual tours of our mining operations and processing facilities.

Regards,
Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Steam Coal Inquiry - 150MT to Tocopilla
email_chain.body:

I've reviewed your website and am impressed with its professional layout and comprehensive information. The Product section's quality specifications, Health and Safety protocols, and Environmental commitments are particularly noteworthy.

Could you please send us your product prices and complete specifications?

Best regards,
Douglas Brown

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Singapore to Colombo Motor Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Batra,

We expect to ship 3,000MT of motors from Singapore to Colombo by April 1st. Would your vessel be available for a short term voyage, and are you flexible on ballast condition?

Best regards,
Ernest

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Singapore to Colombo Motor Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ernest,

The 'Coastline' is currently berthed at Kakinada on Indian coast and I expect to receive her draft survey report around the 25th. Her charterers are currently assessing the bunkers required for Singapore, however, we may be able to depart for Singapore as early as 26th March.

Regarding ballast conditions, you could also consider 'Coastline's' current charterers (i.e. 'Sambalino' of the same owners) as they will be arriving from a short haul fixture and may be able to proceed immediately to the loading port in ballast. Alternatively, you may proceed ballast and obtain fuel in advance of loading.

Please let me know if you require any additional information.

Best regards,
Raj Batra

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Singapore to Colombo Motor Shipment
Re: Vessel Inquiry - Singapore to Colombo Motor Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Batra,

Thank you for sending the Sambalino draft survey. I am pleased to inform you that Sambalino would arrive in 6 days. Please revert for further details. We are expecting to send the draft survey of the Coastline shortly.

Best regards,
Ernest

email_chain.subject: DFRA Vessel Freight Rate Discussion
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I am sorry that we didn't find a solution for the cargoes on the DFRA vessels. I understand that if my offer of $5.25 is not satisfactory, then a freight rate should be negotiated at the price of an alternative vessel.

I look forward to hearing your proposal.

Many thanks,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: DFRA Vessel Freight Rate Discussion
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ed,

We regret that DFRA was not able to fulfill the commitment given to you regarding the sea-going vessel and express our sympathy for the difficulties this must have caused your company.

If you would like to enter into discussions for a future contract, we will gladly take this up with you. Regarding payment for the cargoes already on board, this may be possible, though not at a rate higher than $5.25 as previously quoted.

We await your instructions.

With best wishes,
Cullen

email_chain.subject: Re: DFRA Vessel Freight Rate Discussion
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I understand the rate cannot exceed $5.25, but I must make an urgent appeal. We have just discovered we are in serious financial difficulty and may struggle to make payroll next week. Given your company's position, I'm hoping you might show some flexibility. We are reliable partners and will ensure full payment once we overcome this temporary setback.

Please consider allowing us use of your vessel under adjusted terms.

Best regards,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: DFRA Vessel Freight Rate Discussion
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ed,

I'm sorry to hear about your financial difficulties. However, I must maintain our position as per the contract terms. We cannot adjust the rate of $5.25. I hope you understand this business decision and are able to find alternative solutions for your immediate challenges.

Regards,
Cullen

email_chain.body:
Hi Rudi,

Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipment to Durban - Payment Query
email_chain.body:
Peter,

A short while ago you offered to carry goods on my behalf to Durban, for which I was to pay you US$2800. I have made this payment but have not heard from you or your company since. Could you please confirm receipt of the money and provide an update?

I'd really appreciate your swift response.

Regards,
Rudi

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipment to Durban - Payment Query
email_chain.body:
Rudi,

Thanks for your patience. One of our cargoes has been held at customs in South Africa due to documentation issues - the cargo is ours but the papers are in another company's name. I've just spoken with customs and they've agreed to release the goods. Once this is resolved and I receive the associated funds, I will arrange for your payment to be returned.

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipment to Durban - Payment Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Thanks for your email. I'm concerned about your explanation regarding the funds. Could you please clarify what you mean by your money failing to get through? I need more details about this situation.

Regards,
Rudi

email_chain.subject: Rate Request - Chemical Shipment Westport to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Ms. Helberg,

We've got a 5,000MT of chemicals requiring transport from Westport, LA to Long Beach, CA. Could you please provide your rate quote for this shipment? Also, could you advise on any current dock congestion situations at Long Beach?

Thank you,
Adam

email_chain.subject: RE: Rate Request - Chemical Shipment Westport to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Adam,

Good day! Thank you for your inquiry. I must inform you that we currently don't have local agents at Westport. We only operate shipments from LA, Long Beach, or Hueneme ports.

This means we cannot arrange local delivery pickups or handle port activities at Westport. These would need to be arranged by the shipment owner or a third-party company.

For reference, our current rates for similar shipments from our operating ports to Long Beach are:
- Ocean Freight: USD 1,862
- Port Charges: USD 1,858

We're currently offering a 6% discount on our services, which would result in savings of approximately USD 362.

Please let me know if you would like to discuss alternative arrangements through our operating ports.

Best regards,
Ms. Helberg

email_chain.subject: Vehicle Shipment Request - Houston to Long Beach
email_chain.body:

We would like to make a shipment of the following vehicles:

Vehicle Type    Qty    HHL

email_chain.subject: Re: Vehicle Shipment Request - Houston to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hello Neil,

Your request was sent to my attention as we are looking into our system to determine if we can accommodate the vehicle shipment request. We are having difficulty communicating with our warehouse operation at this time, and I need to discuss your shipment request with them.

You will be notified as soon as I receive a response.

Thank you for your patience,
Lina O'Neil

email_chain.subject: Re: Vehicle Shipment Request - Houston to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
