If you would like more information, please contact Mr. Brian Brady in Houston. Brian is the warehouse manager, and he has the authority to address your concerns directly.

Regards,
Lina O'Neil

email_chain.subject: Transport Query - Used Milkers Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Hey Jane,

Interested in taking on a cargo of used milkers. If we could move the milkers from Lydenburg, RSA to Gaborone, Botswana, can you send us the details for loading and unloading on each side, then a complete logistics and transport plan?

Sincerely,
Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Query - Used Milkers Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Our milkers will arrive on 28 July 2016 from Cape Town to Lydenburg by ship. If you can receive these milkers by road and transport them from Lydenburg to Gaborone, Botswana, please let us know your plans and the cost of the transport.

Sincerely,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Query - Used Milkers Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Yes, we can take the milkers off the ship at Lydenburg and transport them from there to Gaborone. We will use our tippers and 40ft containers for transporting these milkers. We will receive them and bring them to Gaborone where you will be able to pick them up.

Cost of transport will be:
- Lydenburg to Gaborone: R7000 per tipper
- Load, transport and discharge at Gaborone: R12,000 per container

Please let us know when you will receive the milkers on the ship in Lydenburg so that we can plan our collection.

Sincerely,
Bridget

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Query - Used Milkers Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the logistics plan. The milkers will arrive on 27 July 2016 at 09:00. The ship will berth in Lydenburg at 09:00 and will be at anchor waiting for customs clearance and other paperwork.

Please pick the milkers off the ship at 09:00 as the captain of the ship will sail at 13:00 to Cape Town.

Also, please let us know if you want to transport these milkers from Lydenburg to Gaborone by tippers or trucks, and we will prepare an order for the milkers.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.body:

From: Guangzhou, China
Destination: Manila, Philippines
Quantity: 2,000MT (approximately 28,000 boxes, Gross 1000@1.2Tons)

Payment Terms:
- Bank Letter of Credit to Kimono Inc. (Korean Export Company)
- 60% in US Dollar via Bank Cashier Check
- Balance upon inspection confirmation at origin

Export License: All necessary customs and commercial licenses will be provided

Delivery Time:
- Sea freight: 21 days ex-work
- Air freight option: 15-30 days

Sincerely yours,
Drew Wong

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - Rubber Shipment GZ to Manila
email_chain.body:
Dear Drew,

Here are our shipping terms:

1. Letter of Credit required in favor of Hapag-Lloyd
2. All taxes, duties, and associated costs (local, state and federal) are your responsibility
3. Shipment costs including packing and insurance to be borne by your company
4. Payment due on the 10th day of the last month of every quarter
5. Shipping schedule to be coordinated between your company and Hapag-Lloyd
6. Delivery within 30 days of shipment date

Rate: USD 2,500.00 per tonne
Total for 28,000 boxes: USD 70,000

Best regards,
Ting

email_chain.body:

We would like to confirm our offer for the owners terms and conditions for the following vessel for the next port survey:

Vessel: Vinmar
No. of Cargo hold: 6
Draft: 12.40 m
TPC: 13,070
DWT: 15,435

We offer the owners warranty on the size of hatch 9.8 m x 21.0 m, instead of 10,000 mts. We would have no additional upcharge. Owners will bear the DPU notice requirement, but have the free pratique.

Best regards,
Mr. Ben Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Survey Inquiry - MV Vinmar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lee,

This is to confirm that we have received your reply to our enquiry for the upcoming port survey.

1) We will consider your offer, but we want to reconfirm that we would have no additional upcharge.
2) We understand that owners will bear the DPU notice requirement, but have the free pratique.
3) Also we would like to confirm that your warranty on the size of hatch would be sufficient for loading 10,000 tons of bulk fertiliser.

Could you confirm and let us know if there are any other requirements?

Best regards,
Will

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Survey Inquiry - MV Vinmar
email_chain.body:

I confirm all points: no additional upcharge, owners will bear DPU notice requirement with free pratique, and the hatch size is sufficient for loading 10,000 tons of bulk fertiliser. There are no other requirements.

Best regards,
Ben Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Survey Inquiry - MV Vinmar

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Charter Requirements and T&Cs
email_chain.body:
Jack,

As mentioned earlier, please see attached our company's terms and conditions for signature. We will send you the same request as sent to LME.

Regarding our booking requirements, we are willing to book 5-7 vessels on a voyage charter basis for 1,000-10,000MT with the following specifications:

Commodity: JP54
Origin: Asia
Destination: West Africa
1 or 2 vessels with DAP or CIF for each cargo

We would also like to charter additional vessels on shorter routes for 1-2 weeks each under the same freight terms.

Please arrange these chartered vessels for June and July bookings.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Documentation Follow-up and August Bookings
email_chain.body:
Jack,

Just checking if you've received and signed the attached documents. We have received signed copies from all your brokers which will be forwarded to you.

Regarding the additional chartered vessels, there is significant uncertainty in both Asia and West Africa markets, which may impact vessel availability. We will provide options where possible.

We've prepared a list of cargoes for booking in the first week of August. Please see attached.

Look forward to your comments.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent - Asia Cargo Options Required
email_chain.body:
Jack,

It has been over 4 weeks since our last email. We urgently need options on the Asia cargo. We have requested this from your broker LME, but have received no response.

Regards

email_chain.subject: Final Notice - Vessel Options Required
email_chain.body:
Jack,

I am writing to you as the owner of General Products. We have sent multiple requests regarding chartered vessels without response. We need you to provide options for these cargoes urgently.

We have attached the charter vessels and cargoes under consideration again. Please review and respond with available options so we can proceed with arrangements.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Termination of Business Relationship
email_chain.body:
Jack,

It is with disappointment that I must inform you we have chosen to work with another company to secure our vessels. The lack of timely response has made it impossible to proceed with our booking requirements.

Regards

email_chain.subject: Sugar Cargo Inquiry - Santos to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

I'm looking for 12,000MT of sugar from Santos to Saudi Arabia in June. Also, are you familiar with fixtures coming from Santos?

Thank you,
Victoria

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Cargo Inquiry - Santos to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

I understand you would like to get your query regarding sugar vessel. Please provide the following information:

- Which specific berth in Santos?
- When is your exact delivery period in June?
- What is the rate you would like to pay?
- Can you confirm the sugar quantity is 12,000MT?

Please provide more information so we can assist you better.

Regards,
Pedro

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Cargo Inquiry - Santos to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Morning!

I realize we haven't discussed the specific berth in Santos. Please advise which berths you can work with, so we can determine if we're able to proceed.

Regards,
Victoria

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipping Quote Request - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Salter,

Could you provide us with an estimate for shipping 7,000MT of crude oil from Dhaka to Miami, including any necessary insurance charges?

Kind regards,
Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipping Quote Request - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Dear Brijesh,

Thank you for your inquiry. The estimated shipping cost would be $9,288 for the route and cargo size specified. I'll be happy to provide more details as needed.

Best regards,
Rishi Salter

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipping Quote Request - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Salter,

Thank you for the quote of $9,288. Could you please clarify if this is a one-time charge or recurring? If recurring, I would appreciate a monthly breakdown of charges with some recent examples.

Best regards,
Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipping Quote Request - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Hi Brijesh,

Unfortunately, due to recent global economic turbulence, our prices have increased. We currently charge around $3,000 per MT for shipping crude oil from Dhaka to Miami. The prices will be more fixed after April 30th. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Regards,
Rishi Salter

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipping Quote Request - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Hi Rishi,

Thank you for the update. Would it be possible to get an indication of what the fixed price might be after April 30th? Also, could you please provide more details about your shipping services?

Best regards,
Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipment Dubai-Osaka Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Saba,

Can you handle 5,000MT of crude oil shipment from Dubai to Osaka by mid-May? Also, please clarify your liability provisions in case of non-fulfillment of the C/P terms.

Kind regards,
Muhammad

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Dubai-Osaka Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Muhammad,

Yes, we can accommodate the shipment of 5,000MT crude oil from Dubai to Osaka with delivery by mid-May. Please note that standard C/P terms and liabilities will apply as per our usual agreement.

Best regards,
Mrs. Saba

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Dubai-Osaka Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Saba,

As per our contract for the transport of 5,000 MT of crude oil from Dubai to Osaka by mid-May, we are still awaiting your response regarding the specific vessel details and schedule confirmation.

Please provide this information at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Muhammad

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Dubai-Osaka Query - URGENT
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Saba,

I must emphasize that you have a contractual obligation to transport 5,000 MT of crude oil from Dubai to Osaka by mid-May. Your continued silence regarding vessel details and schedule confirmation is concerning.

We urgently await your response to fulfill the terms of our agreement.

Regards,
Muhammad

email_chain.subject: CIF Rate Request - Black Sea to Thailand Oil Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Chang,

Could you provide your CIF rate on a clean cargo of oil from the Black Sea to Thailand, with 10-14 day laycan and 30 days free time at discharge port?

Warm Regards,
Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: CIF Rate Request - Black Sea to Thailand Oil Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Chen,

Thank you for your inquiry. The CIF rate is USD 28.58/MT plus a premium on MT/MT ASP/ICE Brent of USD 0.28 per MT/MT.

Could you please provide your company details, port of discharge, vessel size and cargo size requirements so we can provide further details?

Warm Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Fertilizer Cargo Yanbu to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Fernandez,

Can your vessel load 9,000MT of fertilizer from Yanbu to Long Beach? Kindly also advise what documentation is required and any terms & conditions attached.

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Fertilizer Cargo Yanbu to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Nigel,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Please take note that we do not provide chartering services. I also highly suggest arranging for a visit with your colleagues to our yard so we could better explain to them the scale of our operation.

Please let us know if we can assist you in any other way.

Kind regards,
Kerwin

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Fertilizer Cargo Yanbu to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Kerwin,

Sorry for the delay in replying. I've attached our client's details and our Terms & Conditions for bulk cargoes for your review.

We are looking forward to our cooperation.

Many thanks and best regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Fertilizer Cargo Yanbu to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Kerwin,

Thank you. However, could you kindly clarify the following:

Would your yard be able to handle a vessel of the size: 300m x 36m x 13m deep?

Could you kindly also advise:
1. The soil forking reach to the yard (from the berth)?
2. How deep your yard is?
3. The dimensions of your yard?

Best regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Fertilizer Cargo Yanbu to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Nigel,

Sorry for the delay in replying. I've attached the vessel specifications and yard drawings as requested. Our yard has a soil forking reach of 38m from the berth and we have 5.8m draught available inside our dock. The dimensions of our dock is 320m length by 30m width.

Please let me know if you have any other questions.

Regards,
Kerwin

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Transport Inquiry - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
To Whom It May Concern,

I require a tanker to transport 4,000MT of crude oil from Saudi Arabia to Oman. Could you provide your best rate, and what does your typical laytime policy look like?

Sincerely,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Transport Inquiry - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

I can accommodate your shipment in my tanker at a freight rate of $15 per MT. The laytime policy for oil tanker shipments is generally a maximum of 14 days, but I would like to clarify with you the details of the shipment and payment to schedule the loading and confirmation of laytime. Please revert to me.

With regards,
Zachary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Transport Inquiry - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Dear Zachary,

I hope this message finds you well. Regarding the shipment, here are the details:

* Destination: Shallow seaport in Oman
* Volume: 4,000MT
* Delivery: January 15-30

The freight rate of $15 per MT sounds good, and I agree to confirm the details of the shipment and payment as well.

Sincerely,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Transport Inquiry - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Dear Zachary,

Regarding your message, I would like to confirm the payment for the shipment as well. Please let me know the total amount and the payment method so we can finalize the details.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Transport Inquiry - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Hello Mike,

Here's the calculation. The total cost for the shipment is $60,000 and the payment method is 50% in advance and 50% after the completion of the shipment.

Best regards,
Zachary

email_chain.subject: Import Regulations Query - Canada
email_chain.body:
Can you please advise on the current import restrictions and requirements for electronics and medical products into Canada? We have a client looking to establish regular shipments and need to ensure compliance with all regulations.

email_chain.subject: RE: Shipment Status Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Roger,

I'm writing to inform you that your shipment has arrived at our Toronto facility and is awaiting processing. However, we've noticed some issues with the pallet packaging and weight distribution that need to be addressed before we can proceed with loading.

Could you please provide guidance on how you'd like to handle this situation?

Best regards,

email_chain.subject: RE: RE: Shipment Status Update
email_chain.body:
Mike,

I apologize for my delayed response as I was away on business. I'm concerned to hear that the shipment has been sitting in the receiving bay since November 5th with minimal progress. Regarding the pallet issues, I'll have our shipping department contact you directly to resolve the weight and packaging concerns.

Best regards,
Roger Green
Senior Associate
R. & M. Green Co.
1726 2nd Street
Liverpool, Ohio 43402

email_chain.subject: Review of Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Good morning Brian,

Thank you for sending the materials for review. I've reviewed the proposal and have attached my questions regarding Mr. Blanchard's letter. As I'm new to working with your company, please confirm if these questions are appropriate.

Additionally, could you please clarify the transit time calculations? While I understand the times provided are averages, your proposal mentioned timing from receipt to dispatch. We need to know if there are specific required dates for container arrival at the destination port.

Best regards,
Kaylene Smith
Export Sales
A.S.A. Co.
6019 Hartsfield Court
Monmouth, Illinois 61462

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request - Cardboard Boxes to Singapore

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request - Cardboard Boxes to Singapore

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Request - Cardboard Boxes to Singapore
email_chain.body:
John,

We can offer 20-foot containers which can accommodate...
[Email appears to be incomplete]

email_chain.subject: Outstanding Payment - March Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I am still awaiting payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that you purchased from us back in March. Could you please confirm when you are expecting to pay?

Kindest Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Re: Outstanding Payment - March Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I am still awaiting payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that you purchased from us back in March. I really do hope this isn't another one of your stunts, as you promised that payment would be made before now.

If you fail to pay within 7 days of receiving this message, I will be forced to contact our solicitors and take action against you. I hope this is not required.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Legal Action - March Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I have now had to refer your company to our solicitors in regards to the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that you purchased from us back in March. This has now been ongoing for almost 12 months, and you have continuously promised payment yet failed to do so.

You have now wasted a considerable amount of our time with your constant lies and I am extremely upset by this. This is the final time I will be contacting you, and I advise that you take this matter very seriously as our solicitors will be taking action against your company.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - London to Philadelphia Flour Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - London to Philadelphia Flour Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Murphy,

Please let me know if you need any additional information.

Tom Rogers

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment Inquiry - Korea to NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mohamed,

It's been almost a month since we last communicated. I was hoping you might be able to help me secure a tanker for a methanol shipment from South Korea to New Zealand. The tonnage required is 8,000 dwt, and we're looking at loading dates from mid to late May.

Let me know if you need further details and I can send across more information.

Regards,
Brad

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry - Korea to NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Thompson,

Thank you for your email. Our organization works with a network of trading companies, and we can assist with fuel supply to New Zealand. We would be interested in exploring a partnership opportunity for this requirement.

Please let me know if you need any additional information from our side.

Regards,
Khadija

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry - Korea to NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Khadija,

Regarding the recent correspondence, we need to conduct some due diligence. Could you confirm if this proposal has been shared with other parties, and if so, how many?

Additionally, we've received some concerning reports about potentially non-compliant activities. As we maintain strict compliance standards, we need to investigate these claims thoroughly. Please be advised that any verified non-compliance will result in immediate account suspension and appropriate legal action.

Best regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: BECS Quote for Sines-Rotterdam-Houston Route
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

Your BECS (Bunker Environmental Compliance Surcharge) is competitive for a trip from Sines to Houston via Rotterdam. Can we discuss adding this trip to our book and what you can offer?

Best,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Re: BECS Quote for Sines-Rotterdam-Houston Route
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

Sorry for the delay. We've completed our interview with a seafarer at work in the industry and I wanted to follow up with you for any new information you might have.

What was the final BECS quote you received?

Thank you,
Isaac

email_chain.subject: Re: BECS Quote for Sines-Rotterdam-Houston Route
email_chain.body:
Anne,

I just got the bill from my employers for fuel and BECS. It looks like I am paying 2600 euros and my employer is charging 6500. That's approximately $7000. Do you think there is any way to reconcile this discrepancy?

Isaac

email_chain.subject: LNG Freight Enquiry - US Gulf to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Mr. Parkin,

Can you please provide a freight estimate for 6,000MT of LNG from Mopan in the US Gulf to Antwerp in July. Is port rotation compulsory for this service?

Kind Regards,
Cassie

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Freight Enquiry - US Gulf to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Manwell,

Thank you for your enquiry. We have prepared a proposal for the movement of 6,000MT of LNG from the US Gulf to Antwerp in July. The price can be structured in two ways:

1. Fixed FOB rate as detailed in the proposal
2. FCN basis with a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM based on the cargo declaration

In both scenarios, the CIF rate would be fixed, with cargo delivery to the discharge port on the same day. Regarding port rotation, this would be at the shipper's request and subject to prior agreement between all parties.

Please review the proposal and return a copy of the commercial terms (either C/P or C&F).

Best regards,
James Parkin

email_chain.subject: GCM/Voyage Charterparty - CBM Rate Discussion
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

Regarding our recent communications, our chartering division has consulted with London about the GCM/Voyage charterparty provisions (as drafted by BIMCO).

The current charterparty specifies a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM for FCN charters. However, our client Shell has indicated they cannot proceed with this arrangement for LNG shipments unless the CBM charge is reduced to below 90 cents per CBM.

We therefore request BIMCO to consider revising the relevant provision in the GCM/Voyage Charterparty accordingly.

Best regards,
David Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: GCM/Voyage Charterparty - Proposed Amendment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

Following our previous communication, please find below our proposed amendment to the current GCM/Voyage charterparty draft:

18.30.1 Freight shall be calculated at 1.20/cbm based on the CBM declared by the cargo

This amendment would be effective for cargoes delivered after January 1st, 2023.

Please advise if this amendment is acceptable, and we will proceed with BIMCO accordingly.

Best regards,
David Smith

email_chain.subject: Available adhesives space? Antwerp to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Olsen,

Could you handle a 2,600MT cargo of adhesives from Antwerp to Liverpool before month's end? Also, can you provide your typical demurrage and dispatch rates?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Available bitumen space? Yanbu to Jeddah
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Dorsey,

Got a question: any chance you have space this week for 4,800MT of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah? Please let me know if demurrage might be an issue.

Cheers,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Petcoke Cargo Inquiry - Port Elizabeth
email_chain.body:
Greetings Mrs. Bird,

We are waiting on a number of tenders for an 8,000MT cargo of dry petcoke to Port Elizabeth. We're currently unsure if the US Gulf can produce enough tonnage to meet our requirements. Can you please provide some estimated tonnages, and inform us of any other points of origin that could be competitive?

Kind regards,
Lewis

email_chain.subject: Re: Petcoke Cargo Inquiry - Port Elizabeth
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

The M/V Ostende is due to load a cargo of Petcoke from Grays Harbor and delivery is scheduled for early November. The US Gulf is the only origin that we can produce in volume. We currently expect to have sufficient petcoke available to meet all of our charterers requirements.

Please note you will need to present your documentary requirements including:
- Full set of Bills of Lading (BLs)
- Charter Party
- LPA Form 1
- Most recent IOPPCA

The US Gulf produces 3 grades of petcoke:
1. Very fine grade
2. Course grade
3. Lamellar (wax contaminated) grade

We are able to book all 3 grades of petcoke on an as-available basis.

Best regards,
Sarah Bird

email_chain.subject: Dry Petcoke Availability Nov-Dec
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

We shall have dry petcoke available for November and December loading. We can offer about 10,000-15,000MT per load.

Please advise if you would like us to provide pricing including the cost index.

Kind regards,
Wei Shan

email_chain.subject: PVC Shipment to Manila - Laycan Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Luca,

Could we get our 8,600MT shipment of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) to Manila delivered on time? Let us know if you have room on your laycan this week, and how quickly we can get the freight rate confirmed.

Thank you,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: PVC Shipment to Manila - Laycan Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

You sent me a confirmation from Sofia last week, but unfortunately they cancelled it when they received the revised request for freight and the quote for 1,650,000ft² in which we required that they make it 100% Ullage and also allowed for the customs duties and transportation cost to Sofia to be paid from their end.

If you were to confirm the space, the cargo would be allowed to be imported under the Free on Board Freight term, in which the clearance cost and custom duties are the responsibility of the shipper.

Please let me know the best way forward as soon as you can.

Kind regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: PVC Shipment to Manila - Laycan Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

You may be interested to know we've reached an agreement with our supplier to get the entire shipment delivered for 14,400 USD! Great news! Please confirm our booking as soon as you can.

Regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: PVC Shipment to Manila - Laycan Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

I'm writing to you again to let you know that we're still waiting to hear about our shipment. I hope you're able to take the time to reply soon.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: PVC Shipment to Manila - Laycan Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Luca,

I have been tasked with looking after the quotation you sent to my company. I would like to know when you are going to send me the quotation documents?

Kind Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipment Invoice Discrepancy
email_chain.body:

The coal shipment from last month was supposed to be 15,000MT but the final invoice was for 30,000MT. We need a swift resolution for this, can you please provide us with a new invoice?

Yours Sincerely,
Simplice

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Invoice Discrepancy
email_chain.body:
Dear Simplice,

This is not the first time I'm receiving similar complaints. The new invoice is not your fault. The information we have is that the coal came in 30,000MT instead of 15,000MT. But you can rest assured that we are going to check this ourselves and provide you with a new invoice in less than two weeks.

Yours Sincerely,
Hanz

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipment Destination Change Request - Pulau Belawan to Muara Berau

Makara

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Destination Change Request - Pulau Belawan to Muara Berau
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Destination Change Request - Pulau Belawan to Muara Berau
email_chain.body:

However, we will do our best to assist you with your transportation needs. Our vessel is currently sailing from Muara Berau towards Pulau Belawan and we estimate arrival at Muara Berau on 13 May. Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Destination Change Request - Pulau Belawan to Muara Berau
email_chain.body:

In order to minimize your waiting time, we have found a tugboat service company that has vessels available near Jakarta, which is about 12 hours away from Muara Berau. Their pricing is higher than our normal tugboat services but they are able to guarantee availability within 48 hours. Would you like us to proceed with this option?

Kindly confirm your decision.

Best regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment Panama-Nantes

email_chain.subject: Re: Missing Delivery Documents

email_chain.subject: Re: Document Analysis
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Document Verification
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Document Verification
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Star Bright - Grain Cargo Inquiry Santos to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Mary,

We have a grain cargo inquiry for your consideration:
- 60,000MT soybeans
- Santos to Qingdao

email_chain.subject: Potential Organizational Changes
email_chain.body:
Hello Jorge,

I hope you and your family are doing well.

I've enjoyed working with you over the last couple of years, and I'm sure I'm not the only one who feels this way.

Although our current business outlook is positive, I feel I should inform you that there may be some changes ahead due to merger and alignment discussions happening in the background. This might affect our working relationship moving forward.

Best wishes,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Seeking Advice - Company Leadership Transition
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Munoz,

I hope you are doing well. We met briefly at the last GM Conference, though we haven't had the opportunity to speak since then.

I'm writing because I'm concerned about our company's current situation. As you may have heard, our CEO, Mr. Smith, is departing and is reportedly joining JPS. This news has significantly impacted our market performance, with our stock dropping 8 percent on the day of the announcement.

The board plans to appoint an interim CEO while conducting a search for a permanent successor. While the timing is less than ideal, the transition appears unavoidable.

I would greatly appreciate your insights on how we might best navigate this situation.

Best regards,
Jeff

Paul

John

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor Pricing - Hamburg/Singapore Route

Regards,
Claudio

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor Pricing - Hamburg/Singapore Route
email_chain.body:

That's interesting. Could you tell me anything more about them? What makes them different from others?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor Pricing - Hamburg/Singapore Route
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

They are absolutely different from the rest of the players in the market. They are very conservative and they are not satisfied with the current low margins.

Regards,
Claudio

- What is the quantity in one shipment?
- Is this 1 shipment or a continuous cargo?
- Is this contract or spot charter?

email_chain.subject: Question about Angular Forms Module Implementation
email_chain.body:
Hi Angular Support Team,

I'm having some issues implementing email validation in our Angular application. Could you provide guidance on the proper way to handle email input validation?

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Angular Forms Module Implementation
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

For email validation in Angular 2+, you'll need to:

1. Import FormsModule using: import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms'
2. Add FormsModule to the imports array in your @NgModule declaration: imports: [ BrowserModule, FormsModule ]
3. Add [email] to your input tag

Let me know if you need any clarification.

Best,
Angular Support Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about Angular Forms Module Implementation
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the quick response!

I implemented the changes as suggested. The FormsModule integration was indeed quite straightforward. At the end of the day, it was more trivial than I expected.

Appreciate your help!

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Question about refractive index equations in your Nature article
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Berg,

I read your recent article in Nature about reflective materials with great interest. You presented two equations for refractive index, and I'm particularly interested in finding a proof or derivation for the one involving lambda and n. Could you point me to any references for this?

Thank you,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: f2=1-2n
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Thank you for your message. The equation n=1-sqrt(1-f)/2 is a very general one that appears in most textbooks on electromagnetism and optics. I included the reference in my Nature paper on page 3. You can also find it in more recent books on plasmonics, such as Jain's work.

Best regards,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Re: f2=1-2n
email_chain.body:
Hello Dr. Berg,

Specifically, I'm looking for the derivation of the equation f2=1-2n, where n=4*Pi/lambda*d*n*d. Do you have any notes or references for this particular form?

Thanks,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: f2=1-2n
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

I can suggest two key references:

(1) P. Drude, Handbuch der Radiologie, Leipzig: Barth, 1922 (p. 369)

(2) N. Jain, C. J. Kryzhanovsky, and C. H. Chen, Excitation and Detection of Surface Plasmons on Gold Films. In: T. Zimmermann, and A. Berger, eds., Coherence, Statistics, and Quantum Optics IV (Springer, 2005) 146-165

Drude's book is considered fundamental for metallic materials.

Best regards,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Re: f2=1-2n
email_chain.body:
Hi Wim,

Thanks for the references. I've actually already consulted them, but I'm still looking for a clearer derivation that shows how the refractive index in the form d*n/d relates to the frequency, lambda, and amplitude.

Best regards,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: f2=1-2n
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

I understand your frustration, but I'm not aware of a clearer derivation than what's available in those sources. The relationship you're looking for is complex and the existing derivations tend to be rather dense. Perhaps someone else in the field might have a more accessible explanation.

Best regards,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Asset Transfer Agreement Review
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

I am writing regarding the pending asset transfer agreement between ABC and RBC Capital Markets. We would like to schedule a review of the proposed terms with our Board of Directors.

Kind regards,
Maria Flippo

email_chain.subject: Re: Asset Transfer Agreement Review
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

I appreciate your email dated December 14th. We are still analyzing our options and have reached no final conclusion. The timing of our acquisition of the remaining 15% is part of that analysis. In the meantime, the rest of our business remains as before and the Board of Directors of ABC will continue to oversee its management.

RBC Capital Markets
Jason McGroarty
(416) 842-6293

email_chain.subject: RE: Asset Transfer - Deposit Notice
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

I was copied on your email yesterday to Mr. Frank and Messrs. Calloway and Vaughn. Please be advised that pursuant to Section 14.4 of the Purchase Agreement dated November 4, 2004, we have placed certain assets that are subject to the asset transfer agreement in our depository at 15 York St., Toronto, to await return to ABC. These assets are detailed in the list attached to our email of December 14, 2004 (see attachment A). I assume these are the assets under your custody. Please advise if you have any objections to this deposit.

email_chain.subject: Re: Asset Transfer - Deposit Notice
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

Thank you for your email. While we have no objections to the list provided, it has not been previously reviewed by ABC's Board of Directors. The list appears to conflict with the Sale Agreement requirements, particularly regarding retention of files and ABC Confidential Information. Your proposal to place our assets in a depository pending return is inappropriate and contrary to the terms of the Sale Agreement, specifically Section 2.1(a).

email_chain.subject: Re: Asset Transfer Concerns
email_chain.body: I just spoke with Martin but I was copied on the email below. Today is December 17th, 2004 and we continue to have no approved and executed sale agreement. In the meantime, ABC is purging all of our assets and information, and sending same to various unidentified third parties and law firms. We simply cannot accept these proposals in light of ABC's wrongful purging of our assets. All of the discussion contained in your email is irrelevant in light of the purging. Please provide us with a confirmed list of all assets that have been sent to third parties and their names.

email_chain.subject: Re: Asset Transfer Concerns
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

You must withdraw any claim that ABC has breached the purchase agreement. You are not our trading partner; you are our custodian, holding assets that belong to ABC until such time as the transaction is closed.

email_chain.subject: Rotterdam-Naples Container Contract Review
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Gonzales,

Our team has been reviewing the contract for freight containers between Rotterdam and Naples for some weeks now.

Do you have any further business questions or suggestions to our market analysis?

Regards,
Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Rotterdam-Naples Container Contract Review
email_chain.body:
Morning Christa,

If I remember correctly, that contract included only containers shipped by steam ship, but I now know that steam ships have been phased out in favor of modern container ships.

I'd like to amend that contract to cover all types of modern container ships, with a specific expiration date.

Regards,
Hugo

email_chain.subject: Re: Rotterdam-Naples Container Contract Review
email_chain.body:
Hi Hugo,

I've found some documentation from the 1970s that shows there was still a significant number of containers transported by steam ship, despite being a less economical transportation method.

What do you think about this historical context?

Regards,
Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Rotterdam-Naples Container Contract Review
email_chain.body:
Hi Christa,

That is no doubt true. However, steam ships proved extremely dangerous for the containers, even the newest ones. The vibrations produced by the steam engines, and the leaks from the boilers, caused significant damage to most containers in transit. This is precisely why modern container ships have completely replaced them.

Regards,
Hugo

email_chain.subject: Programming Skills Assessment Questions
email_chain.body:
Dear Candidate,

As part of our technical assessment process, please respond to the following questions about your programming experience:

• How many software projects do you currently have under development?
• About how long have you been programming in Java?
• Have you developed any Java GUI applications?
• What IDE do you use to develop Java GUIs?
• Have you been involved in any multi-threaded programming projects?
• Have you developed any projects in C/C++?
• Which C/C++ IDE have you used?
• How many software projects have you completed in C/C++?
• What do you think about C/C++ versus Java?
• What are the things you like most about Java?
• What are the things you like most about C/C++?
• What do you think about Java GUIs?
• What do you think about C/C++ GUIs?

Please note that attachments should not exceed 20 MB.

Best regards,
HR Team

email_chain.subject: T-shirt Shipment Shanghai to Paris - Space and Rate Request
email_chain.body:

We are shipping 200CTNs of T-shirts from Shanghai to Paris. Do you have space this month and how soon can we get a price?

Regards,
Jean

email_chain.subject: Re: T-shirt Shipment Shanghai to Paris - Space and Rate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Jean,

Thank you for your email. I would like to ask you some information regarding your shipment of t-shirts:

1) What is the mark or brand of the t-shirts?
2) What type of t-shirt is it? Tank, tube, long sleeve, short sleeve?
3) Is the t-shirt knitted or woven? And what kind of knit or weave?
4) Does it have any decoration on it? What type of decoration?
5) What type of fabric is it? What is the denier, threads, and fiber count?
6) What is the weight of a t-shirt?
7) Do you want us to pay for the cost of freight, or do you want us to put it on your invoice?
8) How many items in one package?

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

Best regards,
Yue

Paul

email_chain.subject: Vessel Pilotage and Port Call Query - Gdynia to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Dear EUROTUG Operations,

I would like to inquire about the possibility of a same-day port call between Gdynia and Liverpool for an upcoming vessel operation. Additionally, could you please clarify the pilotage requirements and rates?

Regards,
Noa

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Pilotage and Port Call Query - Gdynia to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Dear Noa,

Thank you for your inquiry. Please note the following pilotage requirements:

- Mandatory pilot services for tankers at Sulzheim and Ettlingen
- Mandatory pilotage for vessels over certain draft at other Rhine terminals
- Mandatory for vessels without canal-certified ship masters

EUROTUG's minimum towage rates apply to short draft vessels, though rates may vary based on specific circumstances.

Regarding same-day operations between Gdynia and Liverpool, this would not be feasible due to the transit time required.

Please let us know if you need any additional information.

Best regards,
EUROTUG Operations

Our company has extensive experience in international forwarding, and we specialize in worldwide shipping operations.

We would be happy to handle your container shipment in Mexico. I will send you our price list shortly. Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions.

With kind regards,
Kaira

email_chain.body:

With kind regards,
Christophe

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Transport Request - Terminal Van Oord to Mexico City
email_chain.body:
Dear Christophe,

Thank you for reviewing our price list. I would like to highlight that we offer multiple daily sailings from both Vancouver (6+ sailings) and Los Angeles (daily departures) to Mexico.

Our pricing is highly competitive for all destinations, and we also provide express services at attractive rates.

We look forward to establishing a business partnership with you. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.

Kaira

email_chain.subject: Import Delivery Terms and Documentation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Pal,

Could you please advise if we can deliver your import under EXW terms?

If so, could you provide a copy of the bill of lading as soon as it is available, and make sure you've sent a pre-arrival notification of the cargo and owner's details, so that we can facilitate berth preparations and other documentation.

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery Terms and Documentation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

We can deliver your import cargo under EXW terms. While our suppliers can sell our product under CIF terms, our cargo is already loaded, and I believe our transportation cost under CIF may be higher than ex-works.

Regarding the B/L copy before arrival, could you confirm if this will be acceptable?

As for other documentation, we are not sure how to fill it in, as we only supply high technology components, and your export will be the final user.

Many thanks for your kind assistance.

Regards,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery Terms and Documentation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Terry,

We do require a copy of the bill of lading to be sent to us before arrival. As for the final user, we don't mind, but we will need the information on the final user on the bill of lading, and we would like to know the manufacturer of the products as well, which I will need you to provide us with.

Regards,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery Terms and Documentation Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

Thanks for your reply.

We are very sorry, but I am afraid we are unable to provide you with the final user information, because the purchase of our product is for internal use only.

As for the name of the manufacturer, we are afraid that we are not allowed to disclose such information due to confidentiality reasons.

We are very sorry that we cannot help you with these details.

Best Regards,
Terry

Wanjia

We understand that you will be arriving at the port in Shanghai later today, so in order to avoid any problems, could you please let us know the amount that you have been sent to cover our shipment?

Thank you in advance for your cooperation.

Warmly,
Jian Li

email_chain.subject: Re: Outstanding Payment for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body:

CFO

email_chain.body:

Isaac

email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. M.,

Mrs. Busra Öztürk

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Loading and Insurance Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lincoln,

I am pleased to confirm that we will be loading in Sharjah on 20th October. We hope to load 8,500 MT of crude oil. Our freight is at the rates you sent us.

We have purchased freight insurance and will need to insure our goods for shipping. The insurance cost will be 5 percent of the total cost. Could you please confirm whether your company can provide this insurance?

We have filled in and scanned the additional form requested by our insurers. Please also send a copy of your marine insurance policy to our insurers to confirm it covers our cargo.

We look forward to working with your company.

Kind regards,
Isaac

John

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Petroleum Coke Shipment Baku-Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer spot shipping at:

Rate: USD 0.19/MT + USD 0.05/MT bunker surcharge

Details:
- Charter party: GLS terms
- Cargo: Petroleum coke - 20,000 MT
- B/L: 100% prepaid
- Sailing: November 2023
- Route: Baku, Azerbaijan to Qingdao, China

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Internal Notes - Baku-Qingdao Charter
email_chain.body:
Internal strategy notes:

Presenting as open charter to make rate appear competitive. Actual arrangement is vessel rental. Quote structure (0.19 + 0.05) designed to create impression of separate bunker costs while maintaining total desired rate.

Keeping decimal precision vague to discourage detailed rate comparison.

Our supervisor in Seattle, Scott Jones, will be contacting you to discuss the situation further and will be issuing you a refund for the shipment.

We hope that you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Warm regards,
Loyalty Team
FedEx Express
7671 Roswell Rd. Bldg. A Suite 100
Atlanta, GA 30350

email_chain.subject: Re: RFQ - RME Shipment Fujairah to India
email_chain.body:
Dear Louis,

- FOB or CFR basis with vessel sailing on August 19th
- Payment terms: 100% T/T cash at sight to seller's account, or irrevocable L/C confirmed by prime ARA rated bank at 110% of CFR value

Susan

email_chain.body:
Mr. Vargas,

Please find attached a copy of the Terms of Sale as agreed in our discussion today. Please note that we will be shipping via ocean and have attached the applicable rates and fees.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Order Confirmation - Ethylene Glycol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Vargas,

We hereby confirm our appointment as your shipping agents and representatives for all shipping services. This includes handling of the 4,000 MT Ethylene glycol shipment from Houston to La Guaira. All products will be accompanied by an official certificate of analysis (COA).

Attached, please find our official confirmation of order and rates per our discussion this morning.

Thank you,
Lawrence Preece

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipment Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We need 7,600MT capacity for coal from Richards Bay to Maputo this weekend. Do you have an open slot?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Hi Adrian,

We have 7,000MT capacity and offer the following prices:

Price FCA: US$150.00 per MT
Price CIF: US$175.00 per MT

Terms and conditions:
- Subject to export LOI and Bill of Exchange (not negotiable)
- FCA price includes Ocean Freight
- Loading at RBCT
- Cargo packed in bags with tags
- Wheel barrows required for loading
- Payment terms: 100% 30 days net from loading at port

Please confirm if these rates are acceptable.

Regards,
Sheldon

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sheldon,

The cargo is ready to be loaded. Can you please provide us with your vessel details for loading in Richards Bay?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Adrian,

We will load your cargo on our vessel MV Ocean Carrier. Please note the following requirements:

• Bill of Lading required for booking and rate confirmation
• Cargo will be discharged in Mozambique at your nominated port berth
• Your representative is responsible for collection and delivery
• Payment via TT, 100% pre-paid upon receipt of original invoice based on actual consumption
• Additional costs for your account
• Container de-bagging at pre-determined location (to be agreed with nominated port)
• Port agent contact details will be provided
• Loading updates will be communicated

Regards,
Sheldon

email_chain.subject: Methanol Cargo Booking Request - Montevideo to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Lin,

I'd like to book a 4,500MT cargo of methanol from Montevideo to Rotterdam for the 8th. I know you mentioned in our previous email that you'd have space for us, can you confirm?

Kind regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Cargo Booking Request - Montevideo to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Thanks for getting back to me.

I checked with the charterer and we do not have availability for the 8th. Can you let me know the details on the cargo you would like to move?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Cargo Booking Request - Montevideo to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Michael,

We received your request and we are searching for an available freighter for your cargo of methanol.

We'll inform you when the ship we are interested in is available.

Hope to hear from you soon.

Kind regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Container Shipment to Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

I have a container to send to Vietnam, date of shipment 7th of February. Would it be possible for you to send me an offer by the 28th of January please?

Best regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment to Vietnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

Thank you very much for your offer, we have a deal and the freight will be confirmed through our usual trade financing bank.

Can you please provide me with a waybill number?

I look forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Vessel Arrival Status Update
email_chain.body:
Good morning Robert,

Just checking in to see how everything is going. Our vessel just arrived in port yesterday and has been off-hire since 2pm. We also hear that other vessels are being loaded in a first-come, first-served basis which may cause a delay in our ETA.

Please advise and let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Stefan

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Arrival Status Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Robert,

I understand our vessel is at berth 1 with an ETA for Friday. I've been trying to reach you earlier today without success. Would it be possible to have a phone call later today to discuss the situation?

Best regards,
Stefan

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Arrival Status Update
email_chain.body:
We will be going through security tonight at 22:00. I have the ETA as 06:30 on Thursday. We have been told that there will be a job and a blast if necessary. Please be sure to let us know so we can follow up with them. If you have any further information, please let us know.

Thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: GMS Status
email_chain.body:
Hello,

We have received our GMS and we are waiting for them to arrive. Could you please provide us with a time estimate of when they will arrive?

Best Regards,
Will

email_chain.subject: Cotton Shipment Quote Request - Huangpu to Ghent
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We'd like to transport 2,900MT of cotton to Ghent from Huangpu. Could you let us know your best available rate, and do you work on a FCA basis?

Thank you for your time,
Henry

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment Quote Request - Huangpu to Ghent
email_chain.body:
Dear Henry,

Thanks for your mail. I will try my best to find out the information from our cargo department.

Best regards,
Clark Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment Quote Request - Huangpu to Ghent
email_chain.body:
Dear Clark Chen,

Thank you for your response. Please feel free to check with any carrier. Given that we transport via containers rather than trucks, and our cargo requires special handling, carriers with empty sailings might be interested.

Let me know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Thank you!
Henry

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment Quote Request - Huangpu to Ghent
email_chain.body:
Dear Clark Chen,

Thanks for looking into this. To provide more context, we typically transport around 100,000 tons per shipment. Could you advise whether using carrier-owned containers or shipper-owned containers would be more advantageous?

Please let me know if you need any clarification.

Thanks for your time!
Henry

email_chain.subject: Cargo Space Request - Kaohsiung to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. An,

If you still have room on your 1st Apr laycan to Kaohsiung, can we load 5,000MT of blue crystalline sodium nitrate from Kaohsiung to Xiamen next week?

Regards,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Request - Kaohsiung to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Hi Phil,

Thank you for your e-mail. I cannot find the charter today, but you may confirm with me again on Wednesday.

Regards,
Jenny An

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Request - Kaohsiung to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Thanks Jenny! We appreciate it.

Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Request - Kaohsiung to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Hi Phil,

Just checked charter contract again. It is available for loading of your cargo.

Best regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Request - Kaohsiung to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the quick reply!

Can we have your voyage details so we can organize the delivery of our cargo? Also what is your departure date?

Regards,
Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Request - Kaohsiung to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Phil,

Please provide this information to me and I can forward to ship agents. Also, for your information, our vessel was calling in Kaohsiung 1st Apr and will load about 12,000 MT of blue crystalline sodium nitrate from Kaohsiung to Xiamen.

Best regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Sorghum Shipment Request - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dominic,

Please send a proposal to ship 5,000MT of sorghum from Abidjan to Rotterdam. The ETA should be within a month.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment Request - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I am very interested in your proposal. Please provide the following information:

1) The USD price of the sorghum
2) When the sorghum is available to be shipped from Abidjan to Rotterdam
3) The volume of the sorghum in cubic meters
4) The total amount in USD for handling, shipping, insurance, and other fees
5) The normal delivery time for shipping from Abidjan to Rotterdam

Regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment Request - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Andy,

Thank you for your inquiry. Here are the details:

1) USD $100 per MT
2) Available within 1 month
3) 5000 cubic meters
4) USD $100,000 total for all fees
5) Normal transit time is 20 days

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment Request - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Thank you for the information. I am very interested in proceeding with this business opportunity.

Regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment Request - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Andy,

Thank you for your interest. Please confirm the following:

1) Your understanding of the 20-day transit time to Rotterdam
2) Your credit status for this transaction
3) Please confirm your email: peter@hotmail.com
4) Please confirm your address: Queen 1003, Hangzhou City, China

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Fuel Oil Cargo Available - ARA Mid-April
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Brown,

I have 4,500 MT of fuel oil available from ARA. Do you have a vessel that is scheduled to load mid-April?

Thanks,
Michelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Fuel Oil Cargo Available - ARA Mid-April
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

I was recently forwarded your email. I have a vessel (MT EVROS V) that is scheduled to load in ARA mid-April, and I would like to inquire about your offer. What price are you offering?

Please let me know if this is something you are interested in.

Best regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Fuel Oil Cargo Available - ARA Mid-April
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

I am glad to hear that you are interested in our offer. My company is offering $3.20 per MT FOB for your vessel. Please let me know if you would like to accept our offer, and if you would like to proceed, I can send you a contract to formalize our agreement.

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Fuel Oil Cargo Available - ARA Mid-April
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

We would like to make you a better offer. What would you be willing to accept?

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Re: Fuel Oil Cargo Available - ARA Mid-April
email_chain.body:
Mr. Brown,

I hope you're doing well and have had a chance to review the new contract I sent you. I just wanted to reach out and see if you had any questions on it. Also, I wanted to confirm whether you are still interested in receiving fuel from us.

I look forward to hearing back from you soon!

Regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Susan,

We're reaching out to see if you could handle a 1000CTN container load from San Diego to Auckland, NZ. We anticipate this shipment will go on board a vessel by the end of this month. Our client requires that you use the 'GENTLE' special handling service during the entire voyage.

Would you be willing and able to do this? Can you also quote a freight rate and demurrage cost?

Regards,
Jeanette

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Kevin,

Our customer in Auckland, NZ has asked for a tender price for a container shipment from San Diego. This is for 1x40ft HC container of GPS tracking devices requiring 'GENTLE' handling. Could you please provide a quote?

Thank you,
Michael

email_chain.subject: FW: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Our company is handling a shipment of GPS tracker devices. One of our customers from San Diego, CA has asked for a quotation for the shipment of one 40ft container of their devices to Auckland, NZ. This load will require 'GENTLE' special handling.

Could you please email me a price?

Thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

This is to confirm our pricing for the shipment of 1 x 40 ft HC container for 1,000 cartons of GPS Trackers from the port of San Diego, California to the port of Auckland, New Zealand. The cargo will require the 'GENTLE' special handling service.

We would like to quote you an FOB rate of $1,250 per container and an L/C payment term. If you would like to further discuss this quote, please contact me at your convenience.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: RE: Liner Shipment From San Diego to Auckland, NZ
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

Thank you for your follow-up. I am pleased to say that we can offer a final price of $1,450 per container, including the special handling requirements.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Rice Shipment Quote Request - Vietnam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We would like to ship approximately 30,000MT of rice from Vietnam to Mombasa, with delivery required as soon as possible. The destination port has requested a lump sum delivery price.

Best regards,
Tina

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment Quote Request - Vietnam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your quote.

Some further information:

- The rice would be shipped over several months, but we require a fixed price for all shipments
- Loading ports should be either Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang, or Cai Mep (not Vung Tau)
- We anticipate starting loadings in September, with deliveries spread across subsequent months
- FOB terms preferred

Best regards,
Tina

email_chain.subject: Molybdenum Oxide Shipment Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Miguel,

We need to move 4,000MT of molybdenum oxide from New York to Guadalajara. Could you send me your best rates ASAP and please confirm if you offer a standard laycan, demurrage and dispatch?

Thanks,
Tracy

email_chain.subject: Re: Molybdenum Oxide Shipment - PO Attached
email_chain.body:
Hi Miguel,

As requested we have attached our Purchase Order. We are expecting a draft shortly.

Thanks,
Tracy

email_chain.subject: Re: Molybdenum Oxide Shipment - PO Attached
email_chain.body:
Hi Tracy,

Thanks for the Purchase Order. We will need a pre-booking fee of USD 15,000, refundable once we have executed the contract and to cover our expenses and your insurance. Your estimated delivery is March 14, 2017. We would be pleased to quote you our normal FOB laycan, demurrage and dispatch.

Kind regards,
Miguel

email_chain.subject: Re: Molybdenum Oxide Shipment - Freight Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Miguel,

Thanks for the info and for your invoice. We confirm that we would like to go with the market freight of USD 9,000 on FOB basis. Your invoice, including the commission of USD 15,000, will be sent to our bank today. Please note that we have been quoted an insurance of USD 500 by XYZ Insurance Company. Could you inform us whether you are using XYZ Insurance Company? We are informed that they are a reputable company but that they are paying out large claims in many cases.

Thanks,
Tracy

email_chain.subject: Re: Molybdenum Oxide Shipment - Insurance Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Tracy,

Thanks for your invoice. We will contact your bank on Friday regarding the draft. We confirm that we will use XYZ Insurance Company. We will send you the insurance documentation on Friday.

Kind regards,
Miguel

email_chain.subject: Insurance Statement
email_chain.body:
Dear Miguel,

We confirm receipt of the following insurance for shipment of 4,000MT of molybdenum oxide to be shipped from New York to Guadalajara.

1. All Risk Cargo Insurance - $9,000 premium
2. Airborne Container Loss - $1,000 premium

We also confirm that we will be liable for any additional insurance premium resulting from the non-advice of the dangerous goods declaration.

With regards,
The AM Line Ltd.

email_chain.subject: LNG Cargo Inquiry - Melbourne to Halifax
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Strauch,

It's time for our annual port visit to North American ports. What can you offer for 11,700MT of LNG from Melbourne to Halifax in early May?

Thanks,
Mckenzie

email_chain.subject: RE: Crude Oil Availability - Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hey there,

I'll be in Dubai next month and wanted to know if you're in the market for 35,000mt of crude oil on our shuttle tanker. Price is $26,400/mt.

Drop me a line if this interests you,

Best regards,
Conrad

email_chain.subject: RE: Port Loading Notice Requirement
email_chain.body:
Mr. Morgan,

No worries for the port. However, we need a two day notice before loading so we don't end up in a crunch.

Regards,
Mr. Stanley

email_chain.subject: Shipment from Jeddah - RO Query
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Carmona,

When can you expect your shipment to leave Jeddah? We'd like to arrange an RO for our bulk carrier.

Thank you,
Colleen

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment from Jeddah - RO Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Colleen,

When should we expect your goods to leave? At the moment, the container has not been shipped out from the yard. Kindly clarify.

Regards,
J. Carmona

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment from Jeddah - Status Update
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Can you please give me an update on the arrival of your shipment at the port of discharge?

Thank you,
Port Operations

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment from Jeddah - Status Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We expect to receive the goods from your port next week. Kindly let me know if there are any issues to take care of.

Best regards,
J. Carmona

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment from Jeddah - Container Status
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Carmona,

Is the container placed in a ready condition for shipment? Kindly confirm.

Best regards,
Colleen

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipment Inquiry - NY to London
email_chain.body:
Morning Mr. Smith,

I need 1500 m3 of crude oil transported from New York to London by August 1st. Could you please advise on your demurrage rate if we're 15 minutes late?

Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - NY to London
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Smith,

I'm working for American Fuel Corporation from New York and I need to arrange shipment of 250 m3 of crude oil starting July 25th. Could you please confirm your demurrage rate for one hour delay?

Regards,
Lisa

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - NY to London
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

Thanks for your email. Please fill in the following information:

Port of Loading: _________________________
Cargo Volume: 250 m3
Loading Date: July 25th
Discharge Port: London
Demurrage Rate (1 hour): _________________________

Regards,
Richard Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - NY to London
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

For your reference, the distance between New York and London by water is approximately 4550 miles. At an average speed of 100 miles per day, the journey will take about 64 hours. Therefore, any arrival after 65 hours would incur the demurrage rate.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Port Dues Query - Sodium Chloride Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Valued Partner,

We're looking to ship 700MT of sodium chloride from Guangzhou to Kuching on 1 December. Could you advise if you handle port dues under FOB terms, and do you accept telegraphic transfers?

Kind regards,
Faizal

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues Query - Sodium Chloride Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Faizal,

Yes, we can handle the port dues and we accept telegraphic transfers. We'll prepare a detailed quote for the port dues.

Regarding your other potential vessel, if you need the bill for settlement, please let us know your preferred date of issuance.

Best regards,
Operations Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues Query - Sodium Chloride Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Partner,

Thanks for your quick response. We'll advise the details once we receive the shipment's necessary documents, which we expect will be issued this week.

Kind regards,
Faizal

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues Query - Sodium Chloride Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Partner,

Please advise. We'd like to confirm the specific terms of your offer:

(i) Value of port dues
(ii) Payment method: Telegraphic transfer or ACH
(iii) Time of issuance of port dues invoice

Kind regards,
Faizal

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues Query - Sodium Chloride Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Partner,

We'd appreciate a prompt response as our next step is to decide whether to instruct you to handle port dues. Thanks.

Kind regards,
Faizal

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues Query - Sodium Chloride Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Partner,

Thank you for the follow-up. We'll get back to you with a final proposal shortly.

Best regards,
Operations Team

email_chain.subject: ECO MANGROVIA - CHARTERING - ETA & LAYCAN
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Yupaporn,

I'm just following up to see if there is any movement on ETA for MS Mangrovia, and an updated laycan window. I understand that there is a problem with a Cargotec crane in Busan, and wonder if it will affect your schedule for Mangrovia?

If not, I need the chartering activity date for this ship to proceed with FCL for the cargo and hire out charterer's agency.

Thanks for your help.

Letitia

email_chain.subject: Re: ECO MANGROVIA - CHARTERING - ETA & LAYCAN
email_chain.body:
Dear Letitia,

Thanks for your follow up.

I was told the laycan will be June 30th which is the same as MVB. The problem is at both ports but the previous schedule is for Ubon Ratchathani, Muang district Chiang Rai, and on July 10th Busan and Yangon with repositioning fees due to charterer. This vessel is sub chartered out to another charterer.

Yours sincerely,
Yupaporn

email_chain.subject: Re: Fw: ECO MANGROVIA - CHARTERING - ETA & LAYCAN
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your help. When can we expect the sailaway? The chartering date is today and I understand that a possible charterer will not be a problem for us. Let me know so I can inform the chartering party.

Yours sincerely,
Letitia

email_chain.subject: Taka Loading
email_chain.body: I saw that Chong of ABC Brokerage has emailed his updated laycan window. His vessel is slotting ahead of yours. Do you need the laycan before you inform the charterer?

email_chain.subject: Re: Fw: ECO MANGROVIA - CHARTERING - ETA & LAYCAN
email_chain.body:
Dear Letitia,

Our charterer charter the sub vessel Mangrovia out of Singapore. The 1st cargo delivery which is scheduled on the 5th of July will be delayed until the sailaway is secured.

Hope you will understand the situation.

Yours sincerely,
Pong

email_chain.subject: Silicon Cargo Shipment Request - Pipavav to Southampton
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robinson,

I wanted to inform you that we have just completed shipping 1,000MT of mercury from Singapore to Bahrain aboard the 'Magellan'. 

We now have a new requirement for transporting 12,000MT of silicon from Pipavav to Southampton on the vessel 'Fitzroy'. Would you be able to accommodate this shipment?

Kind regards,
Kirsten

email_chain.subject: Re: Silicon Cargo Shipment Request - Pipavav to Southampton
email_chain.body:
Dear Kirsten,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, we are currently engaged in Singapore until July 15th, and we have a scheduled stop in Dili en route to Pipavav. Would it be possible to accommodate your shipment at a later date?

Best wishes,
Sue

email_chain.subject: Re: Silicon Cargo Shipment Request - Pipavav to Southampton
email_chain.body:
Dear Sue,

Thank you for your response. The silicon cargo has now been redirected to Makassar. However, we anticipate having a new order from Mombasa in the near future. May we contact you then to discuss shipping arrangements?

Kind regards,
Stewart

email_chain.subject: Re: Silicon Cargo Shipment Request - Pipavav to Southampton
email_chain.body:
Dear Stewart,

As Sue mentioned, we are committed in Singapore until July 15th with a subsequent stop in Dili. Please do reach out to us regarding your Mombasa shipment when you have the details, and we'll be happy to discuss availability.

Best regards,
Taniwe

email_chain.subject: Kerosene Cargo Inquiry - Rotterdam to Las Palmas
email_chain.body:
Would you please check for availability and slots for 7,100MT of kerosene from Rotterdam to Las Palmas on Tuesday 15 September.

Many thanks,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Cargo Requirements
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

Regarding your LPG cargoes, please note the updated request:

2 x 10,000 MT of LPG (Ethane/Propane) from Bayonne or Western Med to Med-Med – Apr./May.

Please check and revert on availability.

Best regards,
Navtej

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Export Options
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

Thank you for your email regarding LNG export options. Please find our response below:

1. No charters are currently available for immediate deployment. However, we have one refueling LNG vessel (Lloyds Korean Register, NOTB, YB, ICE Classed) with following specifications:
- Capacity: 400,000 cbm
- TEU: 550 (20 feet)
- Draft: 11.2m

2. Charter inquiry details:
- Date: 2007-11-10
- Port 1: Houston
- Port 2: Suez
- Cargo: LNG Export
- Period: 2007-12-15 to 2008-01-15

3. Regarding barge filling:
Customer has requested a forward date for Wednesday, October 16th to commence filling, with full barge completion by Thursday morning, October 18th. They're seeking full rate and back charter options.

We will analyze both scenarios and provide recommendations.

Best regards,
Operations Team

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Coal Shipment Taiwan to Huizhou
email_chain.body:
Dear Rose,

We're looking for an open position for 11,000MT of thermal coal from Taiwan to Huizhou next month. Please let me know if your vessel is suitable, and also your best freight quote for that route.

Regards,
Jun

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Jun,

This is the confirmation email for your offer to us. We have received your invoice. Thanks for your support.

Best regards,
Kelvin

email_chain.subject: Thermal Coal Offer - Indonesia to Shekou
email_chain.body:
Dear Kelvin,

We have a 27,000 mt of thermal coal for late May shipment from Indonesia to Shekou. Do you want it? You are most welcome to come and visit our loading port if you want to check our loading condition. Our minimum package quantity is 27,000 mt.

Regards,
Vincent

email_chain.subject: Re: Thermal Coal Offer - Indonesia to Shekou
email_chain.body:
Hi Vincent,

How about 27,000 mt of 30,000 kcal thermal coal from Indonesia to Shekou with loading port: Kalimantan?

Best regards,
Kelvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Thermal Coal Offer - Indonesia to Shekou
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelvin,

There is still a high chance to complete the delivery due to favorable time factor (but there may be another 4 containers for you to accept) if we deliver the coal today.

Regards,
Vincent

email_chain.subject: Parcel delivery from Norway
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Matthews,

We have a situation regarding a parcel that was supposed to be shipped from the USA to Luton, but has somehow been routed through our facility in Norway. Our tracking system shows it was delivered today, but the client is inquiring about its whereabouts. Could you please confirm receipt and advise on next steps?

Best regards,
Wren Simpson
Global Delivery Services

email_chain.subject: **SECURITY WARNING** Re: Parcel delivery from Norway
email_chain.body:
SECURITY ALERT: Incoming email flagged for review
Sender verification: Failed
Delivery method: Rapid Mailer (Mandrill)
Attachment scan: Complete - No threats detected
Tracking number verified: Yes
Action required: Manual review completed

email_chain.subject: RE: Parcel delivery from Norway
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Thank you for your quick reply. We're quite confused about how our package ended up in Norway when it was supposed to be shipped directly from the USA to Luton.

Please advise on the next steps for collection.

Sincerely,
Joe Parr

email_chain.subject: Re: Parcel delivery from Norway

email_chain.subject: Cargo Space Query - Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body:
If possible, I'd like to ask a question about your voyage SMMACV2749. For 2,700MT of ammonium sulfate from Damietta to Koper, do you have capacity next week, and can we finalize a CP with minimal laycan buffer?

Thanks,
Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Query - Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body:
Dear Karen,

We have already had two communications regarding this matter, but we haven't received any formal proposal from you, despite offering our best C/P terms.

Regards,
Farid

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Query - Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body:
Dear Karen,

Please send your proposal as soon as possible, as we need to proceed with cargo loading next week. The exact vessel date will be confirmed by Monday.

Regards,
Farid

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Query - Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body:
Dear Farid,

Regarding the C/P from Damietta to Koper, I notice the rates are 3.25-3.70 points lower compared to Rotterdam-Damietta route. This creates a difference of $3.625-5.375 per day depending on grade. Since you're only willing to fix until next week rather than the full laycan period, I cannot proceed with any CP amendments at this time.

Regards,
Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Space Query - Voyage SMMACV2749
email_chain.body:
Dear Karen,

Thank you for your reply. Unfortunately, the market outlook isn't favorable. Ammonium sulfate prices decreased yesterday, although Ammonium Nitrate has seen significant increases.

Regards,
Farid

Best regards,
Adam
