email_chain.subject: Re: LDPE Shipment Rome-Tangier Query
email_chain.body: For Denmark shipment of Flour and Chutney: Quoted prices are USD 140 base rate plus freight surcharges and 40-180 cents per ton for backland transport.

email_chain.subject: Re: LDPE Shipment Rome-Tangier Query
email_chain.body: An interesting scientific question has come up regarding neural processing systems: Can we reverse engineer a functional brain on a small scale? We understand the basic process of visual perception through the lens and retina, and neural pathway signal processing. The question is whether we can synthesize these components to create a working organic brain with only the essential elements.

email_chain.subject: REQUEST FOR DEMURRAGE RATE
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I kindly request information regarding your demurrage rates for the period of 02/02/2015 to 08/02/2015 for the following vessel details:

Location: Suez Canal Area
Vessel Draft: 15.5m
Arrival Port: Bandar Mahshahr (400 KM from Tehran)
Estimated Arrival Time: Friday 06/02/2015

Please provide the applicable rates with navigation clearance requirements.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: RE: QUERY FOR DEMURRAGE DATE RATE
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Thank you for your inquiry. Please note that your request mentioned Bandar Abbas, while the vessel details indicate Bandar Mahshahr.

For reference, we have recorded the following details:

Date of Arrival: 8th February 2015
Position of Vessel: Offshore of Bandar Mahshahr, awaiting tug
Type of Vessel: 105,000 DWT Crude Oil Tanker
Draft of Vessel: 15.50 meters

Please note that no demurrage rates are applicable for vessels delayed while waiting for tug assistance.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: RE: QUERY FOR DEMURRAGE DATE RATE
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Regarding your response about demurrage rates at Bandar Mahshahr, Suez Canal area, we have been informed by the Iran Ministry of Maritime & Ports (Letter No. [redacted] dated 23/02/2015) that for vessels over 120,000 MT deadweight, when tugboat services fail to meet international standards, the local authority KOTTE is responsible for providing alternative services as per contract terms.

Best regards

email_chain.body:

I'm responding to your email regarding the oil products shipment. We would be happy to assist you with the transport requirements and here is our proposal for your review:

Product: Oil Products (7,000MT)
Delivery to port cost: $12,500
Storage transfer to dockside tanks: $8,750

Thank you,
Sarah Yim

email_chain.subject: Re: Oil Products Shipment - Transport Quote Request

Kevin

email_chain.subject: EVA Resin Shipment Query
email_chain.body:
Hey Nick,

We're trying to move 8,000MT of EVA resin from India to Turkey. Would you have the space? What's your freight rate?

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: EVA Resin Shipment Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Andreas,

8,000MT to Turkey isn't possible right now, but we do have space for 15,000MT to Taiwan. The freight rate would be around $10.50/MT, definitely not going above $11.

Regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: EVA Resin Shipment Query
email_chain.body:
Nick,

I've discovered that the Turkey and Taiwan customers are actually the same company's offices. There's a 10,000MT limit per office. Could we split the shipment between the two locations? Also, is there any flexibility on the freight rate to help us make a better offer?

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: EVA Resin Shipment Query
email_chain.body:
Nick,

Let's focus on Taiwan for now. The buyer there can actually only take 6,000MT. Would this smaller quantity help us get a better rate? Also, our shipper needs to know the specific port in Taiwan.

Best,
Andreas

4. Loading dates: 16th - 19th July, 2013

email_chain.subject: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry - Galveston to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Can your vessel load 4,000MT of corn oil from Galveston to Qingdao by the end of May? We are looking for an L/C T/C with an expiry of 15 days.

Best,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry - Galveston to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hi,

This vessel arrived at Qingdao at the end of the day on 16 May. It is ready for discharge and we are unable to arrange unloading before 19 May. We would appreciate if you could send an amended voyage estimate to our agent so we can approve it as soon as possible.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry - Galveston to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

Could you let me know your appointed agent in Qingdao please? We can contact them directly. Also, your intention of discharging on 19 May is not acceptable to us. A vessel lies idle for 10 days at Qingdao is unacceptable for us. If you can't start discharging before 18 May, we are looking for a counter-offer.

Thank you.

Best,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry - Galveston to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

We have appointed JPT as our agent in Qingdao. This is their contact information:

JPT International Co. Ltd.
Address: Block A, Room 802, No.10 DongHaiNan Road, Qingdao, 266061, P.R.China
Phone: 86-532-80780378/80780379
Fax: 86-532-80780380

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Oil Shipment Inquiry - Galveston to Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

We are concerned with the delay on loading by your charterer in Galveston. We suggest that your charterer completes loading before the vessel arrives in Qingdao. Otherwise, your charterer has to pay the vessel demurrage.

Our voyage estimate has already been prepared and is on its way to you. This is a copy of the voyage estimate for your reference.

Please also note that, according to your contract, the charterer is responsible for the costs of shifting between berths.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Brazilian Rice Export Opportunity

John

email_chain.subject: Re: Brazilian Rice Export Opportunity
email_chain.body:

Yusang

email_chain.subject: Rice Shipment Requirements
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hong,

I am glad to hear that you want to work with me.

Please find the following requirements:

- We need around 5 containers of rice in three shipments from one Brazilian company.
- I know we can't finish these at once. We need at least US $1.5 million in one week. We can do this repeatedly with larger amount.
- Please send me the price information before you go to bank.

Yusang Kim

email_chain.subject: Rate Request - Isopropanol Shipment Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:

Please provide a rate estimate for 4,800 MT of isopropanol from Houston to Cartagena. We'd like to get this to our factory for production as soon as possible. Do you do cargo insurance under DAP terms?

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Isopropanol Shipment Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:
Dear Jonas,

To clarify on my previous email, the 4,800 MT of isopropanol will be packed in 3x20' containers and 2x40' containers with a total capacity of 96 TEUs.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request - Isopropanol Shipment Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am sending you a quote for your review. We will require a 25% deposit to secure the space.

Once the space is secured, we will provide the details for your local bank to remit payment, as well as the full details of your cargo insurance and bill of lading requirements.

Our next step will be to have our operations department send you the cargo insurance declaration forms to initiate the insurance coverage process. Once the insurance has been set up, we will begin the shipment process and provide you with all necessary documentation.

Best regards,
Jonas

Technical Coordinator

Assistant to Sales

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Flour Shipment Query - Australia to Bangkok

Chartering Manager

Sincerely,
Zane Griffin
Assistant to Sales

email_chain.subject: Change in Account Management
email_chain.body:
Dear Felicia,

Please note that Dr. Alexander will be leaving our brokering firm at the end of the month. I will be taking over your account and would be happy to schedule a meeting to discuss ongoing matters.

Would you have any availability early next week?

Many thanks in advance and best regards,
Angela

email_chain.subject: Re: Change in Account Management
email_chain.body:
Hi Angela,

Thanks for your quick reply. We actually just recently set up a meeting with Patrick Winkelmayer. If I remember correctly, he's the one who showed strong interest in our portfolio.

I'm keen to understand his plans for future collaboration. I'm including his recent email correspondence below for your reference.

Best regards,
Felicia

email_chain.subject: Re: Spangler Proposal Review
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

I received the proposal from Paul Spangler's firm. As discussed, please find my comments below:

1) We would like to reduce the number of projects for which we plan to broker deals with you. This isn't due to concerns about your capabilities, but rather to start with a focused approach. The deal with the American electronics firm is our first priority.

2) Regarding the electronics deal, please consider accelerating the timeline. We've noticed American firms are increasingly looking to work with British firms to access their competitive tax rates. An earlier timeline would make us more attractive.

3) Regarding your quoted rate for the electronics firm deal...

email_chain.subject: Termination of Electronics Firm Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

I regret to inform you that we will not be proceeding with the electronics firm deal. Your negotiation approach is pushing the company beyond their current comfort zone and capabilities.

It was a pleasure working with you.

Sincerely,
Felicia

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Bauxite from Port Beni
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Brown,

We have a load of Bauxite coming out of Port Beni, Peru, approx. 40,000MT, FOB. Please advise your best freight estimate.

Sincerely,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Bauxite from Port Beni
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

I'm assuming you're with Sigi Sanaa Shipping Corp. If that is correct, your freight rates are as follows:

HK: USD2.20/MT
TZ: USD3.40/MT
SK: USD1.10/MT
CW: USD2.00/MT
RH: USD0.90/MT
JO: USD1.90/MT

As per Custom clearance, cargo will be delivered at sidong railway/terminal. Freight, customs and railway charges depending on load and transportation will be included at spot rate - subject to railway cooperation and availability of wagons.

This is a FREIGHT estimate. Let me know if you want an FOB-CIF estimate instead.

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Corn Starch Shipment Quote - Bangkok to Haiphong

Demurrage rate: $150.00 /day

Al

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Starch Shipment Quote - Bangkok to Haiphong
email_chain.body:
Dear Al,

Thank you for the quote. Following my mother's recent passing, I would like to make an advance payment of $15,000 for this shipment. My mother was a philanthropist, and this transaction would honor her memory.

Please provide your bank details for the transfer.

Best regards,
Zara

email_chain.subject: Re: Corn Starch Shipment Quote - Bangkok to Haiphong
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

What a thoughtful and kind person you are. I appreciate your desire to honor your mother's memory, and I admire her values.

Your advance payment is much appreciated, and I will use it to pay for the transportation costs. Please be assured that your shipment will be handled with utmost care and delivered promptly and safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to me. Looking forward to a long-lasting and fruitful business relationship with you.

Best regards,
Al

email_chain.subject: Change of Delivery Point - Bangkok to HCMC
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Zara

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Delivery Point - Bangkok to HCMC
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

We're having a hard time switching the delivery point. I've talked to the shipping line and their only solution is to send the shipment back to Bangkok so it can be shipped to the correct location. Unfortunately, the cost of this is very high, and I don't think it's a viable option for you.

Best regards,
Al

email_chain.subject: Re: Change of Delivery Point - Bangkok to HCMC
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

I've talked to the shipping line again, and they have agreed to make the necessary changes to the shipment so it can be delivered to Ho Chi Minh City instead of Haiphong. However, the cost of this change will be substantial.

Best regards,
Al

Jelena

Sincerely,
Harry

Jelena

email_chain.body:

Thanks,
Zoe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request - Ethanol Maceió/Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Zoe,

I just looked up prices for ethanol in Houston from Singapore, Brazil, and Egypt. They are all pretty much the same - only a 3 USD difference. In July, Brazil was cheaper, but now in August, Egypt is slightly cheaper, though that could change quickly.

I'm going to go with the MT readings as shown and work with a delivered price of 1 USD from Maceió. I need this information to estimate the gas requirements for profitability.

Thank you for all your help. You are a great addition to the company.

email_chain.subject: Cotton Shipment - Panama Canal Toll Query
email_chain.body:
Hey Sam,

We are interested in the second shipment of cotton under 50-ton container in direct sail from Santa Cruz to Newark. Will the new Charter Party apply the New Panama Canal toll?

Thanks,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Panama Canal Toll Query
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Where can I find this 'new Charter Party' you mention? I have the latest canal treaty with me, but it says nothing about a new C/P. Can you please clarify?

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Panama Canal Toll Query
email_chain.body:
Sam,

Please refer to the canal toll agreement here:
http://www.panamaxmaritime.com/AG/Panama%20Canal%20Tolls%20Agreement.pdf

The addendum discusses toll rates for container vessels. As per the Neutrality Treaty, the Panama Canal should operate equitably for all merchant vessels. The tolls should be consistent with established rates.

Best,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Panama Canal Toll Query
email_chain.body:
Ian,

I suspect we will need to hire a cargo lawyer. We should challenge this on grounds of discrimination. We could seek a legal opinion from the Secretary of State for Transport, or alternatively engage a private firm to challenge the canal authorities directly.

At minimum, we need clarification on their 'adjusted and equitable tolls' arrangement. However, I should mention that our principals are generally reluctant to engage in legal proceedings.

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Grain Shipment Inquiry - Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

I am enquiring as to your ability to transport grains from your Sydney port to ours in Seattle. We would want to use your containers to ship approximately 40,000 tons of grain.

Could you advise me of the approximate cost and timing of delivery. Could you also supply me with a copy of the relevant carriage conditions? Please also include a contact number, name and fax number.

Thank you.

Regards,
Jill

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Shipment Inquiry - Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms Slater,

Thank you for your enquiry on the transport of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

As requested, I have enclosed a schedule and conditions of carriage.

The estimated cost for the shipment of 40,000 tons from Sydney to Seattle is as follows:
Container service: $55,000.00
Insurance of goods: $25,000.00
Total: $80,000.00

For insurance purposes, we need a complete list of the goods to be shipped, together with their approximate value and precise quantity. The estimated time of arrival is 1 month from the date of departure.

We work with A Insurance, New York, for cargo insurance coverage.

If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Shipment Inquiry - Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms Slater,

I need to follow up regarding the grain shipment quote. We require additional details to provide a firm price:

1. Specific type of grains to be shipped
2. Approximate value of the cargo
3. Exact quantity confirmation

Once you provide these details, we will be able to give you a firm quote.

Regards,
Sally

Mary

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability - Qingdao to La Guaira Shipment
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Mary

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Dalian to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Good morning Peter,

It's been a while, how's everything going with you? I trust you're still doing well on the ship, and I hope there are no problems! I'm really excited for your plans for the new year. I heard that you're doing very well as the 2nd Officer on board your new vessel. Great work!

We're sourcing a 2,500 MT shipment of LPG from Dalian to Fujairah. Do you have a vessel available that's open in the next two weeks, and at what cost?

Kindly,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Dalian to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sarah!

Thanks for the email. We just came in from our shift, and we're happy to hear from you. Please accept our apologies for the delay.

We're doing well on board. How about you? I heard that you just took a new job, congratulations!

Regarding your inquiry, we have a vessel that's available from Dalian to Fujairah in two weeks. At what rate do you wish to move the cargo?

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Dalian to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Good morning Peter!

Thanks for the response, we're doing well on our end. How about yourself? I heard you just started a new job, congrats!

We're still looking into the rates for the cargo transport. Could you provide us with your availability and rate indication?

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Dalian to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sarah,

Thank you for the email. Sorry about the delay.

How are you doing? I heard that you're still looking for a new vessel to transport your cargo. Don't worry about it, we understand.

We're very open for business. We're actually available now if you can confirm your details by the end of the day.

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Dalian to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

We're really excited for the news!

Best regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Office Supply Relocation Quote Request - Boston to Antwerp

Alex

email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Ian

email_chain.body:

Alex

Can you help with a more competitive rate?

Regards,
Alex

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment Inquiry Manila-Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

The loading rate of rice from Manila to Qingdao can be around 65 to 70 USD/MT. Please note that the rate is rough for reference. There is no demurrage in our liner.

If you have any other questions, please feel free to let me know.

Sincerely,
Zou

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment Inquiry Manila-Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

According to the new regulation on rice import to China, the loading rate should be increased for rice from Manila to Qingdao. The loading rate can be around 80 USD/MT.

Please let me know your latest information.

Sincerely,
Zou

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment Inquiry Manila-Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hi Zou,

We already bought a shipment from Nantong. But, we need one more shipment. The cargo will be loaded in Qingdao in June. Can you tell me whether you can provide this service?

I hope you can send me a quotation asap.

Thanks,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment Inquiry Manila-Qingdao
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Thanks for your information. The rate is as follows:

Qingdao: 65 USD/MT (with demurrage)
Qingdao: 80 USD/MT (without demurrage)

Sincerely,
Zou

email_chain.subject: HFO Cargo Schedule Request - Feb-March Discharge
email_chain.body:

Leo

email_chain.subject: Re: HFO Cargo Schedule Request - Feb-March Discharge
email_chain.body:
Dear Leo,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the HFO cargo. I understand you're interested in our commission structure for different pricing scenarios.

To clarify: for buyers accepting the 0.5% price discount, we can offer a 5% commission rate instead of the standard 7%.

Please let me know if you need any additional information to help secure the buyer.

Best regards,
Jin

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Iron Ore Transport Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Chen,

We have urgent need for a vessel, 50,000dwt size, with good dry-bulk and/or ore carrier experience for transportation of between 20,000 and 25,000 MT of iron ore from Dampier to Yuan Island.

Please confirm your vessel's availability, draft and size, and also availability of existing ballast water. When can you have your vessel at sea, and does it accept 'dumping' of cargo in the event of strike?

We would be most grateful if you could provide a detailed specification of your vessel, including crew, safety records, and insurance policy information, by 7th August.

We will contact you regarding further details after this date.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Iron Ore Transport Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vernon,

Thank you for your enquiry.

We are pleased to inform you that we have an 87,000dwt ocean-going ore carrier on our register. The vessel is 12 years old and has passed rigorous safety inspections. She has been chartered to an oil company for the past 3 months and is now available from 15th August.

In the event of a strike, the vessel has the capability of 'dumping' her cargo.

We would be most grateful if you would advise the load port, discharge port, estimated cargo quantity, loading time, and estimated number of loading/discharging crew.

Yours faithfully,
Jin Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Iron Ore Transport Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

Thank you for your swift reply.

With your permission, I enclose an outline of the proposed charter, which covers the period 10th September to 31st October 2011. In addition, I enclose a Letter of Inquiry, which we have requested from Dampier Iron Ore and from Port Walling.

I would be grateful if you would check these and advise on any corrections that you require.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Iron Ore Transport Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Richard,

I have reviewed your letter, and I confirm that our vessel will be ready at sea by 15th August, so your preferred dates are acceptable.

With regard to the charter, the only changes that I require are the amounts and unit prices for port, light, and insurance; and the percentage of each these that are to be deducted from the charter.

I trust that these amendments will be acceptable to you. I will revert with confirmation and insurance policy documents once we have both agreed on the terms.

Yours faithfully,
Jin Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Iron Ore Transport Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

The amendments to the charter agreement are acceptable to me. I enclose a signed copy of the charter agreement, together with a draft insurance policy.

I would be most grateful if you could confirm that the vessel is ready for loading by 17th August.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Jones,

We are looking to ship 1,100MT of shoes from Rotterdam to Boston. Can you confirm your earliest available sail date, and can you let me know if you have a regular schedule?

Kind regards,
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Anne,

We would be happy to help with your shipment. Our regular weekly sailing is on the 23rd of the month. This shipment will sail on the 25th of March. Please confirm your delivery address and let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

Yes, I think that works for us. The final destination for the goods will be Boston, MA. We will be clearing the goods through Port Newark, NJ.

Thank you for your help!
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

I'm following up about the shipping to Boston, MA. I spoke with our customs broker who said they will need to ship from NJ. Can you let me know if that will be a problem?

Thanks,
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

NJ is not a problem. The vessel leaves from Rotterdam, then stops in Houston and NJ, before going to Boston. The final destination for the cargo is Boston, and you will clear the cargo in Boston, so that is fine.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Anne,

The carrier for this shipment will be ZIM Lines. They will export from Rotterdam, and stop in Houston, before sailing to Boston. All shipments are delivered FCA (Free Carrier). This means the carrier will deliver the cargo at their warehouse in Rotterdam, from where you will be responsible for paying for the cargo and the customs duties. You will also be responsible for unloading the cargo, or arranging for that to be done.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Regards,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: Shoe Shipment Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Anne,

Can you please let me know if you have any questions about our quote? We've already run out of our weekly quota, so we will have to sell your cargo at market price.

Regards,
Don

Also, I will need more than the 30,000 bags of styrene to bring to Surabaya - can you offer any more at the same price?

Kind Regards,
Celeste

email_chain.subject: Meeting Today - Styrene + Benzoate Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hi Ryan,

Looking forward to our meeting today to discuss styrene + benzoate between Singapore and Surabaya! Also looking forward to our next meeting this Thursday to discuss the methacrylates trade.

Best regards,
Celeste

email_chain.subject: Turkish Hazelnuts Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Is there a minimum guaranteed quantity of 15,000MT of Turkish hazelnuts, picked in 2020, that you can supply in October? We need to load it to Hong Kong.

Regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Re: Turkish Hazelnuts Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Marina,

How much price would you offer for containerized Turkish hazelnuts?

Thanks,
Grace

email_chain.subject: URGENT - HAZELNUT
email_chain.body:
Dear Marc,

We'd like to discuss in detail about hazelnuts in large quantities. The purpose is to sell directly to factories in China. This email is for urgent contact as you might know that hazelnuts are running short in Turkey.

Please reply at your earliest convenience.

Very Respectfully,
William

email_chain.subject: Introduction - Nuts Trading Partnership
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

I would like to introduce you to our business partner for nuts and dried fruits in China. As you probably know, we buy your hazelnuts, walnuts and almonds in Turkish supply and then we export them to China, for our business partner.

From the market side, we do a lot of sales with their clients. As a result, we are very interested in establishing a direct relationship with your company. When we have products, we could share the direct deal with you, for the price, quantity and time to be determined.

From now on, for future quotations, please send them to me directly. If you have any questions, please contact me at any time.

Kind Regards,
Emine

email_chain.subject: Re: Price Information
email_chain.body:
Hello,

As soon as I get the information about the price, I'll let you know.

Best Regards,
Emine

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment to Yanbu - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hey Aziz,

Our vessel is scheduled to discharge 11,000MT of methanol in Saudi Arabia. Your FOB looks promising, do you accept CIF as well? Also, are there any charges for net tankering?

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Yanbu - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Abe!

Greetings from the sea. Our agent in Saudi will do a lift-booking and transport methanol from Red Sea to Yanbu. In addition to your FOB price, do you foresee any additional costs such as bunker charges?

Our priority is safety of the cargo. However, in the unlikely case of any spillage, our liability will be limited to cleaning cost only. Can we discuss?

Yours,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Yanbu - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Aziz!

Thank you for your swift response. However, the transit time from Red Sea to Yanbu by road is 3 days and this has added to our costs considerably. We would like to work out a compromise to ensure that this cargo reaches Yanbu in the minimum possible time.

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Yanbu - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Abe!

I have attached a CIF quote.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Yanbu - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you Aziz, but we prefer FOB.

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment to Yanbu - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
We are also open to FOB.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on accounts payable?
email_chain.body:

The shipment of coffee beans you ordered from Mexico was supposed to arrive at your store in mid-October. It has been several weeks now and we have not received payment. Could you please confirm receipt of the shipment and advise when we can expect payment?

We look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Regards,
Tim Garson

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on accounts payable?
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Yes, we received the shipment of coffee beans from Mexico. We have already processed the payment and the invoice has been recorded in our system. I apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

Sincerely,
Owen Vincent

email_chain.subject: Scrap Metal Shipment - Zeebrugge to Rotterdam

Thanks,
Sherry

email_chain.subject: Re: Scrap Metal Shipment - Zeebrugge to Rotterdam
email_chain.body: I forgot to mention in my previous email, it's Russian material that we need to ship.

email_chain.subject: Re: Scrap Metal Shipment - Zeebrugge to Rotterdam
email_chain.body: Do you have vessels in mind that could fit this quantity? (25,000MT)

email_chain.subject: Re: Scrap Metal Shipment - Zeebrugge to Rotterdam
email_chain.body: Thanks for your response. Yes, I've already found carriers who have the Russian language skills to handle this deal. I'm just trying to price out the shipping and what it's going to take to get the demurrage under $10k. Will update you once I have more details.

email_chain.subject: Re: Scrap Metal Shipment - Zeebrugge to Rotterdam
email_chain.body: I'm not sure of the specification of the material that you want to be shipped. I'm guessing it's a high-density product that won't require much space to contain. In this case, the charges should be low. 25,000 MT isn't really that much for a vessel. Please provide material specifications so we can better assist you.

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

We'd need to charter 35,000MT of iron ore from Korea to China. Could you confirm if your vessel can carry the required weight?

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Sorry for the late reply. Yes, we can carry 35,000MT of ore from Korea to China. We have a team ready to charter a vessel. Please share with us the details of the cargo specifications so we can proceed with the charter arrangements.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

The vessel specifications are as follows:
Length: 164 meters
Width: 27 meters
Height: 11 meters
Cargo capacity: 7,000MT

Additional details:
- Vessel was built in 1995
- It has been used for shipping raw materials
- It has 6 layers, which are lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

I have a question about the vessel. Can you tell me if there are any modifications that have been made to the vessel after it was first built in 1995?

Thanks,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Yes, there have been some modifications made to the vessel since 1995. In 2010, a new engine was installed which increased the cargo capacity to 7,000MT and improved efficiency. In 2017, the six layers were lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy, improving cargo protection and durability.

We're ready to charter the vessel for 10 days from September 5 to 14 for the iron ore shipment from Korea to China. Our team is available to discuss charter terms and address any questions.

Regards,
Scott

VOH Global Cargo Management, Dublin

We are still waiting for confirmation of October 18th for our collection in Newark, NJ. We would need a reply from you to let us know if that is OK or not.

Sam

email_chain.subject: Maersk confirms opening of new Singapore-Yantian-Busan-Vladivostok service

YM - Yantian Wednesday (port stay two days)
YB - Yantian Thursday (port stay two days)
YS - Yantian Saturday (port stay two days)
YV - Yantian Monday (port stay two days)

Detailed schedule to Busan and Vladivostok will follow.

Best regards

YM - dep Yantian Wed 24/5 ETA Busan 31/5 ETA Vladivostok 05/06
YB - dep Yantian Thu 25/5 ETA Busan 01/6 ETA Vladivostok 05/06

email_chain.body:

Our current rates (including all charges) for the carriage of fuel in bulk to main European ports are as follows:

Murmansk Port, Russia to:
- Hamburg, Germany
- Rotterdam, Netherlands
- Le Havre, France
- Antwerp, Belgium

Rates:
- 3,500 MT up to 5,000 MT on 23,000 DWT tankers: €280 per metric ton
- 6,001 to 12,000 MT on tankers up to 34,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton
- 12,001 to 16,000 MT on tankers up to 50,000 DWT: €260 per metric ton

Best regards,
Bryan

- 2,001 - 10,000 MT on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €218 per metric ton

email_chain.subject: Appreciation for Market Coverage
email_chain.body: You guys are like the backbone of this market. I'm really impressed with your trading analysis and commentary. Your insights have been invaluable for my trading decisions.

email_chain.subject: Re: Permission to Share Analysis
email_chain.body: Would you mind if I shared some of your market analyses with a few colleagues in NYC and London? Your insights are exactly what they've been looking for. I'll ensure it's just direct sharing, no mass distribution.

email_chain.subject: Thank You for Quality Content
email_chain.body:
I just wanted to let you know how happy I am that I found your service. Now I don't have to scour the web to find solid stories, analysis, and humor. Your commentaries help me focus on the markets and do my own research.

I just wanted to tell you how much I appreciate your hard work.

email_chain.subject: Great Community
email_chain.body: I just wanted to let you know that you guys have the best readers around. The community engagement and discussion following each analysis adds tremendous value to your already excellent content.

Recent market activity:
- 2865 for 6000mt (Oct 5)
- 2855 for 5500mt (Oct 8)
- 2850 for 6000mt (Oct 10)
- 2860 for 5800mt (Oct 12)
- 2870 for 6000mt (Oct 14)

As these deals were made well in time, we believe the market is on the rise. We would like to confirm our offer at 2770.

Please confirm if you are agreeable to our offer. If we don't hear from you, we will assume your acceptance.

Regards,
Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Re: FERT Price Update and Offer
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the update,

In reference to our email regarding your offer of 2770:

You confirmed to us that your sales team confirmed the deals in place were between 2845 to 2870 for the 1st of November delivery. Yet you are demanding we confirm your offer of 2770.

I am not sure why this is so, but it is clear the market price is closer to 2870. At this point, we would rather make our arrangements for 1st of Nov delivery when we know the market has risen, rather than when it is sitting at its low.

Please advise what exactly you expect from us.

Sincerely,
Zohair

email_chain.subject: Re: FERT Price Update and Offer

email_chain.subject: Port Operation Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Mr. Liang,

I am writing to inquire about your port's operational status. Could you please confirm if your port is currently accepting vessels? I would also appreciate information about any available terminal facilities and if you have local shipping agents we could work with.

Additionally, could you provide details about tanker berthing capabilities and local transportation infrastructure?

Thank you for your time,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Operation Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for your inquiry. While our port is technically open for business, we are still in the development phase. Currently, we are utilizing foreign shipping agents as our harbor infrastructure is not fully operational. We expect to complete the development and have our own local shipping operations established by the end of this year.

I would be happy to keep you updated on our progress.

Best regards,
Ron Liang

email_chain.subject: Reaching out after 6 years
email_chain.body:
Hey Mom,

It's been 6 years since we saw each other. Are you still in Hong Kong? I am now a captain in the army. I can't believe how fast the time has gone by.

Best regards,
Jun

email_chain.subject: Re: Reaching out after 6 years
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Yang,

I was glad to get your email. Yes, I am still in Hong Kong, but I will be moving to Beijing soon. Please don't worry. I am very well, and I hope you are as well. Now you can tell me about your life. Where are you stationed? And where are your wife and children? How old are they?

Love,
Mom

email_chain.subject: Re: Reaching out after 6 years
email_chain.body:
Hi Mom,

I am glad that you are still doing well. My family is fine. My children are getting bigger. My oldest is almost 6 years old, and my youngest is 4. I will have to wait a little longer until I can send you pictures of them. I am stationed near Guangzhou. My wife and I don't see each other very often, so I guess you could say that we are basically divorced.

Take care,
Jun

2. ONORE (MSC IMAGO)
- Commodity: Mixed Cargo
- Reefer Space: 3000 sqm / 12000 cbm
- Reefer Temp: +25°C

3. ABACUS (Hyundai Samurai)
- Commodity: Bulk
- No reefer capacity

4. BIRGIT (Tore II)
- Commodity: General Cargo
- Reefer Space: 1000 sqm / 5000 cbm
- Reefer Temp: -25°C

5. AKIRA (MSC IMAGO)
- Commodity: General Cargo

Please advise if you need any additional information.

email_chain.subject: Sugar Vessel Inquiry - Nouakchott to Kotka
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bayuk,

I'm seeking a vessel for 9,600MT of sugar from Nouakchott to Kotka. Could you advise me if your vessel is available at the end of September, and if so, what your laytime terms would be?

Thank you,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Vessel Inquiry - Nouakchott to Kotka
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Regarding your Kotka sugar inquiry, I must inform you that we cannot accommodate a late September loading. The vessel must be in Nouakchott no later than August 25th due to port scheduling constraints.

Kind regards,
Alasdair

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Vessel Inquiry - Nouakchott to Kotka
email_chain.body:
Dear Alasdair,

1. Could you please confirm your current vessel position?
2. If loading can commence before August 25th, please indicate, as we are still arranging vessel options.
3. What is your estimated loading duration?

Best regards,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Vessel Inquiry - Nouakchott to Kotka
email_chain.body:
Dear Kelly,

1. To be clear, we cannot commence any sugar movements after August 25th. Your vessel must arrive before this date.
2. Please confirm your vessel nomination before August 25th, or you will need to arrange an alternative loading port.

Best regards,
Alasdair

email_chain.subject: Chemical Inc. Acquisition Rumors & Naphtha Report
email_chain.body:
Bob,

I am intrigued by the media reports that you are a potential buy for Chemical Inc. Do you have any comments on this story?

Would also appreciate you forwarding me your internal report on the market impact of U.S. falling naphtha prices.

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Inc. Acquisition Rumors & Naphtha Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Martin,

This has to be a joke. I don't know of any report that Chemical Inc. is a target for acquisition.

Regards,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Inc. Acquisition Rumors & Naphtha Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

No joke here, I just read in the news that 'Chemical Inc. is reviewing its strategic alternatives'. Does this mean they are thinking of buying you?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Inc. Acquisition Rumors & Naphtha Report
email_chain.body:
No worries Martin,

We are watching the market closely. The naphtha market is hard to predict. We are all at the mercy of the OPEC production decisions. The question we are facing is whether we should buy long term or short term, or maybe even store. Which one is your thinking on this?

Cheers,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Inc. Acquisition Rumors & Naphtha Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

I am an external consultant for Chemical Inc. I am currently preparing a report on the impact of naphtha price movements and I would appreciate your comments on this. You can reply via email or phone me direct at (123) 456 789 and I will share it with my colleagues at Chemical Inc.

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Inc. Acquisition Rumors & Naphtha Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

I have managed to get a draft copy of the report by the Chemical Inc. consultant on the naphtha market. I understand that this is a confidential document. Can you confirm that this is the case?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Palm Oil Shipment Inquiry - Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
I'm interested in moving 5,000 tons of palm oil from Bintulu to Tocumen (Panama). Freight and laycan is negotiable, so please respond with an offer.

Best,
Monet

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment Inquiry - Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
Dear Monet,

My name is Olga, Director of International Trade at Colombia Export Co. We are one of the largest palm oil exporters in Colombia, and I'm writing to propose acting as your agent for the delivery of 5000 tons of palm oil from Colombia to Tocumen (Panama).

If you're interested in collaboration, we can establish an agency agreement and commence export-import operations immediately. Could you please indicate your standard agency commission rates for such shipments?

Best regards,
Olga

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment Inquiry - Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
Dear Monet,

I am Colibri, Operations Manager at Colombia Export Co. I'm following up on Olga's email regarding the agency arrangement for 5000 tons of palm oil to Tocumen.

We are prepared to offer a commission of $5 per ton. I can arrange a video conference to discuss the agreement details and begin operations promptly.

Looking forward to your reply,
Colibri

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment Inquiry - Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
Hi Monet,

We have a more cost-effective solution for the palm oil shipment to Panama. Our company has over 100,000 tons of palm oil available in Bintulu, and we can supply the 5,000 tons you need plus additional volume.

We offer $1 per ton commission, meaning if you can secure $9.95 per ton, your earning would be $4.95 per ton.

Please let me know if this interests you.

Regards,
Ivan

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability Query - Casablanca Discharge

email_chain.subject: January Loading Schedule - Forecast Request
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Empty Container Purchase Inquiry - Aqaba to Tripoli
email_chain.body:
Good day Hong,

Thanks for your offer of buying empty containers from us. Our containers are in Aqaba and our port of discharge is Tripoli. We believe the following offer will be of interest to you:

2,000 x 20ft reefer - Free of Cost

Please advise if the offer above is still available.

Thank you.

Regards,
Ms. Banks
HNB International LLC

email_chain.subject: Re: Empty Container Purchase Inquiry - Aqaba to Tripoli
email_chain.body:
Good morning Ms Banks,

Thanks for your email and inquiry. I have a few questions before proceeding:

1. Are you a trading house or a trading firm?
2. Have you ever traded with gulf region before?
3. Have you ever bought containers from Middle East?

If you are serious about this business, I can invite you to become an agent of HNB International, LLC. As an agent, you will be reselling our products in your country, and we will be buying back from you for further reselling to your local customers or for re-exportation.

All you need to do is to get your local bank to open an account, and we will be able to process your purchase order. I will be glad to process all the documents on your behalf to get the transaction started.

Please provide the requested information, and I will forward you the contract.

Best regards,
Hong

email_chain.subject: IT Equipment Transport Stockholm-Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mjönes,

We have two pallets of IT equipment that need to be moved from Stockholm to Oslo ASAP. The value of the goods is between $40,000 and $50,000. Could you arrange pickup in Stockholm on Monday and delivery in Oslo before Friday?

We look forward to working with you on this project.

Sincerely,
Ulf

email_chain.subject: Re: IT Equipment Transport Stockholm-Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our client needs to pick up the goods on Monday, but they want to ship the goods the same day. They want to have them delivered in Oslo by Thursday morning.

I hope this is not a problem for you. We need to confirm that this is possible by this evening.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: IT Equipment Transport Stockholm-Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mjönes,

Yes, we can deliver the goods on Monday morning. We can pick them up at your office in Stockholm this afternoon.

You may not need this, but our client also requires a clean bill of lading.

Let us know if this meets your needs.

Sincerely,
Ulf Vikman

email_chain.subject: Re: IT Equipment Transport Stockholm-Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

My colleagues and I just reviewed the bill of lading. We noticed that it was missing our address. We need to make sure that the address on the bill of lading is correct.

Can you check it and make sure it is correct?

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: IT Equipment Transport Stockholm-Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

Thank you for your help. I spoke to my colleagues and we all agree that the address on the bill of lading looks right. Can you please check your end and make sure that the address matches your files?

Let me know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes
